loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона 32-летняя замужняя женщина. У нее трое дочерей, которым с двух по шесть лет. Она живет со своей семьей в городе Исфара. Ее муж в данный момент находится на заработках в России. Сама Фарзона тоже трудится и зарабатывает на жизнь. Она умелая швея. У Фарзоны богатый опыт. Ее стаж работы в этой области составляет более 10 лет. Фарзона берет заказы на шитье женских национальных платьев, фасоны для платьев она придумывает сама. Ее клиентки всегда остаются довольными ее работой. Сейчас Фарзона хочет расширить свое швейное дело. Она просит кредит, чтобы приобрести новую модернизированную вышивальную машинку. С помощью новой машинки процесс ее работы ускорится и она сможет брать больше заказов, что увеличит количество ее клиенток. Фарзона надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
Farzona is a 32 years old, married woman. She had three daughters, who are between two and six years old. She lives with her family in the city of Isfara. Her husband is currently a migrant worker in Russia. Farzona also works hard and earns money for living. She is a skilled seamstress.

Farzona has a rich experience. Her work experience in this area is of more than 10 years. Farzona takes orders to sew women's national dresses. She invents the dress styles herself. Her customers are always pleased with her work.

Currently, Farzona would like to expand her sewing business. She requests a loan in order to purchase a new, modern embroidery machine. With the help of the new machine, she will work faster and be able to take more orders and increase the number of customers. Farzona hopes for support.

loans.use: to purchase a new, modern embroidery machine to expand her sewing business

loans.name: Ulsuluv

texts.ru:
Улсулуву 61 год. Она уроженка района Гиссар. Она вдова и мать пятерых детей. Улсулув вырастила своих детей честными, воспитанными, вежливыми и уважающие взрослых. Трое старших детей заведены семьями, младшие живут с ней и помогают. Улсулув не чувствует потери мужа ведь с ней ее дети они самое главное.
  Улсусув считает, что она еще не старая и сама может обеспечивать себя. 61 летняя Улсулув решила начать новую деятельность. Она хочет работать в сфере торговли. Услулув арендовала прилавку на рынке и на сумму от кредита намерена купить первый товар. Она будет заниматься продажей фисташек. Для нее это не только способ заработки, но и общение с новыми людьми и другими продавцами, коллегами. Для нее Ваша помощь очень важно. Она нуждается в поддержке.
texts.en:
Ulsuluv is 61 years old. She is a native of the Gissar region. She is a widow and the mother of five children. Ulsuluv raised her children to be honest, well mannered, polite and respectful adults. Her three eldest children have started families, the youngest live with her and help her. Ulsuluv no longer feels the loss of her husband because her children are the most important to her.

Ulsuluv thinks that she is not yet old and that she is able to support her family herself. The 61 year old Ulsuluv decided to start a new business. She would like to work in retail. Ulsuluv rented a stall at the market, and for the loan amount she intends to purchase her first goods. She will sell pistachio nuts. For her this is not only a way to earn money, but also to get to know new people and other sales people and colleagues. To her, your help is very important. She hopes for support.

loans.use: to purchase pistachio nuts for selling

loans.name: Abdukholik

texts.ru: Абдухолик 20-летний юноша, проживающий в городе Исфара.  Он холост и живет с отцом, дедушкой и братьями. Абдухолик низкого роста и выглядит моложе своего возраста. После окончания школы Абдухолик начал свой бизнес. Он стал заниматься животноводством и уже два года как он в этом бизнесе. Ему нравится разводить коров и бычков на природе. Бизнес ему приносит не только доход, но и удовольствие. Абдухолик сейчас собирается увеличить поголовье скота и с такой целью обратился за кредитом. Он хочет приобрести пару молодых бычков для дальнейшего откорма и продажи. Абдухолик за счет дохода с бизнеса помогает отцу обеспечивать семью. Он очень надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Abdukholik is a 20 year-old young man, living in the city of Isfara.  He is single and lives with his father, grandfather and brothers.  Abdukholik is short and looks younger than he actually is.  Abdukholik started his own business after finishing school.  He got involved in animal husbandry and has been in this business for two years now.  He likes to raise cows and bulls out in nature.  The business brings him not only an income, but also satisfaction.  Abdukholik is now planning to increasing livestock headcount and requested this loan to achieve this goal.  He wants to buy a couple of young bulls for fattening up and resale.  Abdukholik helps his father to support the family with the business income.  He hopes very much for support.

loans.use: to buy a couple of young bulls in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru:
Этого 29-летнего жителя города Конибодом зовут Дилшод. Он семейный человек. У него жена и две дочки. Дочерям 4 и 2 года. Жена не работает, она следит за детьми и ведет домашнее хозяйство. В связи с этим все семейные расходы несет Дилшод. Он глава этой семьи и единственный кормилец. 
Чтобы обеспечивать свою семью Дилшод занимается двумя делом. Он рядом с домом имеет лавку, где продает продукты питания и хозяйственные товары. К тому же последние два года он занимается животноводством. Дилшод ответственный и трудолюбивый человек. Он хочет увеличить поголовье скота в своем скотном дворе, а также увеличить товарооборот в своей лавке. С такими целями Дилшод запрашивает кредит, на сумму которого он хочет закупить партию хозяйственного товара и продуктов питания, а также на остальную сумму приобрести двух голов бычков. Этот кредит ему очень важен.
texts.en:
This 29 year old resident of the city of Konibodom is called Dilshod. He is a family man. He has a wife and two daughters. The daughters are 4 and 2 years old. His wife does not work, she looks after the children and manages the household. Therefore, Dilshod carries all family expenses. He is the head of the family and the only breadwinner.

In order to support his family, Dilshod has two businesses. Next to his house he has a store, where he sells food products and household goods. In addition he has worked with livestock breeding for the last two years.

Dilshod is a responsible and hardworking man. He would like to increase the number of livestock in his stockyard, and also increase the turnover from his store. With this aim Dilshod requests a loan. He would like to purchase household goods and food products for the loan amount, and also to use the remaining amount to purchase two bull-calves. This loan is very important to him.

loans.use: to purchase food products, household goods and also to purchase two bull-calves for livestock breeding

loans.name: Kulumbu

texts.ru: Кулумбу 52 года, вдова, воспитывает 2 сыновей. После смерти супруга, Кулумбу очень долго не могла пережить утрату близкого человека. Нужно было воспитывать и ставить на ноги детей и Кулумбу решила взять хозяйство и материальную ответственность в свои руки. У Кулумбу - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кулумбу занимается животноводством, стартовав 24 года назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кулумбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 32 овцы, 37 коз, имеет все условия для содержания скота. Дважды в год стрижет шерсть овец и коз и сдает реализаторам на изготовление шерстяных нитей, имеет определенный доход. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулумбу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку телят и овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кулумбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на улучшение материального состояния.
texts.en:
Kulumbu is 52 years old, a widow, and brought up two sons. After the death of her husband, Kulumbu was unable to cope for a long time with the death of her loved one. It was necessary to raise the children and get them on their feet, and Kulumbu decided to take the farm and material responsbility into her own hands. Kulumbu has a higher education. As a main source of income for her family, Kulumbu raises livestock, having begun 24 years ago with a livestock purchase of 1,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Kulumbu today has on her farm: 32 sheep and 37 goats, and has all the conditions for tending livestock. Twice a year, she sheers wool from the sheep and goats, delivers it to producers for preparation of woolen yarn, and gets a certain income. Monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her farm, Kulumbu applied to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy calves and sheep for expanding the count of livestock.

Kulumbu plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of the quantity of domestic livestock, and plans to save money for improving the material conditions.

loans.use: to buy calves and sheep

loans.name: Juliana Maribel

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Estancia Vieja. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Juliana, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 11, 8 y 1 año, los mayores estudian en escuela. El marido es mecánico electricista de carros.
Doña Juliana realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su esposo para que él lo utilice en su trabajo, el esposo tiene un taller de mecánica en el cual trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de un operario a quien le paga por su labor,  el crédito le sirve para comprar repuestos que necesita para realizar los arreglos, el además de cobrar por su trabajo también les vende a sus clientes estos repuestos y así el gana tiempo y ganancias extra, su marido tiene más de 15 años su taller por lo cual tiene mucha clientela que le permite ganar lo suficiente para que a su familia no les falte nada.
Este crédito es para comprar repuestos eléctricos para carros. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella  le ayuda a su marido con algo. Su sueño es  darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the area known as Estancia Vieja of the parish of Colón in the city of Portoviejo, the credit group "Estancia Vieja" meets every fifteen days. It is a place of humble people who generally work in agriculture and trade. 

Juliana lives here. She is thirty-one years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and has three children from this relationship, aged one, eight, and eleven. The older children attend school. Her partner is an auto electrician.

Juliana is taking out this loan to help her partner so that he may use it for his business. He has a garage where he works every day with the help of a paid worker. He will use the loan to buy spare parts that he needs to repair vehicles. In addition to charging for repair services, he also sells these spare parts to his customers, and like so, he saves time and earns extra income. He's had his garage for more than fifteen years; for this reason, he has many customers and this allows him to earn enough money so that his family isn't lacking anything.

This loan is to buy spare electrical parts. She has been with this credit group since the beginning, and she likes it because she's able to help out her partner in this way. Her dream is provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy spare electrical parts.

loans.name: Saber

texts.en:
Saber is 50 years old; he lives in Gaza with his wife and his five children.  He sells all kind of vegetables and fruits. He opened his shop three years ago, this business helped the family income.

Saber asked Ryada for this loan to purchase more vegetables and fruits because he had shortage in his capital, shelves, and table cash, so he would be able to increase his stock and arrange his shop more. He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur; his dream is to be well known at the city so he tries to give the best service for his clients.

Saber is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits for his shop.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en: Haleema is a 31-year-old married woman, in the business of selling milk for the past 10 years. She has 1 buffalo to provide milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has five children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses of life. She is in her 5th loan cycle; she is happily running her business through its support. Now she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase one cow. She hopes to get increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one cow.

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en: Munawar is a 44-year-old married woman, doing a business of selling milk for the past 5 years. She has 2 buffaloes producing milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has three children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses of life. It’s her sixth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through its support. Now she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase one more cow. It will help her to inflate her sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 28-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo). Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their three children. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at their store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding their business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Ana Candelaria

texts.es:
Ana, vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 18, 16 y 15 años, para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y cultivo de maíz y frijol, ya tiene 10 años de realizar esta actividad junto a su compañero de vida, trabajan todos los días, de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m., hasta no ha tenido ningún problema en su negocio.
Con el capital comprara alimento para cerdos y con el resto podrá cancelar a los mozos que le ayudaran a recolectar la cosecha. Espera fortalecer su negocio, incrementar sus ingresos con los cuales podrá continuar ayudando a su familia y también cancelara sus deudas.
Sueña con dar a sus hijos una educación superior y reparar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her partner and three children aged 18, 16 and 15.  To help with the household expenses she works raising pigs and growing corn and beans.  She has been doing this for ten years now, together with her partner.  They work every day from six in the morning till three in the afternoon.  Up to now, they haven’t had any problems with their business.

With this loan, she will buy food for the pigs and with the rest she will be able to pay the laborers who help collect the harvest.  She hopes to strengthen her business and increase her earnings, which will help her to continue helping her family and also to pay off her loans.

Her dream is to be able to offer her children higher education and to repair her home.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two calves to raise.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana vive en compañia de su hermana mayor actualmente enla zona de Munaypata de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja cuidando personas delicadas y de la tercera edad.
Ana  necesita el crédito para comprar ladrillos, cemento y arena para hacer construir una pequeña habitacion en la Zona de achachicala donde tiene una porcion de terreno recibida por herencia y que esto sea el comienzo de tener una casita propia.

El sueño de Ana es tener su vejez tranquila y no estar dependiendo de su hermana.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her elder sister in an area of Munaypata, in the city of La Paz. Ana works looking after the sick, infirm and elderly.

Ana needs this loan in order to buy bricks cement and sand in order to build a room on a plot of land in the Achachicala area. She inherited this plot of land and she wants this room to be the start of her own house.

Ana's dream is to live out her old age in peace and not to have to depend on her sister.

loans.use: to buy bricks cement and sand in order to build a room on her land.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 25-year-old hard working gentleman. He is married to Philomena and a father of one child. Samuel has been employed in the motorcycle transport business for the last two years, where he earns a monthly income of about KES. 21,800 per month. He learned about vision Fund Kenya from fellow riders who are already accessing the organization's services.

Samuel has acquired his first loan of KES. 87,880 which will facilitate him in purchasing his own motorcycle. He is likely to make more due to the flexibility that comes with ownership as well as the already established customer base. He has an advantage as this kind of transport is the major type used by most residents of the town due to the poor road network. 

He will use the additional income to take care of his young family's needs. His hope is to continue saving until he can afford to buy himself another motorbike for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his transportation business.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman, she has five children all of whom are in school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest  monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Umazi operates a cereal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, and rice for resale. She joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans, and rice for resale

loans.name: Khovaniso

texts.ru: Хованисо деятельная и усердная женщина. Ей 50 лет, она родом из города Конибодом. Хованисо живет там с мужем, 27-летним сыном, невесткой и тремя дочерьми, которым по 22, 20 и 15 лет. В данный момент ее сын и невестка живут и работают в России. Муж занимается птицеводством. Он выращивает куриц. Двое ее старших дочерей домохозяйки и занимаются домашним хозяйством. А младшая дочь школьница. Сама Хованисо по профессии швея. Она начала свой швейный бизнес не так давно, а 6 месяцев назад. Ей помогают ее старшие дочери. Хованисо по заказу вышивает женские платья и халаты. Она шьет на очень старой машинке, которую вы видите на фотографии. Ее собственного сбережения не хватает, чтобы купить новую и поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. Хованисо на сумму кредита собирается купить модернизированную швейную машинку, а на остальную сумму кредита приобрести несколько куриц для развития птицеводческой деятельности мужа. Семье Хованисо действительно важен данный кредит. Они надеятся на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Khovaniso is an enterprising and tough woman. She is 50 years old. She was born in the town of Konibodom. Khovaniso lives there with her husband, 27-year-old son, her daughter-in-law and three daughters, who are 22, 20 and 15 years. At the moment, her son and daughter-in-law live and work in Russia. Her husband is engaged in poultry farming. He raises hens. Her two older daughters and homemakers and are engaged in the domestic household. And the youngest daughter is in school.

By profession, Khovaniso herself is a seamstress. She started her own sewing business not long ago, about six months. Her elder daughters help her. By order, Khovaniso embroiders women's dresses and gowns. She sews on a very old machine, which you can see in the photograph.

Her personal savings are not enough to buy a new one and therefore she applied for a loan. With the loan amount, Khovaniso is going to buy a modernized sewing machine, and with the remaining loan amount will acquire some hens for developing the poultry breeding activities of her husband. This loan really is important to Khovaniso's family. She hopes for financial support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, and also hens

loans.name: Jasurjon

texts.ru: Часурчон родился в 1993 года. После окончания средней школы он поступил в университет. Он учится в Таджикском Государственном Технологическом Университете. Он учится по специальности Инженер-энергетик. Часурчон не женат и живет с родителями. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Jasurjon was born in 1993.  He got accepted to a university after finishing a secondary school.  He is attending the Tajikistan State Technology University.  He studying to become an energy engineer.  Jasurjon is not married and lives with his parents.  He has to pay for his tuition, but does not have money.  He is requesting this loan to pay for his university tuition.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi is from Vanadzor town. She has been involved in retail business for 5 years and this business is the only source of her income. Armenuhi brings products from the regional center's market and sells it to nearby villages. As there are not many shops in villages where people can purchase needed products, Armenuhi's services are highly demanded there. She sells different products (clothing, home products) and gets income for her living.

Armenuhi now requests this loan to be able to purchase new stock of products (clothing and home supplies) and resell it to her customers. Armenuhi will be very grateful to her lenders for supporting her with her retail business. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of products (clothing and home supplies) for reselling to customers

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia de 43 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado y es una persona acompañada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.  Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su esposo  para realizar sus actividades diarias.


 Rosalia se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura oficio que le enseño su madre, junto a su esposo durante la mañana trabajan en las parcelas camina 5 K.m. Para llegar y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas para vender la leche. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca lechera, para  producir mas leche para la venta y así incrementar sus ingresos.

 Rosalia planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de leche y  de la siembra, comprar más animales y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosalia is 43 years old and completed up to ninth grade. Rosalia is married; her husband is a farmer. Rosalia gets up with her husband at 4.30 in order to carry out her daily activities.

Rosalia works in farming, a trade that she learned from her mother. She works with her husband in the morning, walking five kilometres to their plot of land. In the afternoon, the couple milk their cows in order to sell the milk.

Rosalia is applying for this loan in order to buy a dairy cow to produce more milk to sell and increase her income.

Rosalia plans to use the income from milk sales and her crops to buy more animals and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lucia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Lucia de 29 años de edad,   estudio hasta educación media y es una persona acompañada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Lucia se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su esposo, para realizar sus actividades diarias.

Ella  se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura oficio que le ha enseñado su esposo, durante la mañana trabajan en las parcelas camina 3 K.m. Para llegar y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas para vender leche.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una novilla para  producir mas leche en un futuro y poder así incrementar sus ingresos

Su deseo es comprar en un futuro un terreno para  pastar sus animales.
texts.en:
Lucia is 29 years old and completed up to middle school. She is married and her husband works as a farmer. Lucia gets up with her husband at 4.30am in order to carry out her daily activities.

Lucia is also a farmer, having learned the trade from her husband. The couple walks three kilometres to their plot of land, where they work in the morning. In the afternoon, they milk their cows in order to sell the milk.

Lucia is applying for this loan to buy a heifer to produce more milk and increase her income.

Lucia's wish is to buy a plot of land for her animals to graze in the future.

loans.use: to buy a heifer to produce more milk.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмире 44 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Двое старших детей -студенты, двое младшие -школьники. У Эльмиры - высшее образование, закончила университет, по специальности -преподаватель физики. В данное время работает учительницей в местной сельской школе. У нее аналитический склад ума. К сожалению, ее зарплаты не хватает на бытовые и семейные нужды и в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Эльмира занимается животноводством, стартовав 21 год назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Эльмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 4 лошади, 25 овец. Супруг тоже работает учителем в школе, в свободное время помогает Эльмире по хозяйству. Скот в зимнее время содержат дома, где имеют все условия для содержания скота, в летнее время отгоняют на выпас на пастбище. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Эльмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку кобыл для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Эльмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Elmira is 44 years old, married and raising 4 children together with her husband.  Two of her older children are college students, and two younger are school students.  Elmira has a higher education.  She graduated from a university with the profession of a physics teacher.  At the present time, she works as a teacher at the local village school.  She has an analytic mind.  Unfortunately, her salary is not enough for consumer and family needs.  To provide additional income for her family, Elmira is involved in animal husbandry, having started 21 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Elmira's hard work, today her business contains 4 dairy cows, 4 horses and 25 sheep.  Her husband also works as a school teacher and helps Elmira with the business in his free time.  They keep livestock at home in the winter, where they have all of the conditions for keeping livestock, and take it out to a pasture in the summer.   The monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Elmira requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy mares in order to increase livestock headcount.  Elmira plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy mares in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Kunduzkhan

texts.ru: Кундузхан 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом Сейитбеком воспитывают 1 дочь. Супруг строитель, занимается подработками частного строительства. Как говорят односельчане у Сейитбека "золотые руки". У Кундузхан - среднее образование, домохозяйка, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кундузхан занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кундузхан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 7 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кундузхан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кундузхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Kunduzkhan is 55 years old, married, and together with her husband Seyitbek raised one daughter. Her husband is a construction work and is involved in underworking in private construction. As his fellow villagers say, Seyitbek has "golden hands".

Kunduzkhan has a secondary education and is a homemaker. As a main source of income for her family, Kunduzkhan raises livestock, having begun 20 years ago with a livestock purchase of 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Kunduzkhan today has on her farm: seven sheep. Monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her farm, Kunduzkhan applied to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to purchase a cow to increase her livestock count.

Kunduzkhan plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of the quantity of domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Zeiba

texts.en: Zeiba is a 47-year-old widow. She has five children. She deals in the business selling cloths to bear her household expenditures. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a 50,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Sandra Guadalupe

texts.es: Sandra de 28 años de edad es soltera y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar desde hace mucho tiempo. Sandra se dedica a la comercialización de tablillas de chocolate, la venta  la realiza de manera ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad. Con los ingresos que percibe de su negocio logra llevar el sustento a su hogar y colaborar con los gastos diarios. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar los materiales necesarios para encementar el piso del corredor y para repellar las paredes de la vivienda. Con el crédito comprará cemento, grava y arena.
texts.en: Sandra is 28-years-old, is single, and lives at home with her familial group where they have lived for a very long time. Sandra makes her living by marketing chocolate bars as a street vendor in the main areas of her city. With the earnings of her business, she does bring money home and helps with daily expenses. In order to improve her housing conditions, she requested a loan from FUSAI to purchase materials needed for building a concrete floor in the corridor and plastering the walls of the house. With the loan, she will buy cement, gravel, and sand.

loans.use: to purchase cement, gravel, and sand to build a cement floor and plaster the walls of her home.

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 32 años de edad estado civil Casado vive con su esposa en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, perteneciente a la parroquia Ricaurte cantón Urdaneta, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en el Comercial López y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para mejorar la economía de la familia. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno.
Le gusta trabajar y viajar.
texts.en:
Carlos is 32-years-old and married. He lives with his wife in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. 
The community bank called SAN NICOLAS is located in the San Nicolas hamlet which belongs to the parish Ricaurte, in the canton Urdaneta. This community bank is dedicated to agriculture and livestock activities. 
Carlos has been engaged in growing corn and rice for some years. He purchases products in the Lopez market in Ventanas and sells in the same market. 
He requests this loan for the purchase of fertilizer and manure for planting corn and rice. 
This loan will help him improve the home economy for his family. His dream is to buy land. He likes to work and travel.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his corn and rice crops.

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es: Víctor de 2 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar desde hace mucho tiempo. Víctor es jornalero y así se gana la vida honradamente. Trabaja muy duro en la agricultura ya que no tuvo oportunidad de terminar sus estudios y aprender un oficio por lo que este trabajo es lo que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Desea reparar el piso de la vivienda ya que actualmente es de tierra. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de la vivienda.
texts.en: Victor has lived in his own home for two years. It is located alongside his family's home where they have lived for a long time. Victor is a laborer and earns his living honestly. He works very hard in agriculture since he had no chance to finish his studies and learn a trade so this is the work that allows him to bring money home. He wants to repair the floor of his house which is currently made of dirt. Therefore, he requested this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, and gravel for building a concrete floor in his house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and gravel to build a cement floor in his home.

loans.name: Ruby Gersania

texts.es: Ruby es una joven de 35 años de edad habita en la ciudad de Juigalpa en casa de su madre, en donde tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa que ha formado con muchos esfuerzos con el apoyo de su esposo, ambos luchan para salir adelante con su hijo que cursa la escuela secundaria. Ruby solicita este primer crédito con el fin de comprar materiales de construcción como 150 piedras canteras 7 quintales de hierro y cemento, los destinara para hacerle anexo, puertas y ventanas a una pequeña vivienda que tiene, la cual no puede habitar porque no presta las condiciones necesarias para ocuparla, con una segunda etapa empezara la obra y así poder trasladarse junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Ruby is a young woman of 35.  She lives in Juigalpa in her mother’s house, which is where she has a small business selling clothes.  She set up this business with a lot of effort and help from her husband.  Both of them strive to get along in life and help their son who is in high school.  

Ruby is asking for this loan to be able to buy building materials such as 150 quarry stones, 7 quintals of iron, and cement.  She will use them to build an extension, doors and windows in a small house that she has, which at the moment she cannot use because it is not in a suitable condition to be lived in.  With this second stage she will start the work and be able to move in with her family.

loans.use: to buy 150 quarry stones, 7 quintals of iron, sand and cement.

loans.name: Ana Estela

texts.es:
Ana, es una mujer casada que disfruta la alegría de ser madre de 3 hijos los cuales viven junto a ella, para cumplir con las obligaciones de su hogar se dedica vender ropa nueva y cosméticos desde hace 6 años, la apoya una hija, su negocio no representa ninguna dificultad para realizarlo.
Con el capital comprara variedad de ropa y cosméticos, como faldas, pantalones, blusas, vestidos, cremas, lociones, labiales entre otros productos que sean necesarios para realizar sus ventas en este mes navideño que se acerca, espera aumentar sus ventas, ganar clientes nuevos, mejorar su economía con la que cancelara sus deudas y seguirá cubriendo los gastos familiares.
Aspira tener un negocio mucho más grande y rentable, para que sea auto sostenible.
texts.en:
Ana is a married woman who is delighted to be the mother of three children who all live with her.  To meet the household expenses she sells new clothes and cosmetics, a business she has been doing for six years.  One of her daughters helps her and the business is not hard to do.

With the loan she will buy a variety of clothes and cosmetics, such as skirts, blouses, dresses, creams, lotions, lip-stick and other things which she will need for sales during the Christmas period.  She hopes to increase her sales and win new customers which will improve her financial situation and so she can pay off her debts and continue to cover family expenses.

She hopes to have a bigger and more profitable business in the future to be able to sustain herself.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 29-year-old married woman who helps her husband run a grocery store located in their home. They have four children. 

When the couple started their relationship with the Kashf Foundation four years ago, their store was small and had very few items. They wanted to increase the range of products that they carried but lack of funds made this almost impossible. 

Kousar borrowed some funds from the Kashf Foundation in anticipation of improving their business. Over time, they have been stocking the store with new items, and now the store has become popular in the community. 

They want to increase their inventory as the population in their neighborhood has increased in the recent years.  Currently, Kousar has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more stocks of grains, biscuits, and oil to consistently meet the increasing demand of their customers. 

She wishes to spend a part of the profits on providing a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of grains, biscuits, and oil.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina, age 54, is a married woman. She has been running a business manufacturing henna (mehndi) cones. 

The henna cones are amongst the most popular method of henna paste application and are made of rolled plastic with a tiny hole at the end. These henna cones are commonly used during festivals and marriages for beautifying hands, arms, and feet. 

Sakina has been in this business for many years with the support of her husband, and now she has become popular in her community for providing good quality henna. 

To cope with the increasing customer demand, she applied a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase a stock of mehndi leaves, other herbs, sugar, and packaging material like rectangular, stiff and flexible plastic. 

Sakina hopes to increase her earnings through larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of mehndi leaves, other herbs, sugar, and packaging materials.

loans.name: Jose Amilcar

texts.es:
José, se siente satisfecho con los buenos resultados que tiene al invertir préstamos en su negocio pues logra que su inventario este surtido, mejora sus ventas, aumentan sus ingresos, puede proveer a sus vendedores y dar un estilo de vida diferente a su familia.
En esta ocasión necesita capital nuevamente para comprar por mayor sorbete y paletas, con lo que seguirá fortaleciendo su negocio y mejorando su economía para poder salir adelante con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Jose is satisfied with the good results from the loan that he invested in his business. His inventory has improved, his sales have improved, and he has increased his income so that he can provide for his employees and give a different lifestyle to his family.
This time, he again needs capital to buy wholesale popsicles and sorbet which will continue to strengthen his business and improve his economy in order to move forward with his obligation.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale popsicles and sorbets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 40 zinc sheets, beams, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Andrea Eugenia

texts.es:
Andrea, es una persona de familia vive con su abuela y su tía, es soltera, para cubrir sus gastos y aportar con los gastos familiares se dedica  a la venta de enchape y  ropa, lo aprendió de su tía, lo practica desde hace 6 años, es un trabajo que no le representa ninguna dificultad.
Invertirá en la compra de ropa usada y variedad de piezas de enchape, para tener su negocio surtido para las fechas de fin de año, espera aumentar sus ventas y obtener más ingresos para continuar apoyando a su familia y cancelar el crédito.
Aspira hacer crecer su negocio e independizarse de su familia.
texts.en:
Andrea lives with members of her family, her grandmother and her aunt. She is single. In order to cover household expenses and help with the expenses she works selling jewelry and clothing. She learned from her aunt and has been doing this for 6 years. It is work that offers no difficulties.

In order to have her business stocked for the end of the year season she will buy used clothing and various pieces of jewelry. She hopes to increase her sales and obtain higher earnings in order to continue helping her family and pay off the loan.

She is endeavoring to grow her business and to become independent from her family.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and various pieces of jewelry

loans.name: Rouqia

texts.en:
Rouqia is a 49-year-old married lady who has run a small general store in her community for many years with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. They offer a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and have retained many customers who regularly shop at their store. They make enough to provide for their family. 

To fully stock their store, Rouqia requested a loan of Rs 50,000 which she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, they would be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. Rouqia wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 33-year-old married woman. She is a motivated mother of three and is responsible for providing them with good quality food, education and clothing. Rubina has been in the business of manufacturing footballs for a period of about three years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. Rubina is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs and is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient on its own to fulfill the demands of his family members. 

For the improvement of her business, Rubina contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. With this, she will be able to purchase large quantities of rubber bladders, threads and leather covers. She is hopeful of receiving an increase in her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She is in her sixth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of rubber bladders, threads and leather covers.

loans.name: Hanifan

texts.en:
Hanifan is a 36-year-old married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching, receiving much appreciation from her community. She has accepted the fact that if only her husband works for their family, they will not be able to meet their household expenses with the children's educational needs. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Hanifan has now requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Hanifan hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing her children with a good quality education through her hard work.

loans.use: To purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a 45-year-old married woman. She is involved in the business of selling clothes in her community. Jameela buys clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Jameela has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Khamees

texts.en:
Khamees is 29 years old. He lives in Gaza with his wife and two daughters. He repairs phones at his office.

He has worked in many shops to gain experience. After three years, he decided to open his own workshop.

Khamees needs this youth loan to buy a display for phones. This will help organize his shop and give the shop a better look. He also wants to buy repair equipment which will increase his income and help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.  

Khamees wants to thank everyone who helps him to achieve success. He believes that this loan will greatly improve his business

loans.use: to buy a phone display and repair equipment

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is a taxi driver with two years of experience. He has been driving a taxi using his own car. He lives in Gugarq village with his wife and two little children.

Davit has a big list of loyal customers who prefer to go with Davit far distances because of his nice and careful attitude toward people. Davit is now asking for this loan to be able to renovate his car, install gas and purchase new tires. The loan is really important for Davit. Due to the improvements that will be done with the loan's help, Davit will be able to continue his taxi driving business.

Davit has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides start-up loans for businesses with soft conditions that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to renovate his car, install gas and purchase new tires

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 38-years-old. She is married with six children and they all go to school. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and cooking oil to sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more beans and cooking oil to sale.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 32-years-old. She is married with one child. She sells milk and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more liters of milk for sale. The profits from the business will be used for reinvesting in the business.

loans.use: To buy more liters of milk for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish for her business.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 26-year-old ambitious married woman and is a mother of three children. She has owned a hand-embroidery business for many years. 

She makes beautiful embroidery patterns with threads and beads. She sells the embroidery after framing for wall hangings. Rukhsana is zealous about her work. Client demand is strong, but business challenges combined with family expenditures frustrate her nearly every day. 

Rukhsana’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earner in her household. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls along with bundles of cloth in various colors.

The loan will help her to inflate her sales and to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls along with bundles of cloth in various colors.

loans.name: Tsiala

texts.en:
Tsiala is a 51-year-old married woman. She lives with her son and husband in the village of Kavtiskhevi in the Kaspi district. Her husband works as a store manager in another city and earns a monthly income of 700 GEL. They have some chickens and the family sells eggs to local people. Despite Tsiala's education, she doesn't have a job. In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living. 

So, Tsiala decided to start a home products trading business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from  borrowers. Tsiala has a great desire to be involved in a trading business. She couldn’t receive a loan from local financial institutions, because of their requirements to have business experience. However, the Start Up program, a joint product of Kiva and Credo, began with a program that allows rural poor people like Tsiala to have the chance of starting a business. 

She requested a loan of 600 USD to begin trading with home products. She plans to go to Turkey and purchase the products at wholesale prices and then resell among her friends and villagers. This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. Thanks to the Start Up program, Tsiala will be able to have some savings and provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: To start a home products trading business

loans.name: Speed Way Organisation Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Speed Way Organization” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 4,600,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Abu is the featured leader of this group. Abu is 30 years old, married, with 2 children. Abu sells hair extensions and cosmetics.  He has requested this loan in order to expand his business by buying hair extensions and cosmetics to add to his business.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying hair extensions and cosmetics to add to his business

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 37 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos de 16 años, 13 años y 8 años de edad. Jorge trabaja como albañil desde hace mucho tiempo.  Este oficio le permite ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a su hogar. Para él lo más importante son sus hijos y hace todo lo que este a su alcance para darles mejores condiciones de vida. Desea encementar el piso del corredor de la vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava. Tiene plena confianza que con lo que gana logrará cancelar la deuda que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Jorge is 37 years old. He lives in his own home with his 3 children who are 16, 13, and 8 years old. Jorge has been working as a mason for a long time. This job permits him to earn a living and to cover the household expenses. What is most important to him are his children and he does everything he can to give them a better life.

He is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand, and gravel because he wants to put in a cement floor in the corridor of the house. He has confidence that his income will allow him to pay off the debt from the loan.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel in order to put in a cement floor in the corridor of the house.

loans.name: Aster

texts.en:
Ms. Aster is a 43-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of animal trading for the past five years. She has 3 buffaloes. Both Aster and her husband look after the animals.  She purchases animals and sells them to an animal market, or buys a calf and sells it at a later stage.

Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has one child and she wishes a bright future for her child. She is very motivated to provide her only child with a beautiful life, good health and education.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life.

Now she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase a small buffalo. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in future.

loans.use: to purchase a small buffalo

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education.

She, with her husband, has been doing agriculture work for 10 years. They grow different crops of vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  Her son also assists her in growing the various crops by watering the soil for good quality production. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.

In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Zainab applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops, which will ultimately help in generating more cash. She is in her 5th loan cycle.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Ms. Mumtaz is a 53-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has 4 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is the mother of 8 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and healthcare.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand in her store. She is in her 8th loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and has a very good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes and footwear for resale

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 36-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She has been running a business selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

Shamim has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a youth residing in the Majengo area in Nairobi. Like other youth, he faces the challenge of unemployment or otherwise the problem of raising capital to start small businesses. He desires to own a business and create employment opportunities for other youth in his community.

He recently learnt about the Fresh Life Franchise and considered it to be a viable business in his area since there is a great need for sanitation facilities. He therefore seeks a loan to fund the purchase and running of two Fresh Life Toilets. He will use the profit generated to expand his business and create more employment opportunities for other youth.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa María tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, también se dedica a la crianza de patos, pavos y cerdos, su esposo brinda servicios agrícolas y labora en una empresa pesquera, son una familia que se esfuerza por tener una mejor calidad de vida, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 700 nuevos soles para la comprar ropa en mayor cantidad y una segunda parte para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is thirty-one years old. She lives together with her husband and children in the Cayalti District, an area where people work in agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry. The district is located in the Chiclayo Province of the Lambayque Region, which is situated on the northern coast of Peru. 

Rosa sells women's, men's, and children's clothing. Her business is located in her home. She also raises ducks, turkeys, and pigs. Her husband offers farming services and also works for a company in the fishing industry. They are a family that strives to have a better quality of life. She has applied for a loan of 3,700 Nuevos Soles to buy clothing in large quantities as well as nutritionally-balanced animal feed to fatten her livestock. In this manner, she can earn a greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced animal feed and clothing in large quantities.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin vive en casa de su padre, lugar donde tiene un taller de chaperia en la zona de Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz, esta soltero, y con esta actividad el se mantiene y cubre sus minimas necesidades.

El credito que solicita es para la compra de herramientas de trabajo (martillo-combo, lijas, una compresora de segunda mano) y poder ampliar su negocio ya que es su unica fuente de ingresos.

El sueño de Edwin es poder independizarse de la casa de sus padres y poder comprar una casita e instalar su taller.
texts.en:
Edwin is single, and lives in his father’s house in the Pampahasi neighborhood within the city of La Paz.  He has an auto body shop there, and this is how he supports himself and covers his basic needs.

The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of working tools (a combination hammer, sandpaper, and a second-hand compressor) so that he can expand his business, as it is his only source of income.

Edwin’s dream is to become independent from his parents and be able to buy a little house where he can set up his shop.

loans.use: to purchase a combination hammer, sandpaper, and a second-hand compressor for his auto body shop.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is married with five children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (a brother and a sister). She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. 

Teddy runs a pub and has been in this business for 20 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer, soda and jerry cans of local brew and gin.  She generates additional income from selling piped water at a restaurant.  She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail and wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include thieves, defaulters and seasonality.  

Teddy is aspiring to own a fully stocked pub and also to educate her children up to university. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest charged. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer, soda, jerry cans of local gin and brew

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is a 57-year-old widow; she lives in a small house in Gaza with her son.

For the past three years, Salwa has run a market for cleaning materials. She hopes in the future to buy a shop of her own, as this business has helped her especially after her husband passed. 

Salwa has asked Ryada for this loan to purchase more goods, so she would be able to increase her stock (soap, washing powder, cleaning powder, etc.) for her shop. This will increase her income and help to improve her financial conditions. Salwa is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as soap, washing powder, cleaning powder etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Sumina

texts.en: Sumina is 30 years old. She is married and has three children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more soaps, beans, and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more soaps and beans for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Diane

texts.en: Diane is 30 years old. She is a mother of two children, aged between three and seven. With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used for reinvesting in the business.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and rice for sale.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is from Vanadzor town. He has been providing transportation services to locals using his own truck. Since the truck has a lifting crane in it, the service that Ashot provides is highly in demand among locals in Vanadzor town. 

Ashot lives with his wife and two daughters. He is the only worker in the family and feels very responsible for providing appropriate living conditions for them. 

Ashot applied for this loan to be able to purchase new tires and repair the lifting crane on the truck. This loan is important for him because currently the truck is in non-working condition and it is very difficult for Ashot to continue providing transportation and other services. 

Ashot has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new tires and repair the lifting crane on his truck.

loans.name: Merujan

texts.en: Merujan has been involved in a retail business for 15 years already. Together with his wife, Merujan has been trading with fruits and vegetables in the small rented space near their house.  As the house is near the market, Merujan brings fresh products from the market and resells them to his neighbors. Because of their hard work, their business helps them to sustain their living and cover basic costs.  By asking for this loan, Merujan needs financial support to be able to purchase fruits and vegetables and enlarge the turnover of his store.  This loan will be very helpful for Merujan and his wife and they both hope for lenders’ support.  Merujan has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to resell to customers

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a tea farmer and is a repeat customer whose previous loan was repaid well.  He owns a banana plantation which gives him additional income in a given period.  He started the business with a motive of earning income to cater to the needs of his family so that the family members can lead better lives.  His major clients are owners of tea factories in Bushenyi where he sells his tea.  He would like to use the loan money amounting to 2,000,000 UGX to rent out a shamba where he can grow tea and get profits.  Godfrey’s future dream is to have many shambas and hence, big harvests which would result into big profits which he would use to cater to the needs of his family. His major challenges are hailstorms which negatively affect his tea gardens by reducing the income that he would have otherwise got in a given period.

loans.use: To rent a shamba to grow tea

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, cement blocks, iron, and a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of soap, canned foods, rice, toiletries, milk, etc.

loans.name: Compressor Group

texts.en:
Nasra is in her late 30s and is married with two children who are still in school.  She has been running several businesses.  She has a food shop and also sells charcoal and drinking water.  She has been in her business since 2008. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. every working day and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be her eighth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With her previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, Nasra used the funds to buy a sack of charcoal and two water storage tanks for storing water for sale, and to restock products for her shop. Nasra is doing great with her business and family. She is happy with Tujijenge products because they are so convenient. With this loan, Nasra will buy a sack of charcoal, dry food for the shop and water to resell. She dreams that one day will be able to build a house. 

Nasra will share this loan with her loan group, Compressor, which totals 13 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a sack of charcoal, buy dry food for the shop and water to resell.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is a 45-year-old man who lives in Aghaiani in the Kaspi district. The family consists of the following members: mother, brother and his family. Zaza's brother works as a truck driver and earns a monthly income of 500-600 GEL. The family also has chickens and they sell eggs. His niece is a daily worker and earns approximately 300 GEL monthly. Zaza is a driver and works using another person’s car at the quarry and earns a fixed salary. 

Zaza has applied for credit to purchase his own car so he won't have to pay car rental any more. This will help him to save much more money from his income. He needs 2000 GEL to purchase a second-hand car and work on his own. The Start Up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase his own car

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is 33 years old, married, and lives with her husband, two school-age children and parents-in-law.

She requested a small-sized loan to start working at a beauty salon, as she used to work as a hairstylist and has experience in this field. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. Khatuna wants to purchase all the needed modern inventory for a haircare business. She will serve the customers as a stylist and generate daily income. According to her estimates, the business will be lucrative and the increased profit will be reinvested in the same business.

Khatuna will be able to increase her spending to satisfy her daily needs and improve the standard of living for her children.

loans.use: to buy inventory and start working at a beauty salon

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 30-year-old married woman. Rehana and her husband have run a business making and selling fried slanty (a traditional yummy spicy snack) for the past six years. They purchase unbaked slanty from the market, fry it at home and sell it in the market. Rehana is earning enough to lead a decent life with the support of her husband who is shown in the photo. He assists her in packaging and selling it in the local market. She serves her community well.

Rehana has requested a loan of Rs. 45,000 to buy large quantities of stocks of ingredients such as unbaked slanty, packs of oil, salt and spices to increase their sales. She wishes to spend part of the profits on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of stocks of ingredients  such as unbaked slanty (a traditional snack), packs of oil, salt and spices.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms. Naseem is a widow, forty-six years old, and she has six children. She took the initiative to set up a general store business after her husband passed away and she needed to manage the circle of life in the home. She put aside a room for a small shop to sell general items for daily use. She started with products which are requirements for every house and sweets for the children. After passing through different phases of development, her small store now sells a few variety items which include bread, eggs, butter, milk, etc.

She is responsible for arranging everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education for her children. She has enhanced her business with the support of the Kashf foundation and it’s her sixth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees to buy additional items including rice, bread, pulses, sugar and other grocery items in bulk from markets. She will then be able to manage increasing demand efficiently. She wishes to utilize the earned profits for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy items including rice, bread, pulses, sugar and other grocery items.

loans.name: Karla Ivon

texts.es:
Karla es una mujer casada de 38 años de edad, madre de un hijo, agricultora, comerciante y con un grado de educación superior graduándose como licenciada en educación básica. Su esposo reside actualmente en E.U.A. quien ayuda por medio de remesas a su familia contribuyendo con la economía en el hogar y la educación de su hijo quien es estudiante. Actualmente ella desempeña su profesión como maestra de kínder en una institución de la comunidad y al salir de sus actividades se dirige al campo en donde trabaja con la siembra de maíz, frijol y caña de azúcar. Gran parte de su vida ella ha alquilado tierra para sembrar sus cultivos de granos básicos y caña de azúcar el cual es vendido en las bodegas de la localidad estando las tierras a una distancia de 2 kilómetros a la cual se traslada en vehículo particular o a caballo. Ella carece de apoyo familiar por lo que paga mano de obra para que sus plantaciones puedan estar cuidadas y al momento de recolecta del grano o corta de caña de azúcar pagar nuevamente mano de obra generando empleo en la comunidad pero las ganancias no son muchas.
Sus sueños poder algún día comprar su propio terreno en donde ella pueda cultivar su producto, ser la mayor abastecedora y productora de la zona, darle a su hijo una excelente educación para que sea una persona preparada, con muchas ideas y con muchas oportunidades en la vida para crecer.
Por lo que ella ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, limpieza y preparación de tierra entre otros que ayudaran a la nueva siembra de caña.
texts.en:
Karla is a 38 year old married woman, mother of a son, a farmer, a merchant, and has a BA in elementary education. Her husband is currently living in the United States and he helps by sending money to the family contributing to the household expenses and to pay school fees for their son who is a student.

Currently she is working in her profession as a kindergarten teacher at a community school and when she leaves she goes to do her farming activities growing corn, beans and sugar cane.

Much of her life she has rented land in order to grow basic grains and sugar cane which is sold to the local warehouse facilities which are about 2 kilometers away and which she travels by private vehicle or on horseback. She has no family to help out so she pays day laborers so that her fields can be cared for and when it is time for the harvest of the grain or cutting the sugar cane she once again pays for workers creating jobs in the community although the earnings are small.

Her dreams are to be able to buy her own land someday where she can grow her product, to be the biggest supplier and producer in the area, give her son an excellent education and to be prepared with many ideas and many opportunities in life to grow. This is why she is asking for funding from the cooperative COMIXMUL in order to buy fertilizers, manure, and for clearing and preparing the land, and more that will help with the sugar cane crop.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for laborers for planting sugar cane crops

loans.name: Muqadas

texts.en:
Muqadas is 37 years old and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for 20 years and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Muqadas was not earning, her family went through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her sewing skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family: due to limited resources, none of their children were sent to school. 

Muqadas felt obliged to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. She is a brave woman and hard work helped her establish a good clientele. However, she was having difficulty fulfilling large orders so she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation which will be used to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of thread. Muqadas is in her sixth loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of thread.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 35-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of selling milk for the past 10 years. She has 2 calves and 1 buffalo in milk. She sells it to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has five children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.

She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her 6th year with Kashf Foundation, and she is happily running her business through its support.

Now she requested a loan from Kashf Foundation of 50,000 PKR to purchase one cow and feed for its calves. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one cow and feed for its calves

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is a thirty-five-year-old married woman. She is the mother of five children.

Her husband has been a rickshaw driver for the past twenty years. Now, after 20 years, the rickshaw needs repair work, the engine also needs some attention and customers also want to sit in a rickshaw which is presentable and clean, so repair work is required. Ghazala has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a new rickshaw body.

Ghazala wants to have better facilities for her children and it’s her dream that the children get a proper education. She hopes to grow her business and she dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through this business.

loans.use: to buy new rickshaw body

loans.name: Malka

texts.en:
Malka is a married woman and the mother of three children. She has been running a business trading cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community.

Malka requested a loan of 50,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different cloth for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business. She is in her 6th loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy stock of different cloth for the winter season

loans.name: Agress

texts.en: Agress  is married with two children, and one of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for five years.  She has applied for a loan of 1,900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons  of salt, boxes of soap, jerrycans of cooking oil, and a bag of rice. She works in a shop and sells on a retail basis seven days a week.  Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a wholesale shop and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar ,cartons of salt, boxes of soap, jerrycans of cooking oil and a bag of rice.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). She has a business that sells used clothes and has been in this business for 2 years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. She doesn't have any other income generating activity. Her major business challenges include transportation and rainy season which hinders her customers to reach out to her because she works from an open place. She aspires to own a boutique and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married mother of one child who is an adult. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.
