Mlongo has operated a water selling business for the past four years, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.  With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase water pipes for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes for her businesss

loans.name: Shokir

texts.ru: Этого мужчину на фотографии зовут Шокир. Он женат. Шокир с женой живет в селе района Шахритус. Шахритусе свежий воздух, чистая природа, гостеприимные и доброжелательные люди. В этом районе популярно деятельности, такие как животноводства, растениеводства и садоводства, потому что климат района благоприятен для таких деятельностей. Шокир пользуясь удачным местом жительства, хочет совместно со свекром начать бизнес животноводства. Он хочет развивать скотов дома. Для этого у него имеется коровник и достаточное количество корма для скота на первое время. Но у него не хватает денег для закупа скота, по этой причине он обратился за помощью. Он верит и надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: The man in the photograph is Shokir. He is married. Shokir and his wife live in a village in Shahrituz. Shahrituz has fresh air, clean nature, and hospitable, friendly people. Raising livestock, farming, and horticulture are popular in the area because of the climate. Shokir, fortunate to live in such a place, wants to start a livestock business with his in-laws. He wants to raise cattle at home. He has barn and enough feed to start. However, he does not have enough money to buy livestock. Therefore, he asked for help. He believes in and hopes for your help.

loans.use: buy livestock to start a livestock business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more red oil, plantain, pepper, bitter ball, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for new stocks of clothing for reselling to customers

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan lives in Yerevan with his mother. Vardan earns his family's living by providing vehicle repair service. He is already very experienced in this field and provides high quality service to his customers. As the demand for this service is high, Vardan has many orders to complete. Unfortunately, the tools that he currently owns don’t allow him to organize his work effectively. This is the reason Vardan has applied for this loan. With the loan's help he plans to purchase tools and materials needed for providing vehicle repair service. Vardan hopes for lenders' support. 
He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing vehicle repair service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, batteries, plastic, and candy to expand her business

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a business woman who is very hardworking. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She has five children, all of whom go to school.

Miriam has operated a charcoal selling business for the past four years. Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ilir

texts.en:
Ilir has been photographed here with his oldest son who is seven years old.  He had just come from school and was taking off his backpack and the shoes at the front of the house, when he heard that his father would be photographed; he ran to his father and took the stand for the photo.

For the past six years Ilir has been doing agriculture and this has been the only source of income for the family; he sells the fresh produce to the local farmer’s market of a nearby city. Ilir is thirty-three years old and wants to buy a water pump for watering the plants with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a water pump for watering the plants

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 43-year-old divorced mother of five children. Hanan's ten years of experience provided her with customers' trust and support, especially as she is her children's sole breadwinner.

Hanan is a hard worker and she puts so much effort into developing her business and supporting her family's living. She runs her convenience store in a well-managed way. As a Palestinian refugee living in a Palestinian camp, this is a suitable business to run.

Her acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with special Christmas and winter highly requested deserts and cereals, in addition to special-offer soft drinks and many other items which will attract customers' attention. Her previous loan was requested to open another branch, but in general it is hard for Palestinians to open a business outside the camp, so she invested it in increasing her business capital and increased her income to cover her children's increasing needs and requests.

She hopes that, in the future, she'll be capable of opening a wider market in the camp and hopes to be capable of opening another branch outside.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special Christmas and winter highly-requested deserts and cereals, special-offer soft drinks and many other items

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna and her nice family live in Sevan in the Gegharkunik region. She works as a teacher of geography at the local school.  Anna has a big family: she lives with her husband and three children. Her elder daughter is a student at the State Armenian University of Economics at the paid division. Anna’s first loan was for her daughter’s tuition fee, and she is greatly thankful for such support from Kiva lenders. Her second daughter and son are still school-aged. Her husband works as a court clerk. 

During this year, the family finally managed to repair their house. For such a large family, it is very hard to have savings, but gradually they repaired their house and made it more comfortable, brighter and modern, but now they cannot furnish their house due to lack of money. Anna is asking for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams in order to buy kitchen and living-room furniture for their house.

loans.use: to buy kitchen and living-room furniture for their house

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es una cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.

Norma tiene 40 años, esta casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella trabaja en un salon de belleza que inicio hace 18 años, en el salón ella realiza cortes de cabello, bases, uñas, depilaciones, tintes, rayos, peinados, maquillaje, pedicure, manicure y pestañas. ella esta solicitando el crédito para comprar artículos de belleza pues piensa que es importante ofrece a sus clientes más opciones para mejorar su image. Sus principales logros han sido mantener y crecer su negocio, construir su casa, amueblarla y en general tener una vida cómoda.
texts.en:
Norma is a Kubo Financiero client and here is her story:

Norma is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She works in a beauty salon that she started 18 years ago and she does haircuts, bases, nails, tweezing, tints, highlights, hairstyles, makeup, pedicures, manicures, and eye lashes.  She is asking for a loan to buy beauty products because she thinks it’s important to offer more options to her customers to improve their images.  Her main achievements have been growing her business, building a home, furnishing it, and having a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Beto es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.

Beto tiene 53 años y vive en una casa con sus familiares. A pesar de que solo estudio hasta primaria, el se considera una persona emprendedora y motivada para mejorar su negocio y su vida. Su negocio consiste en una tienda de abarrotes, cremeria y semillas. Antes trabajo durante 15 años en una tienda de abarrotes y hace un poco más de dos años decidió independizarse y abrir su propio negocio. Para Beto, su principal logro es haber iniciado su negocio y lograr mantenerlo, ahora su reto es hacerlo crecer y conseguir nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Beto is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story:

Beto is 53 years old and lives with relatives.  Despite the fact that he only completed elementary school, be is considered to be enterprising and motivated to improve his business and life.  He has a grocery, dairy, and seed store.  He worked for 15 years in a grocery store and he decided to go out on his own a little over two years ago.  Beto’s main achievements are having started his business and maintaining it.  Now his challenge is to grow it and attract new customers.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Maa Mangla Self Help Group

texts.en:
Suprava is a 49-year-old widowed woman who lives in Tangi village of Odisha, India with her two children. In the picture, the woman sitting on a chair and wearing a green sari is Suprava. Her husband passed away more than ten years ago. 

A few years back, she started a business of making and selling flour, such as wheat flour, maize flour, gram flour, lentil flour, rice flour, etc. She makes these flours with the help of grinders. She makes a variety of flours depending on the demand for flour in the market. 

All the members of this group do different businesses like fishing, dairy, vegetable cultivation, etc. Suprava, along with her group, is requesting a loan amount of 150,000 INR.

Suprava will use her portion to buy more supplies, such as wheat, maize, grains, etc. and a new grinder machine. With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. 

She is requesting within a group of ten members who are all women and live in the same community. They named their group “Maa Mangla Self Help Group”.

loans.use: to buy more supplies, such as wheat, maize, grains, etc. and a new grinder machine for her flour business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, salt, onions, and others items for her business.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a 24-year-old businessman. His retail business is located in a small trading center in Ishaka-Bushenyi. He started the business in 2010 with an objective of earning enough income to provide for his family. He works seven days a week and twelve hours a day. In addition to the business, he has a banana plantation where he gets bananas that he sells at a profit and this really boosts his income. His clients are mainly the business community in Kizinda and Ishaka and he believes that his business will grow from one level to another. He plans to use the loan money amounting to one million UGX to buy more stock so that he can step up his business and make more profits. His main challenge is the bad debtors who never pay as promised, but despite all this he believes that he will succeed in life. In the photo is Jackson standing at the shop while the UGAFODE staff is standing inside the shop.

loans.use: to buy daily household use items for his retail store

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice lives in Kitale, where she does farming and raises her family of four children. She has been doing agribusiness for eight years, in which her primary source of income comes from producing milk, eggs, and a few crops. In farming, she enjoys doing dairy farming the most.

Beatrice chose Juhudi Kilimo for this dairy loan because they offer their loans at a reduced interest rate. During the training received, she learned that MFIs (microfinance institutions) are institutions which offer short-term loans to small-scale holders. 

Her highest monthly expense is school fees and so, this loan will bring in more output to her and, thus, she will be able to cater to her children's school fees and also improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Flor De Los Andes Uno Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE LOS ANDES” iniciará el décimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marcelina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de juguetes, tapicería, venta de ropa, venta de peluches, venta de jugo de naranja, taller de carpintería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marcelina es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hija que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo adquirió por iniciativa propia al observar el movimiento del mercado y el comercio que tenía ese producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, las capacitaciones y el crédito accesible que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Flor de los Andes communal bank will begin its nineteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Focal de Los Andes Center. There are eight members and it is managed by a Board of Directors with Marcelina as the president. The businesses of the members of this communal bank are diverse, including selling clothes, selling food, selling toys, upholstering, selling clothes, selling stuffed animals, selling orange juice, and carpentry.

This loan will benefit these small businesses, including Marcelina's. She has done four loan cycles with Pro Mujer after she became a member from her daughter's invitation, who is also a member. Marcelina currently has a business in selling clothes. She started this business on her own initiative after observing the movement in sales and marketing of this product.

The loan that she is taking out now will be used to increase capital by buying clothes. She will get this product from wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and after preparing it, she will sell it in her sales space. This work allows her to earn income to support her family since she is married with five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Marcelina said that she likes the health, the training, and the access to loans that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Kaja A Group

texts.en:
Martina is a single woman in her late twenties. For two years now she has operated a cafe business, selling cold and hot beverages such as soda, juice and water. She also provides food services through this business. Martina opens her business from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit. 

This is Martina's 3rd loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to open another cafe business in a new location. With her previous loans, all of which she managed to pay back in full, Martina used the funds to buy more food-cooking supplies: maize flour, baking flour, cooking oil, sugar, and fruits for making juice. She also paid wages for her employees and bought some new equipment for her business, such as chairs and tables. Martina used the profits from her business to buy a plot of land and to cover her own food and other household expenses. Her dream is to build a house and be a successful woman. 

Martina will share this loan with her loan group, Kaja A, which consists of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open another cafe business in a new location.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise.

loans.name: Dina Raquel

texts.es:
Dina es una joven de 26 años de edad madre soltera de un hijo quien es menor de edad. Ella es ama de casa y agricultora con un grado de educación secundaria completa graduándose como perito mercantil y contador público pero en la actualidad ella no desempeña su profesión debido a la falta de empleo en la zona. Ella se dedica al trabajo de campo en la siembra y cultivo de café desde hace más de 4 años siendo sus padres quienes a temprana edad le enseñaran las diferentes técnicas para llevar a cabo dicha actividad. Diariamente trabaja fuertemente en el campo ya que su prioridad es su hijo para que a él no le falte nada y pueda ayudarlo en un futuro para que él se prepare académicamente de una mejor manera.
Sus planes para el futuro son los de poder tecnificar de una mejor forma sus cultivos de café, ampliarla y sembrar una variedad diferente. Sus sueños mediante los ingresos generados por su trabajo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y principalmente la de su hijo a quien ella ve en un mejor futuro y por quien ella diariamente trabaja fuertemente en compañía de sus familiares.     
Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes, limpieza, pago de mano de obra ya que gracias a ello, Dina espera obtener mejores ingresos, una excelente producción como resultado del trabajo que quiere llevar a cabo por medio de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Dina is a 26-year-old young woman and a single mother of a son who is a minor. She is a homemaker and a farmer. She has a high school degree and graduated as a trade expert and public accountant. Currently, she doesn't work in her profession due to the lack of jobs in the area. For more than 4 years, she has been making a living planting and growing coffee in the fields. At an early age, her parents taught her the different techniques to perform this job. Every day, she works hard in the fields because her son is her priority. She works so that he doesn't lack anything and so she can help him in the future so that he is better prepared academically.

Her plans for the future are to implement technology to her coffee crops, expand, and plant a different variety. Her dream, from the income generated by her job, is to improve her family's quality of life, mainly that of her son. She sees a better future for him and every day she works hard for him alongside her relatives.

Therefore, today she is requesting financing for the purchase of fertilizers, cleaners, and to pay for labor costs. Thanks to this financing, Dina hopes to obtain higher revenues and an excellent yield as a result of the work she wants to do through this financing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, cleaners, and to pay for labor to tend her coffee crops.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 42-year-old married woman who is living with her husband and 8 children. For about 6 years she has been doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are highly in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR. 45,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater for more customers consistently. She is hopeful for an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Najma dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house as she is living in a rented house with her family. She is very much thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila  es casada y tiene 2 hijos los que estan en etapa escolar, viven en casa de sus padres no pagan alquiler  pero ayudan con la cancelacion de servicios basicos del hogar, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio y terminó la secundaria, pero lamentablemente por los escasos recursos de sus padre no pudo estudiar una carrera universitaria. Actualmente ella y su esposo se dedican al transporte urbano, tienen una movilidad.
El crédito lo requiere para  la compra de repuestos para su minibus, ya que el mismo se encuetra en el taller mecanico, además de llantas nuevas. Asi podrá mantener en un mejor estado su principal herramienta de trabajo.
El sueño de Lucila es tener su casa propia.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Lucila is married and has two school-aged children. They live in her parents' house; they don't pay rent but they help pay for the basic services in the house. The house is located in the Villa Ingenio area of the city of El Alto. Lucila studied and finished secondary school, but unfortunately due to her parents' scarce resources she wasn't able to study for a career at the university. 

Currently she and her husband make a living from urban transportation: they have a minibus. She requires the loan to buy replacement parts for her minibus, as it is in the mechanic shop, as well as new tires. In this way she will be able to maintain her primary source of work in a better condition.

Lucila's dream is to have a house of her own. This is the first time she has asked for a loan from IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts and tires for her minibus to transport passengers

loans.name: Nurlan

texts.en: Nurlan is a 30 year-old married man with one child. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar region. Nurlan is the sole provider for his family. Nurlan owns a barber shop. He established his business in 2010 and has gained much experience in this field. He is well-known in the surrounding area thanks to his good customer care and his affordable prices.  Now Nurlan is applying for a youth loan of 600 Azn .  The aim of this loan is to buy 2 new hair-cutting chairs and install a display window for his barber shop. This is going to be his 4th loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy 2 new hair-cutting chairs and install a display window for his barber shop.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
JUSTO es padre de familia la cual consta de  su esposa y tres hijos  los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar; gracias a su trabajo adquirió un terreno en el cual construyó su casa ubicada en la zona los Pinos sector periurbano de la ciudad de El Alto.
Su trabajo empieza a las primeras horas de la madrugada pues se dirige a los ríos cercanos donde se provee de arena algunos días, piedras otros, con su volqueta la cual constituye su herramienta principal y los traslada a las construcciones cuyos dueños contratan sus servicios.
Es en este constante ir y venir de los ríos a la ciudad, es que se deterioró el motor de su volqueta y requiere realizarse varios arreglos necesarios para el buen funcionamiento 
El crédito lo empleará en realizar dicho mantenimiento y así continuar con su trabajo que es la única fuente de ingresos de toda la familia.

El sueño de Justo es algún día cambiar o  modernizar su herramienta de trabajo para así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.


Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Justo is the father of a household which consists of his wife and three children who are of school age. Thanks to his work he bought land on which he built his home. It is located in the area of Los Pinos which is a suburban area of the city of El Alto.

His work begins in the early hours of the morning when he goes to nearby rivers where some days he gets sand and other days stones, using his main tool which is his dump truck and he travels to the construction sites whose owners contract his services.

Because of the constant going back and forth to the city rivers his dump truck motor deteriorated and he has made repairs several times to keep it in good running order. He will use the loan to perform maintenance so he can continue with his work as it is the only source of income for the family.

Justo’s dream is to someday change or update his vehicle so that he can improve his financial income.

This is the second time that he has applied for a loan through IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to maintain his dump truck which he uses to fulfill contracts for transporting sand, stones, and sod to construction sites.

loans.name: Quaquso Group

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you the members of the "Quaquso" group, for the second time. This group of entrepreneurs has just finished repaying their previous Kiva loan. Now, they are requesting a new loan, in the amount of 800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each person in the group. With the help of this new loan, they will be able to further expand their respective businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve on their living conditions. The featured leader, Annie, is again going to use her share of the loan to buy food in bulk, to add to her current stock for sale at the market, including tomatoes, etcetera.

loans.use: to buy food in bulk, including tomatoes, etcetera.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying more African print for sale, thus increasing the quantity of items like African prints in the near future.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral desde hace más de un año y seis meses, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de arreglos de infraestructuras de corrales donde cría animales patos, gallinas, cerdos y de esta manera tener una mejor distribución de los mismos que le permitira mejorar su producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maribel is 28 years old. She lives together with her husband and her children in the district of Oyotún whose population works in agriculture, commerce and livestock. It is two hours away from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Perú.

Maribel works raising and selling penned animals. She has done this for a year and 6 months. Her business is located at her home. She is seeking a loan of $900 to purchase repairs for a system of corrals where she raises ducks, hens and pigs. As a result she will have a better selection of animals which will allow her to improve the production that she offers to her customers.

loans.use: to mend a system of corrals for young animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase larger numbers of dresses and shoes

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 49 years old and is married with four children, two of whom are in school. Anabelle works very hard to provide for them.

Anabelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 9,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell, such as sardines, breads, soft drinks, and other items.

Anabelle has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items including shampoo, drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Anabelle would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as sardines, breads, soft drinks, and other items.

loans.name: Frunze

texts.en:
Frunze is a farmer living in Arshaluys village of Armavir region. He lives together with his mother, wife and two school age children.

Frunze has been involved in land cultivation for many years. Particularly he cultivates wheat, potato, tomato and eggplant. Frunze also owns a greenhouse, which helps him to be involved in agriculture for the whole year. 

Now this hard working farmer asks financial support to be able to purchase fertilizer, potato seeds and to renovate the greenhouse. The loan will greatly assist him to solve his farming problems and continue his agribusiness. As this is Frunze's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

The loan will greatly help Frunze and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, potato seeds and renovation of the greenhouse

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married with six children and all her children go to school. She has a business of making and selling juice. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of passionfruit, oranges and sugar for making fruit juice. She also sells fresh fruits like passionfruit, mangoes, pineapples and oranges.  

Annet works at the market six days out of every week and sells on retail a basis. Her major business challenges include the rainy season and defaulters.  She is aspiring to become a wholesaler, and also to buy a plot of land to build her own house. 

She resides in rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy passionfruit, mangoes, pineapples and oranges.

loans.name: Josue Yovany

texts.es:
Josue Yovany tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijas en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, que se encuentra ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus clientes a las zonas aledañas a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para mantenimiento de su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando el servicio, generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Josue Yovany, 40, lives with his wife and daughters in the Cayalti district. The population is engaged in agriculture, commerce and livestock. 

It is located in the Chiclayo province which is part of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. 

He works as a public transport driver using his own motorcycle taxi. 

He transports his clients to the outskirts of his district. 

He is asking for a $550 loan to maintain his vehicle. 

This way he can keep providing a service, generating income for his family.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia vive en compañia de sus 2 hijos y su esposo  en la zona de San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja como cajera en una heladeria y  su esposo es taxista, trabaja con la movilidad de un compañero de trabajo de Claudia.
Claudia  necesita el crédito para hacer terminar de construir su departamento y tener algo propio con  mayor comodidad para su familia; necesita comprar ladrillo, estuco, cemento y ventanas.

El sueño de Claudia es tener su casa propia con las comodidades que se requiere.
texts.en:
Claudia lives with her two children and her husband in the San Pedro zone within the city of La Paz.

She works as a cashier in an ice-cream parlor and her husband is a taxi driver, working with the vehicle of one of Claudia’s co-workers. 

Claudia needs a loan in order to finish constructing her apartment so that she can have something of her own that will be more comfortable for her family.  She needs to purchase brick, plaster, cement, and windows.  

Claudia’s dream is to have her own house with the basic amenities that are necessary.

loans.use: to purchase brick, plaster, and windows in order to finish the construction of a little apartment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more meat for her business.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Ella es carolina esta interesada en estudiar auxiliar de enfermería, siempre se ha interesado en todo lo que tenga que ver con medicina porque le gusta servirle a las personas y que mejor que servirles en esta area tan importante como lo es la salud.
Piensa que estudiando este técnico es un gran paso para llegar a cumplir el sueño que tiene que es de  ser medica, es una mujer luchadora pues desde muy pequeña ha tenido que salir adelante por ella misma, muy joven quedo embarazada, y las personas le decían que no podía salir adelante y para ella fue todo lo contrario, su hija la impulso para no conformarse con el titulo de bachillerato.
Quiere demostrarse a si misma y a las personas que cuando se tiene la actitud y las ganas de salir adelante se puede lograr los objetivos.
En la actualidad vive con el esposo y la hija, el esposo no tiene muy buenos ingresos económicos y pro lo tanto no le puede colaborar con los gastos, por lo cual ella trabaja viernes, sábados y domingos en un asadero para poderse  pagar el estudio, ella le interesa el convenio kiva porque es una ayuda para tener mas facilidad en el pago.
texts.en:
Carolina is interested in studying to become a nurses aide. 

She has always been interested in everything to do with medicine because she likes to to help people and what is better than to help people than with something as important as their health. 

She thinks studying this field is a big step in accomplishing her dream of becoming a doctor. 

She is a fighter, from a very young age she has had to get ahead. At a young age she became pregnant and people told her that she would not be able to get ahead. 

For her it was the opposite, her daughter inspired her to not be satisfied with just a high school degree. 

She wants to prove to herself and others that when you have the attitude and the desire to get ahead, you can reach your goals. 

Currently she lives with her husband and daughter. Her husband does not have a great income and cannot help with household costs. 

Therefore she works on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays in a steakhouse to pay for her studies. 

She likes Kiva because it is a way to more easily help pay the costs.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 56-year-old father of three children.

To earn a living, for 19 years now, he has been buying and selling scrap materials. Although Ibrahim finished his university studies a long time ago, he is a Palestinian refugee, so he does not have sufficient access to the working sector. Thus, he found this profession to be the easiest one to provide his family with a good income to cover their needs.

He explains that he is a hard worker, who puts a great deal of effort into his work, but he feels pessimistic about his customers' false promises and distrust of him. He is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a new truck, which will help him improve his business and respond more easily to his customers’ needs. His future plans are to expand his business to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to improve his business and to better respond to his customers'  needs by purchasing a new truck.

loans.name: Souheir

texts.en:
Souheir is a 39-year-old married mother of two children. She is a Palestinian refugee living and working in a Palestinian camp just like almost all of the Palestinians living in Lebanon.
Souheir has been selling women's clothes for six years. In June 2012, she established her current business and she is working hard on developing it to meet her customers' needs and requests. Thus, for this reason she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a special Christmas and winter collection with especially extra large sizes to fulfill the ladies needs since big sizes are hard to find in the market.
Souheir also sells women's shoes in which she completes customers' needs in one place at the same time. She hopes that in the future she'll be capable of opening a bigger shop outside the camp.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a special Christmas and winter collection with especially extra large sizes to fulfill the ladies needs since big sizes are hard to find in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of yams for supply, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Meet John, a happy farmer living in Nyamira with his wife and six children.  He has been farming for 15 years where he produces and sells milk, eggs and tea and he also has a retail shop in the local area that fetches him more income seeing that he has a big family to feed.  He loves tea farming because it fetches him more income.

John chose Juhudi Kilimo because from other farmer's testimonials he learned that Juhudi works closely with their farmers.  This loan will enable him to purchase a dairy cow that will bring in more income and thus he will be able to feed his family and also provide a better education for his children.

loans.use: For purchasing a dairy cow.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 34-year-old, married man, who has been working as a carpenter since thirteen years ago. He is a hardworking man, well-known in his region for the special quality he produces and his special prices.

Omar is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a special, newly-released saw. This particular saw is important for developing his business, and for producing high-quality, requested products.

He hopes that in the future he will work on developing his business more, by buying a mini-truck. He needs a vehicle of this kind, in addition to his required business tools. He would use it to transport wood from the market, and finished work to his customers.

loans.use: to buy a particular, special, newly-released saw.

loans.name: Bassima

texts.en:
Bassima is a 56-year-old, married mother of five children. She has been working in a beauty salon since 1997. She is a hard worker, who puts much effort into helping her husband to earn their living and cover their family’s increasing needs.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua. She will use the loan to buy a new massage machine. The machine will help her develop her business and reply to her customers’ needs. She will also invest part of the loan to make urgent maintenance at her house, before the winter season.

She hopes that in the future, she’ll expand her business to a wider beauty salon. The expansion she hopes for would enable her to provide her customers with extra beauty services and facial treatments, to please them as much as she can.

loans.use: to buy a new massage machine and to perform urgent maintenance on her home.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is a 52-year-old married father of ten children. He has worked in an agricultural business since 1990 to make his living and cover his family’s expenses, since he is their sole breadwinner. Issa is an illiterate man; that's why he tries hard to help his children complete their education. In this way, he helps them to avoid facing the problems he faced.

Issa works in a rented plot of land with seven male employees who help him to plant and harvest it and sell what they produce. He is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to rent an agricultural plot of land to increase his production. Issa’s future plans are to improve his work and buy new machines that support his business.

loans.use: to rent an agricultural plot of land to increase his production.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis is a 39-year-old married man. He lives in Vanadzor, in the Lori region, with his wife and school-age daughter.

For more than 5 years, Sargis has run his own business. Specifically, he rents a stall where he sells fruits and vegetables. As you can imagine from the photo, he sells nice and tasty produce such as apples, grapes, persimmons, mandarins, kiwis, and pomegranates. Sargis buys all of his produce from the Vanadzor city wholesale market. Sargis’s stall is very rich, tasty and colorful.

He says that, on the whole, he is satisfied with his business's income, since he has many loyal customers who visit his stall everyday to make purchases. Even so, Sargis is asking for a loan in the amount of 400.000 AMD in order to enlarge his stall’s assortment of produce, since he expects an increase in demand with the coming Christmas and New Year’s holidays.

loans.use: to satisfy customer demand during the Christmas and New Year's holidays by increasing his stall's inventory

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is a 28-year-old married woman. She and her husband have four children. Her husband works as a motorcyclist.

To earn a living and to support her family, she sells different food items, such as rice, maize, flour and cooking oils for re-sale purposes. With the profits she expects to generate from her business as a result of the requested loan proceeds, she would like to expand and improve her business by reinvesting in the business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., rice, maize, flour and cooking oils) for re-sale.

loans.name: Marie Josee

texts.en: Marie Josee is 49 years old. She is married with four children. She has been selling different items in her store. With the loan, she wants to add more items such as rice, sugar and soap for sale. The profits will be reinvested in the business. Marie Josee was very happy with her previous loan which helped her to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Kushinga  Chikanga Group

texts.en: Mary buys and sells hair products for resale and she is in the brick moulding business in Mutare also.  She buys the hair products from South Africa and Mozambique.  Other group members are doing the same business.  Mary is the chairperson for the the group and is a widow with 4 children and one is of school going age.

loans.use: Needs to buy more hair products for resale.

loans.name: Sendy Yanira

texts.es:
Sendy, es casada, vive junto a su esposo en una casa de sus padres, se dedica a vender cereales y productos para el hogar, ella atiende sola el negocio y no le representa ninguna dificultad hacerlo.
Con el crédito comprara cereales, aceite, embutidos, huevos, maíz, frijol y arroz, con lo que podrá tener un negocio surtido para dar una buena  atención a sus clientes, espera atraer nuevos clientes, mejorar sus ventas y tener mejores ganancias para pagar las cuotas de su deuda, así como también seguir apoyando con los gastos de su hogar.
Sueña con tener un negocio más amplio para mejorar su economía para poder formar un patrimonio para su familia
texts.en:
Sendy is married and lives with her husband in her parents’ house. She works selling grains and household products. She works alone in the store and the business offers no difficulties.

She will use the loan to buy grains, oil, sausages, eggs, corn, beans and rice so that she will have a well stocked business in order to give good customer service to her customers. She hopes to attract new customers, improve her sales and have more income in order to pay the loan payments, as well as also helping with the household expenses.

She dreams of having a larger business in order to improve her income so she can build assets for her family.

loans.use: to buy grains, oil, sausages, eggs, corn, beans and rice

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed to meet the high demand.

loans.name: Jotham

texts.en: Jotham is 34-years-old. He is married with four children, who are between the ages of 6 and 11, and they all go to school. He sells shoes and has been selling shoes for the past four years. With the loan, he would like to buy more shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to expand the business and pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Mussamat

texts.en: Mussamat is a 44 year old vigorous lady and the mother of six children. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of lace, zippers and buttons to create a means for increasing revenues so she may able to generate a  healthier source of income. She is in her 4th loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 42 year old vigorous lady and mother of 3 children and she has been stitching clothes for 10 years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of lace, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fátima  es soltera no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres no aporta con ningun pago ya que ella corre con todos sus gastos educativos. La casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella se encuentra estudiando la carrera de musica en la normal de El Alto, ella atiende el internet de sus hermanos mayores percibe un monto pequeño por sus servicios, ademas aprovecha y vende sandwiches de carnes frias y refrescos. Asi cubre con sus gastos.
El crédito lo requiere para  la compra instrumentos musicales (quena, zampoña, guitarra) que le pidieron los catedraticos de su carrera.
El sueño de Fátima es realizar un diplomado en su carrera.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Fátima is single and has no children.  She lives with her parents and does not pay them anything since she pays all of her own education costs.  The house is located in the Rio Seco area of the city of El Alto.

She is studying music at the normal school in El Alto.  She manages the internet for her older brothers and receives a small payment for her services.  She also sells cold meat sandwiches and drinks to cover her costs.

She is requesting this loan to purchase musical instruments (traditional flute, pan flute, guitar) that her professors require.  Fatima's dream is to get a degree in her major.  This is the second time she has requested a loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a traditional flute, pan flute, and a guitar to continue her music education.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina  es casada tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos ya son casados y su hijo menor termino el colegio el año pasado (2013; vive en casa propia (con sus nietos, hijos), la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Bautista Saavedra de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio solo hasta el tercero de primaria ya que ella proviene del area rural, se dedica a la elaboracion de mantas, ademas tienen un ingreso por su movilidad de ttransporte de pasajeros, la misma que la maneja su hijo.
El crédito lo requiere para  la compra de material de construccion (ladrillos, arena, cemento) ya que construirá una habitacion, asi tendra mayor espacio.
El sueño de Justina es acabar de construir su casa y que en la casa cada uno de sus hijos tenga su propio departamento.
Es la cuarta ez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA
texts.en:
Justina is married and has three children. Two of the children are married while the youngest just finished school last year. Justina owns the house where she lives with her children and grandchildren. The house is in the Bautista Saavedra area of El Alto city.

Justina only completed up to third grade of primary school as she comes from a rural area. She now makes a living producing blankets and also has an income from the public transport services she offers, a business which her son runs.

Justina needs this loan to buy bricks, sand and cement to build another room in her house. She will then have more space.

Justina's dream is to finish building her house and for each of her children to have their own apartment.

This is the fourth time that Justina has applied for a loan with IMPRO, and the second time she has done so with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand and cement to build another room in her house and provide her family with more comfort.

loans.name: Ruth Maritza

texts.es:
Ruth Maritza tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, cerveza y otros productos, es una madre emprendedora ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra a abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ruth Martinez is 37 years old and lives with her children in the Oyotún district.  Oyotún's residents work in agriculture, retail and livestock.  It is located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

She works selling groceries, beer and other products.  She is an entrepreneurial mother.  She has requested a loan of 3000 nuevos soles to purchase groceries to stock her business, so she can increase her earnings for her family.

loans.use: purchase groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
María del Pilar tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de belleza desde hace tres años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 200 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María del Pilar is 25 years old and lives with her husband and their children in the Cayaltí district.  Its residents work in agriculture, retail and cattle-raising.  It is located in the Chiclayo province which belongs to the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.  

She has worked selling clothing and beauty products for the past three years.  Her business is located in her home.  She is seeking a loan of 1200 nuevos soles to purchase merchandise to stock her business and increase her earnings for her family.

loans.use: purchase seasonal clothing for children, women and men.

loans.name: Almardon

texts.ru:
Алмардон родился в районе Кубадиён и по сей день живет там с женой и двумя детьми. Ему 49 лет. У него среднее образование. Дети Алмардона уже подросли и зарабатывают себе на жизнь. Старший сын находится в России и работаем там.   
В настоящее время Алмардон вместе с женой занимаются купле-продажей скота. Данный бизнес они начали два года тому назад. Они в основном выращивают крупнорогатый скот, откармливают его в течение месяца и затем продают с наценкой на местном скотном рынке. Благодаря этому бизнесу Алмардон обеспечивает свою семью. Сейчас Алмардон просит кредит, чтобы закупить пару молодых бычков. Он хочет увеличить поголовье продаваемого скота и таким образом увеличить бюджет семьи.
texts.en:
Almardon was born in the Qubadiyon region and still lives there with his wife and two children. He is 49 years old and has a high school education. His children have already grown up and live independently. His eldest son is working in Russia. 

Almardon and his wife currently buy and sell cattle. They started a business two years ago. They primarily raise cattle, fatten them for a month, and then sell them at the local livestock market. Almardon is able to provide for his family thanks to this business. Now he is requesting a loan to purchase a pair of young bulls. He wants to sell more cattle and thus increase the family's budget.

loans.use: To purchase a pair of young bulls in order to sell more livestock and thus increase the family budget

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo, a 40-year-old married man, lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in motorcycle transportation and also does farming as a side income activity. He started the business in order to raise funds to look after his children and eradicate poverty. He faces a difficulty of poor roads that cause him constant mechanical breakdowns.

In spite of this, he desires to own more motorcycles and educate his children to higher institutions of learning. Deo intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: José Abel De Jesús

texts.es:
José de 67 años de edad,  es  casado convive junto a su esposa, estudio hasta sexto grado. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa que le apoya en la actividades agrícolas y en el ordeño de las vacas.

 José se dedica  a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres,  para llegar a la parcela camina 3  Km y trabajan durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde se dedica a cuidar las vacas que poseen.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una yunta de bueyes, que necesita para poder arar la tierra donde cultiva y podrá obtener un ingreso adicional por arar otras parcelas lo que le ayudara a mantener a su familia.

Su deseo es  comprar un terreno para sembrar y donde tener sus animales.
texts.en:
José, 67 years old, is married and lives with his wife. He studied until sixth grade. He gets up at 5 a.m. to farm and milk the cows, assisted by his wife.

José learned to be a farmer from his parents. In order to get to their plots of land, he and his wife walk 3 kilometers and work all morning. His wife also takes care of domestic tasks. In the afternoon they milk the cows they own.

He is requesting a loan to purchase a team of oxen that he needs to plow the land. This will enable him to earn extra income by plowing his neighbors’ plots and help him to support his family.

He wants to buy land in order to farm and keep animals.

loans.use: to purchase a team of oxen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: will buy more palm oil to resell.

loans.name: Lavdim

texts.en:
Lavdim is a 44-year-old married father of six children who lives in the south central part of the country. 

For the past nine years, his focus has been on agriculture and livestock activity. He has just returned from migration and has lived away for a very long time. While he was away his wife took care of the agricultural activities. 

He is requesting a loan because he needs to pay for the agricultural land certification documents. Kindly note that he cannot plant on this land without paying for the documents. Lavdim has been a long term client of VFA and has been consistent with the payments.

loans.use: to pay for the agricultural land certification registration documents

loans.name: Banabas

texts.en:
Banabas is a tea farmer aged twenty eight years old. He works three days in a week and gives the farming business an average of eight hours of work per day. His tea garden is located in a rural area in Kyamuhunga where he has been since 2009. 

He started the business with the objective of getting income to cater for his family. His major customer is the tea factory which buys all his tea. In addition to tea farming Barnabas also owns a butchery that gives him additional income which he uses to cater for the needs of his family.

He would like to use the loan money of two million (2,000,000) Ugandan shillings to buy fertilizer, so that he can boost the fertility of the soil and hence harvest more tea. 

He hopes to expand his business in future and he believes that then his profits will be much more than what he gets presently. Unfavourable weather is his major challenge since this affects his gardens, especially in the rainy season. But despite the challenges he faces now, he is hopeful that he will beat the odds and make money from growing and selling tea.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María de 69 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado y es una persona acompañada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. María se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposo, para realizar sus actividades comerciales.

María se dedica a la venta de frutas de temporada, oficio que le  enseño su madre, durante el día vende en el mercado de la localidad y su esposo trabaja en las parcelas, camina 3 K.m. para llegar y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedica a recolectar frutas para que su esposa lleve a vender el siguiente día. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar un puesto en el mercado, ya que actualmente ofrece los productos en la calle y eso le dificulta, ya que si le sobra producto tiene que llevarla nuevamente a su vivienda

 María espera, que con los ingresos que obtiene de venta de frutas  y  de la siembra,  arreglar el techo de su vivienda ya que en la temporada de invierno se filtra el agua y le daña la mercadería.
texts.en:
María is 69 years old and studied up to sixth grade. She is married - her husband works as a farmer. María gets up with her husband at 5am in order to carry out her daily activities. 

María makes a living selling seasonal fruits, a trade that she learned from her mother. María spends the day selling her goods at the local market while her husband is working on their plots of land. María's husband must walk three kilometres to arrive at the land and, in the afternoon, he collects the fruits that his wife will sell at the market the following day.

María is applying for a loan from CrediCampo in order to pay for a stall at the market. María currently sells her goods in the street and this is difficult as, if she has stock leftover at the end of the day, she must carry it home again.

María hopes that - with her income from growing and selling fruit - she will be able to repair the roof of her home. During the winter season water leaks through it and damages her stock.

loans.use: to buy a stall at the market.

loans.name: Guralie

texts.en: Guralie did repairs to their family home with the previous loan and now her husband who has been working in the construction field, needed to buy some relevant tools for his profession.

loans.use: To buy construction tools for her husband who does construction work

loans.name: Ivica

texts.en:
Ivica is 33 years old, single and lives in one of the minority communities with his parents, who both receive a pension. Ivica works hard and is employed in a municipality. He also raises pigs, and now he would like to start his own agricultural business since he already owns some land that he would be able to plant corn and wheat on. In order to start this business, Ivica will need a loan to purchase a tractor. 

He believes that adding this type of agricultural business to his routine will provide much profit and additional income in order to save for his future. He will be able to also work on the land of others in the area for a fee as well. By working hard and with various sources of income, Ivica hopes to provide better living conditions for his family. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase a tractor

loans.name: Juan Aristides

texts.es: Juan de 35 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos de 16 años, 12 años, 8 años, y 4 años de edad. Juan trabaja como albañil, dicho oficio es el que el que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia  y mantener la economía de su hogar. Su vivienda es su principal patrimonio y futura herencia para sus hijos por lo que con mucho esfuerzo va mejorando. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios (arena, cemento y grava) para pavimentar el piso del corredor de la vivienda ya que actualmente es de tierra y cuando llueve se hace lodo  e imposibilita el paso.
texts.en: Juan is 35 years old. He lives in his own home together with his life partner and his children who are 16, 12, 8 and 4 years old. Juan works as a mason and this profession is what allows him to provide sustenance to his family and to maintain his household economy. He owns his own home which his children will inherit in the future that he works very hard on to improve. He is seeking a credit from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of the necessary materials (sand, cement and gravel) to pave the floors in the halls of his home because they are currently made of  dirt and when it rains they turn to mud and are impossible to pass through.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and gravel to pave the floors in the halls of his home.

loans.name: Rahman

texts.en: Rahman is 52 year-old married man. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar region. Rahman lives in the country-side and has good opportunities to expand his business, which is livestock and farming. For more than 15 years he has been a farmer and has a great deal of experience. His livestock is always in good health and so Rahman has many regular clients. He wants to expand his business and have higher monthly profits. He is requesting a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase more livestock. He plans to use the profits from the loan to improve his living situation.This is going to be his 1st loan. Rahman hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Majukumu Group

texts.en:
Evergeline, who is in her late 30s, is single with one daughter who is still going to school.  She has been selling different types of clothes for three years now.  She works from 8 am to 8 pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Evergeline's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase the stock of clothing, and has paid back all her loans successfully. 

She used the profit to cover household expenses and saved some in her bank account.  

She will use this loan to buy clothes of different types to sell at Christmas time.  She is so happy with the loan.  She dreams of owning a big clothes shop.

Evergeline will share this loan with her loan group "MAJUKUMU"; the two members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes of different types to sell  at Christmas time

loans.name: Temboni Group

texts.en:
Catherine, who is in her early 30s, is married with two daughters who are still at school.  She has been a food vendor for three years how.  She works from 6 am to 9 pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Catherine's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy cooking oil, baking flour, and maize flour.  She has successfully paid back her loan.  She used the profit to pay for school fees and to buy small items for the food store. 

She is doing great and happy with the loan. She will use this loan to buy rice, maize flour, beans, salt, onions, and charcoal.  

She dreams of being an international businesswoman.

Catherine will share this loan with her loan group "TEMBONI"; the three members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize flour, beans, salt, onions, and charcoal.

loans.name: Vigen

texts.en:
Vigen is a 24-year-old living in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. Vigen lives with his parents and with his younger brother. Vigen’s parents are engaged in the farming and agriculture business. His older brother is already married and lives separately with his family.

Vigen and his younger brother work at the gas station. Vigen also specializes in cooking, which he did for several years to earn a living. Then he went abroad to work for the Russian Federation. But he recently got married and, in order to stay with his family, he left that profession.

Vigen has a very nice and pretty wife, who is soon giving birth to a baby. Vigen explains that he is unbelievably happy and impatient for their baby to be born. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 250,000 AMD in order to buy clothes, a crib, and other necessities for his baby.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, a crib, and other necessities for his baby

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en: Joseline is 39 years old. She is married to a house builder and they have both four children. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past ten years. She wants the loan to buy more clothes commonly known as bitenge for ladies. She plans to use the profits for reinvesting in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emelienne

texts.en: Emelienne is 59 years old. She is a widow with three children. She sells bananas and she has requested the loan to buy more bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business. She is very happy for the previous loan, which helped in boosting the business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Mayram

texts.en:
This young and pretty lady lives in the village of Norashen, in Gegharkunik region. Mayram lives with her parents and her brother. She is 24 years of age, and unfortunately, her family has not enough resources to provide for her to have higher education. Right now, she is attending some computer courses, with the hope that in the near future she will manage to find some convenient job. Mayram’s brother is a hired worker. Her mother is a housewife, and at the same time she runs their farming and agricultural activities. In their farm they have five cows, three calves, two bulls, twenty sheep, a horse, five beehives and twenty chickens.

Unfortunately, Mayram’s father has serious problems connected with his heart, and at this moment, he is incapacitated. The doctor is sure that he needs heart surgery. So her mother does all the farming activities herself, and Mayram tries somehow to help her mother. Their farm products (dairy products, meat, eggs and honey) they sell through the re-sellers, and the income from this is used for their family's needs, which are a lot at this moment.

Mayram asks a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams. She plans to use it for her father’s heart surgery, which is very urgent for her father.

loans.use: to pay for her father’s heart surgery.

loans.name: Carine

texts.en: Carine is aged 41. She is married to a driver and has been selling clothes for the past ten years. With the loan, she wants to buy more cloths for ladies to sell. She plans to use the profits for expanding her business and saving for a better future. Carine has progressively transformed her business as well her life from the business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 50-years-old. She is a mother of eight children, and they all go to school. She sells local breweries; she has spent five years in the business. She has requested a loan to buy more local breweries for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more local breweries for sale

loans.name: Tekla

texts.en: This is Tekla, who is 18-years-old and lives in Kutaisi.  Her parents and brother live together with her. The only income for the family is her father's war veterans' pension of 122 GEL. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no source of income and live in under the poverty level. As a result of  the above mentioned situation,Tekla lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Tekla to get a loan of $3,000 to start a trading business.  She will purchase stock such as snacks, chewing gums, soft drinks and other food products. She has already rented a place where the store will be located. Tekla thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a great location. After the general store is opened, the family will have a stable income which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future.  With the support of the Start Up program, Tekla will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: To open a mini-store

loans.name: Theimuraz

texts.en: Theimuraz is a 30-year-old young man, who has his own family: a wife and two small children. One of them goes to school and the other goes to kindergarten. His wife is a housekeeper and looks after her babies. Theimuraz is unemployed at the moment. As he can’t find a job, he decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Theimuraz applied for credit from MFO Credo (Micro Finance Organization Credo). His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $2000 will help Theimuraz to purchase a secondhand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them inter-city. Theimuraz is a very enthusiastic and hard-working person with a great desire to ensure that his children have a good education for progressing in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Theimuraz is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a married woman, age 63, with 10 children.  She lives on the outskirt of Kyotera town with her husband and four grandchildren for whom she pays school fees. She deals in charcoal selling and a beer business; she supplements her income with agriculture, where she grows maize, beans, and banana plantations.

She started her businesses in 2003; she works 7 days a week. Margret started this business to get enough food for the family and pay school fees for her grandchildren. 

She has acquired this loan to boost the business and buy beer, since  the Christmas season demand for beer is high. 

She said her clients are local people from around and nearby villages.

Her hopes for the future are to be the leading supplier of beer within her area, and to educate her children.  The challenge she faces is lack of enough capital for the business. 

She describes herself as an honest and hard working lady, and encourages other clients to apply for loans to develop themselves.

loans.use: To buy beer to sell

loans.name: Colette

texts.en: Colette is a Cameroonian aged forty-nine and married with two children. The older child is fifteen-years-old and the younger is thirteen and both are in secondary school. She has been in this business for the past nine years which makes her very experienced and stable. Her business is is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase her profit by 35 percent and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy raw food to cook and sell.

loans.name: Beaular Heights Group

texts.en:
Queen is into buying and selling of groceries and electric good. She buys from South Africa, Botswana, and Zambia, depending on the amount and type of order she needs. All the other group members are doing the same business as that of the chairperson.

Queen is still single, and looking after two dependents.

She is also into farming and poultry business, though at a small scale.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and electrical goods from South Africa to sell.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 31-year-old married woman living with her spouse and 3 children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a vendor and sells fruit in their hometown. He goes to the fruit market daily to buy fresh fruit. He is very famous in the community due to the freshness of his fruit. He has been selling fruit for many years, and because of this he understands the needs of his customers. To cope with the demand, Safia requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more fruit, especially oranges.

Safia is very thankful to Kiva and the Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fruit for resale.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina  es casada (su esposo regresó del exterior y ahora viven juntos); tiene 2 hijos, el mayor ya termino sus estudios secundarios y su hija menor tiene 9 meses, viven en la casa de sus suegros la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Bolivar de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella solo estidio hasta el nivel primario, se dedica a la venta de golosinas y refrescos en un kiosco que tiene, su esposo es chofer interdepartamental el solo llega una vez al mes a su casa.
El crédito lo requiere para  la compra la compra de material de construccion ya que realizara refacciones en los techos y paredes de la vivienda por que se aproxima la epoca de lluvias. Necesita comprar calaminas, clavos, cemento y estuco.
El sueño de Ctalina es tener su casa propia.
Es la sexta  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Catalina is married (her husband returned from abroad and now they live together). She has two children. Her eldest child just finished high school and her young daughter is 9 months old. They live in the home of her in-laws which is located in the Villa Bolivar zone of the city of El Alto. Catalina only studied through primary school. She works selling candies and refreshments from a kiosk that she has. Her husband is an interstate driver and he only stays at their home once a month. Catalina is seeking this loan to purchase construction materials because she needs to make repairs to the ceilings and walls of her home soon because the rainy season is approaching. She needs to purchase roofing, nails, cement and stucco. Catalina's dream is to have her own home. This is the sixth time that she is seeking a loan through IMPRO and the third time through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase roofing, nails, cement and stucco to repair the ceilings and walls of the home where she lives before the rainy season begins.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol  is a single mother of two children and all her children go to school. She has a business of selling airtime and has a pay phone and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more airtime and also load airtime for her pay phone. 

She generates additional income from selling tomatoes. She works near the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She aspires to invest in used clothes and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To  buy airtime and  also to load airtime for her pay phone.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a single mother of three children and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

She has had a business of a restaurant for five years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, cooking oil, beans, cassava, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes. 

She works in a market and sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a big hotel and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more  bunches of green bananas, beef, cooking oil, beans, cassava, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en:
Lukia is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (cousin).

Lukia has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for a few months. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and bags of bread. She works in the shop six days out of every week and sells on retail basis only.

Lukia also generates additional income from selling piped water. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and ever increasing prices of commodities. 

Lukia is aspiring of owning a wholesale shop and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and bags of bread.

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
Ana Maribel tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores cerdos, carneros y cuyes en la parte posterior a su domicilio, se dedica a esta labor para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Maribel is 40 years old and lives with her husband in the Cayaltí district.  Its residents work in agriculture, retail and cattle-raising.  It is located in the Chiclayo province which is in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.  

She works raising and selling small animals such as: pigs, rams and guinea pigs in the back of her house.  She works in this business to hep her husband with their household expenses.  She has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase  animal feed to fatten her animals in order to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: purchase feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

Mwaka has operated a charcoal selling business for the past 4 years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She cites price fluctuation and seasonality as her major challenges.
