With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Liszy Estefani

texts.es:
Liszy Estefani, es una mujer de 19 años emprendedora, luchadora, con ganas se salir adelante y   desde muy pequeña tiene la expectativa  de estudiar Medicina o alguna carrera relacionada con la salud porque siempre le a gustado ayudarle a los demás y  siente que es la vocación de ella, en el 2012 se graduó de bachiller y  no pudo ingresar a estudiar Medicina puesto que no tenía  los recursos necesarios para conseguir todo el dinero  que  se necesita, entonces quiso estudiar enfermería y escogió este prestigioso instituto  porque le pareció un excelente lugar; pero no logró inscribirse en el primer semestre porque no tenía la plata de la matrícula, ni de la pensión, además ella tiene una niña de 2 años  y no  consiguió  quien la cuidara mientras ella estudiaba, por ello no puede trabajar y no tiene los recursos suficientes para pagar la carrera ; mientras tanto los papas y el novio le ayudan con los gastos de ella y la bebe; por otro lado la mama trabaja por días y hace lo posible para ahorrar y conseguir el dinero para que la hija  pueda cumplir el sueño.
Liszy Estefani  logro ingresar a estudiar auxiliar de enfermería.  Ya pasando seis meses Liszy pudo cursar el primer semestre de auxiliar de enfermería, esta muy feliz porque ya casi puede lograr la meta que tiene, a aprendido muchas cosas sobres los cuidados, las protecciones y como ser una buena enfermera; gracias a el convenio que le a brindado kiva con el descuento  a podido pagar el estudio y así cada vez llegar mas cerca a cumplir los sueños.
Liszy Estefani  quiere ser alguien en la vida, quiere salir adelante y sacar adelante a la hija y  que  ella se sienta  orgullosa de la madre…
 
…Muchas Gracias...
texts.en:
Liszy Estefani is a 19 year old, entrepreneurial fighter with a desire to get ahead.  From a young age, she wanted to study medicine or another career in the health field because she always liked helping others, and believes that it is the career for her.  In 2012, she graduated from high school but was not able to enroll in medical school because she did not have the necessary resources to put together the money she needed.  Instead, she decided to study nursing and chose this prestigious institution because it seemed like a great place.  However, she was not able to enroll in her first semester because she did not have enough money for tuition or room and board.  She also has a two year old daughter, and was not able to find anyone to take care of her while she was in school.  She is not able to work and does not have the sufficient funds to pay for her education.  Meanwhile, her parents and her boyfriend help her with her and her child's expenses.  Her mother works during the day and tries her best to save and earn enough money to make her daughter's dream possible.

Liszy Estefani was able to enter school to become a nursing assistant.  After six months, she was able complete her first semester of nursing assistant school.  She is very happy because she is close to reaching her goal.  She has learned many things about precautions, protections and how to be a good nurse.  Thanks to the agreement with Kiva for the discount, she has been able to pay for her education, and continue to get closer to reaching her dreams.  Liszy Estefani wants to be somebody in life, wants to get ahead, and get her daughter ahead and make her proud of her mother.  Thank you very much.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Jeimmy

texts.es:
Es una joven de 24 años que desea estudiar  salud oral ya que le llama la atención por  lo general  la medicina y ve por este medio como ayudar en la salud oral de las personas para que así puedan mantener una gran sonrisa.
Quiere como objetivo lograr en un futuro especializare en esta rama, aprender mas  y ser excelente en su profesión.
Con eso mismo también lograr los objetivos personales familiares y profesionales ya  que aspira a inculcar también a la familia y  a las personas que la rodean, lo importante que es mantener una buena salud oral, realmente quiere aprender  y enseñar  todos los conocimientos .
Quiere desempeñarse muy bien laboralmente y demostar que realmente hace muy bien lo que le gusta y asi  ofrecer  un excelente servicio a la comunidad
Necesita el convenio con kiva  ya que económicamente no cuenta con muchos recursos económicos, ya que tiene otros compromisos , gastos etc, por eso mismo necesita de este convenio para que le colabore con un descuento y asi le quede mas cómodo  para financiar la carrera.
texts.en:
Jeimmy is a 24-year-old young woman who wants to study oral health because she is interested in medicine in general; by this means she sees a way to help with people's oral health so that they can maintain a great smile.

Her objective is to be able to specialize in this area in the future, to learn more and to be excellent in her profession. She also wants to achieve her personal, family and professional objectives, as she aspires to impress upon her family and the people around her how important it is to maintain good oral health. She really wants to learn and pass on all of her knowledge. She wants to perform very well in her work and to demonstrate that she really does what she likes very well, thus offering an excellent service to the community.

She needs this arrangement with Kiva, as financially she doesn't have a lot of resources since she has other commitments, expenses, etc. This is why she needs this arrangement, so she can get a discount. In this way it will be more comfortable for her to finance her education.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dried fish to expand their business.

loans.name: Sanyu Development Group

texts.en:
Madina is a 40-year-old resident of Kyengera. She is widowed with four children and is a member of the Sanyu Development Group. 

Madina is a market vendor who sells different agricultural products such as carrots, oranges, and green onions among others. With this kind of business, she has been able to educate her children, buy a small piece of land, and constructed a house for her family although it is not yet complete. Therefore, Madina needs a loan to complete the construction of her house.

loans.use: to complete her residential house.

loans.name: Wito Group

texts.en:
Warioba, who is in his late 40s, is married and has four children who are still going to school. He has been running a business, selling livestock, since 1989. He works from 4:00am to 9:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Warioba's 19th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the number of his livestock. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profits to pay school fees and to start building his house. He appreciates the loans, which have made his life really successful. He dreams of building his house.

He will use this current loan to buy livestock and meet his customers' demand. Warioba will share this loan with his loan group, Wito, which has seven members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy and sell more livestock

loans.name: Glenda Patricia

texts.es:
Glenda de 41 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, trabaja como panadera, en esfuerzo conjunto con su esposo y dos de sus hijos.

Tiene ya dos años de trabajar en el negocio propio, pero de experiencia tiene más tiempo, pues trabajó muchos años en otras empresas panificadoras.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar materia prima para elaborar pan dulce, tal como: azúcar, sal, huevos, colorantes artificiales para alimento, levadura, harina y equipo de trabajo, ya que en época navideña es muy grande la demanda.

En un futuro Glenda le gustaría tener una panadería reconocida por la calidad de su producto, tener una mayor venta y del negocio mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Glenda is 41 years old. She is married and she has three children. She works as a bread baker, an effort she undertakes together with her husband and two of their children. She has spent two years working on her own business, but she has even more experience in the past because she worked for many years in other bakeries. This loan will be used for the purchase of primary materials to make sweet breads like: sugar, salt, eggs, food coloring, leavening, flour and work equipment because there is a lot of demand during the Christmas season.

In the future Glenda would like to have a bakery that is recognized for the quality of its product and to increase her sales from the business to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, eggs, food coloring, leavening, flour and work equipment.

loans.name: Lucie Brigitte Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a Cameroonian, aged forty-eight. She is divorced and has seven children. The oldest is nineteen and in high school, while the youngest is nine and in primary school.

Florence has been in her current business for seven months, which makes her experienced and stable. Her business is likely to succeed, because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase her profit by ten percent. Her standard of living will be improved.

loans.use: To buy food to cook and sell at her restaurant

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a Cameroonian, aged fifty-two and married with five children. The oldest is seventeen in high school, while the youngest is five in primary school. He has been in this business for the past ten years which makes him very experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase his turnover by thirty percent. His standard of living will be improved as well.

loans.use: to buy stuff (powdered soup, soft drinks, beers, biscuits, etc.)

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal APU KCAMER, el banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Huarqui en el distrito de Coya, provincia de Calca, departamento de Cusco.
El socio Daniel continua trabajando como albañil para las distintas obras que solicitan sus servicios, él socio es una persona responsable, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este trabajo el cual le trae satisfacciones personales y economicas, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas como combo,brochas,reglas de madera entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido con los inversionistas de kiva y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Daniel is a member of the communal bank, APU KCAMER. The bank is located in the community of Huarqqui in the Coya district in the province of Calca, in the department of Cusco. Daniel continues to work as a mason on different projects that solicit his services. He is a responsible person and has spent a long time dedicated to this work which brings him both personal and economic satisfaction. Daniel desires to be able to continue working this way so he can continue supporting his family. Daniel is seeking a loan to purchase tools like a sledgehammer, brushes and wooden rulers, among other items. He is grateful to the Kiva investors and he promises to comply with his established payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase tools like a sledgehammer, brushes and wooden rulers, among others.

loans.name: Eneyda Solans

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “APU KAMER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Eneida Solans, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de crianza de cuyes, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos en las distintas ferias que se realizan , la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eneyda Solans belongs to the "Apu Kamer" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Coya in the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.

Eneyda Solans continues making a living from the business of raising guinea pigs. She has had this business for years, and it is going well thanks to her daily dedication to her business. She raises these small animals to then sell them in the various markets in her area. She is a responsible and dedicated person. 

Eneyda Solans wants to keep working in order to keep supporting her family in this manner. She is asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs. She feels grateful for the loan and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She is married with three children, all of whom go to school.

Dama sells goat meat to various butcheries and hotels. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil, a father of three, has been photographed with his cow. He has been in Greece for long time and came back to Albania from there when financial troubles became known in our neighbor country. In Greece, he did seasonal work in construction, and he has been practicing the same skills in his village in addition to livestock and agricultural activities. 

Vasil has been selling raw milk to a nearby dairy farm and now he wants to invest in buying some baby calves from a good breed. He says “I want to expend the livestock activity, it is worthwhile it. Albanians consume lots of dairy products, hence it is easy to sell the produce and make a good income from it in return."

loans.use: to buy baby calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, zinc, nails, and locker doors for resale.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in Tbilisi city, Georgia. She lives with her two sons and daughter. Lia's husband lives abroad and the only source of income for her is the transferred money from him. One of her sons works as an artisan with private orders, which generates 300 GEL monthly. 

Lia has great desire to be involved in her own activity and has requested a loan. Lia's application was approved within the start-up program, which enables people to start or re-start businesses. With the loan 1200 USD, Lia will purchase stock of used shoes and start trading. It will give her chance to make her own income and gain financial independence. Lia is grateful to all Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: to purchase stock of used shoes and start trading

loans.name: Sanene Group

texts.en:
Sharifa, who is in her mid-40s, is married and has four, grown-up children. She has been running two businesses, selling clothes and selling broiler chickens (which are for meat, not for eggs). She has been in these businesses for five years. She works from 6:00am to 8:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sharifa's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep increasing her stock of clothes, and to buy chicks to raise for broiler chicken. She has successfully paid back her loans. She used the profits to pay school fees and household expenses. She is doing great with the loans. She will use this new loan to buy clothes to resell and chicken feed for the broilers. She dreams of building her own house.

Sharifa will share this loan with her loan group, Sanene, which has four members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell and chicken feed for raising broilers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and drinks to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more motor bikes, spare part and motor oil, and different kind of machine spare parts.

loans.name: Ibrahim        S

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Ibrahim from Masuba Makeni, Northern area in Sierra Leone. He is divorced and has 1 child aged 6 years, who is currently attending school. 

In 2010, Ibrahim established his electrical business. He was a sales assistant to his brother but when the shop was closed, he could not get employment elsewhere, so he decided to run his own business out of the little savings he made. Ibrahim works at the business 6 days per week, from 7:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. He says that the main challenge to his business is the high cost of transportation.

Ibrahim requires a loan in order to buy more chargers, extensions and cables for resale. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to renovate his house and increase his business. In the future, Ibrahim plans to build a permanent business place. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more chargers, extensions and cables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more motor bike spare parts, motor oil and different kinds of machine spare parts

loans.name: Sinneh

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Sinneh from Masuba, Makeni northern area in Sierra Leone. He is married with four children between the ages of 3 years and 16 years. One of his children is attending school. 

Sinneh runs a general stock business; He sells bags of rice, flour, and sugar. He has been running this business since 2010. He works at the business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week. Sinneh says that the main challenges to his business is price inflation.

Sinneh has requested a loan to buy more bags of rice, flour, and sugar for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow him to become a successful business man and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Sinneh plans to expand his business more than ever. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, flour, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, eggs and chickens, among other items

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a first time borrower applying for a loan of 5,000,000 UGX. He is single and stays in Banda next to Kyambogo University. He has a poultry farm project which he has been engaged in for two years. He says he has a ready market for his eggs and a broiler in the Banda area and finds no problem with supply. Thomas’s client demand has increased but he is unable to meet them; therefore, he is applying for a loan to expand his poultry house so that he is able to meet all of the demands of his customers. He has been able to contribute to his community through providing jobs at the poultry house to a few young, jobless Ugandans. He is hard working and focused.

loans.use: to expand his poultry house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases more pure water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a first time borrower applying for a loan of UGX 1,500,000. She is married and has one child. Evelyn stays in the city outskirts and sells phones in Wandegeya, near Makerere University.  She has customers since she is on a highway with a ready market of university students. 

Evelyn wants to bring in more phones from China but has inadequate capital. She is therefore applying for a loan to stock for the coming season (semester two) that is yet to begin. Evelyn predicts that her profits are going to rise with the help of the loan. She proposes to open up another branch within Kampala.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Mariama from Masuba northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children. 

In 2007, Mariama established her retail business. She is a shopkeeper; she began her business because she was motivated by her colleague to run her personal business. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a poor road network towards her area of operation.

Mariama requires a loan to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business. 

She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. 

In the future, Mariama plans to expand her business beyond expectations. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of paddy rice from the farmer, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Las 19 integrantes de este comité son mujeres muy trabajadoras, que han visto una gran oportunidad para ella y sus familias por medio del programa de comité de mujeres.
Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Leida, quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas en general, y es por medio de este trabajo que ayuda a su familia, y tiene los ingresos que necesita para poder darles todo lo que ella no pude tener. Comenta que son los fines de semana cuando más venta tiene, y que siempre quiere estar surtida para poder dar a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
Leida pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas varias, que le permitirá seguir con sus ventas, a la vez que lucha por mejorar y crecer. Agradecen todas por la ayuda que están recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The 19 members of this committee are extremely hardworking women. They see the Women's Committee Program as a great opportunity for themselves and their families.

One of these women is Sra. Leida, who sells beverages. Through her work, she is able to help her family and have the income she needs in order to give them everything that she was not able to have. Leida says that the weekends are when she sells the most, so she always wants to be stocked in order to provide what her customers need.

Leida is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of various beverages. This will enable her to continue her sales as she strives to improve and grow. All of the members appreciate the assistance that has been given to them so that they can continue growing.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels allowing her to sell greater quantities of washing powder, sachets of Milo, milk powder, tin milk, biscuits, and candies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of ingredients to improve her overall "Red-Red" sales.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old and has five children, three of whom are in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Gina requested a 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gina has been in business for eight years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 64 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a buying and selling of nipa roofing material (palm fronds) in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa to sell.

Esperanza has been in this business for 25 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa (palm fronds for roofing) to sell

loans.name: Moriza

texts.en:
Moriza is 25 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Moriza has a general store business in the Philippines. Moriza requested a 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional household items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc.

Moriza has been in this business for one year. In the future, Moriza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional household items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional plantains and peppers for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plantains for her business.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is a young Cameroonian, aged thirty and single, without a child. He has been in this business for over seven years, which makes him very experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed, because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase his turnover by fifteen percent. His standard of living will be improved, as well.

loans.use: to buy plastic utensils for resale

loans.name: Anali

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “APU KAMER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Anali continua con su negocio de restaurant, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende diferentes tipos de platos como arroz con pollo, saltado entre otros, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de libreria, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa  siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el restaurant como arroz y aceite.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Anali is a member of the communal bank "APU KAMER." The bank is located in the district of Coya which is part of the province of Calca, in the department of Cusco. Anali continues with her restaurant business. She is successful with her business which is going well thanks to the effort that the puts into it everyday. She sells different kinds of meals, like rice with chicken and stir fried meat and potatoes, among others. At the same time she continues working for a bookstore. Anali is a responsible and entrepreneurial person and through these means she gets her family ahead. She is seeking a loan to purchase supplies for her restaurant like rice and oil. She is happy because of the loan and she promises to comply with her payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her restaurant like rice and oil.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “APU KAMER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Josefina; La socia continua con su negocio de venta de artesania, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende mantas y telares a sus clientes que le solicitan su mercaderia, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mantas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Josefina belongs to the "Apu Kamer" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Coya in the province of Calca and department of Cusco.

Josefina continues with her business selling handicrafts. She has had this business for years and it is going well thanks to her daily dedication to her business. She sells blankets and looms to her customers, who request her merchandise.

Josefina wants to be able to keep working in order to keep supporting her family in this manner. She is asking for the loan to buy blankets for her business. She feels grateful for the loan and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy blankets for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more medical drugs for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, bitter balls, peppers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Kadiatu from O I C Ropolo, Makeni northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with eight children. 

In 2003, Kadiau established her retail business. She began her business so that she would be able to take care of her family's welfare. She works at the business for 10 hours per day and six days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan to purchase more onions and general stock to sell. 

She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more onions and general stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pure water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of onions for resale.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlos  de 53 años de edad, es  casado convive junto a su esposa, estudio hasta sexto grado. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa que le apoya en la actividades agrícolas y en el ordeño de las vacas.

Carlos se dedica  a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres;  para llegar a la parcela camina 5  Km y trabajan durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde se dedica a cuidar las vacas que poseen.


	El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una vaca que necesita para incrementar la producción de leche para la venta y obtener mejores ingresos. 

Su meta es que con los ingresos que persiva, ahorrar para  comprar un terreno para sembrar y donde tener sus animales.
texts.en: Carlos is 53 years old. He is married and he lives with his wife. He studied up to the sixth grade in school. He gets up at 5:00 am each day together with his wife who supports their agricultural activities and helps milk the cows. Carlos is a farmer, a trade that he leaned from his parents. He walks 5 kilometers to arrive at his parcel and he works in the morning while his wife works on the household chores. In the afternoon he works caring for his cows. The loan he is seeking through CREDICAMPO is to purchase a cow that he needs to increase his production of milk for sale so he can obtain higher earnings. His goal is to save the earnings to use to purchase land for planting and housing his animals.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more medical drugs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Ibrahim from O I C, Ropolo, Makein northern area in Sierra Leone. He is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 12 years. Two of his children are currently attending school. 

In 2003, Ibrahim established a food items business. He began his business because he wanted to create a permanent source of income to support the home. He works at the business 14 hours per day, 6 days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business is the road traffic, and sometime the onions spoiled.

Ibrahim requires a loan to buy more bags of onions to sell.

He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to buy a freezer to improve his family's standard of living and increase his business. 

In the future, Ibrahim plans to opening other outlet. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of onions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different kinds of grains such as beans, maize, corn, groundnuts and gari, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased quantities of tinned milk, biscuits, different types of bathing and washing soap, tinned fishes, and tinned tomatoes.

loans.name: Nonvitcha Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVITCHA est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Akouvi Rita, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Akouvi Rita est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un certain Mohamed. Le couple n'a pas encore d'enfant. Akouvi Rita vit ensemble avec son mari. Il y a près de dix sept ans que Akouvi Rita mène comme activité, la vente de produits de beauté et des boissons dans une ville du Bénin. Akouvi Rita s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Togo. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Akouvi Rita désire obtenir un deuxième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe NONVITCHA.
texts.en: The "Nonvitcha" group comprises three people who live in the same area. The group leader, named Akouvi Rita, is the woman whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the second time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ with the goal of raising the level of their business. Akouvi Rita is 31 years old and married to a man named Mohamed. The couple do not have children yet. Akouvi Rita lives together with her husband. Close to ten years ago, Akouvi Rita began running a business selling cosmetics and drinks at a town in Benin. She gets her supplies in Benin and Togo. With the goal of increasing her stock of products and better responding to the demands of her clientele, Akouvi Rita would like to obtain a second loan with the other members of the Nonvitcha group.

loans.use: To buy canned drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bunches of bananas, millet and corn for the preparation of her porridge and also a quarter size of sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cartons of fish and chicken to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of eggs, canned tomatoes, oil, different type of spices and salt.

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON est un groupe constitué de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe (dont la main est levée sur la photo) est nommée Médédodé Claire. Médédodé Claire est âgée de 51 ans et n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Médédodé Claire est mariée à un certain Amidou et est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et à sa charge.  Médédodé Claire vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les différentes charges du ménage sont assurées par les deux conjoints. Il y a dix sept ans, Médédodé Claire a commencé la vente de produits divers (conserves, savons, eau pur water, etc.) à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de se prendre en charge et de nourrir sa famille. Médédodé Claire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin.  C'est la deuxième  fois que Médédodé Claire sollicite un financement auprès de ALIDé, afin d'agrandir son activité et d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu.
texts.en: The "Mahougnon" group consists of three people who live in the same area. The group leader (whose hand is raised in the photo) is named Médédodé Claire. She is 51 years old and did not attend school. Médédodé Claire is married to a man named Amidou and has two children, both of whom attend school and are in her care. Médédodé Claire lives together with her husband and children. The various household expenses are taken care of by both husband and wife. Seven years ago, Médédodé Claire began selling various products (canned goods, soap, purified water, etc.) at her home; this has allowed her to provide for and feed her family. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. This is the second time she is seeking a loan with ALIDÉ in order to expand her business and increase her sales and income.

loans.use: To buy various products (canned goods, soap, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of tinned tomatoes, canned drinks, sugar, pepsodent, and tinned milk.

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
Maria tiene 48 años es madre y padre para su único hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes pero en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar panetones, vinos, champan, chocolates para la época navideña, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mas mercadería como por ejemplo panetones.

Maria está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old and must be both mother and father to her only child. She sells groceries, but is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy panettones, wines, champagne, and chocolates for the Christmas season.

Maria is pleased with the loan that has been given to her, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy panettones, wines, champagne, and chocolates to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Affi Léontine's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité et de faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe s'est rapproché de ALIDé, en vue de l'obtention d'un prêt. La représentante du groupe, Affi Léontine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans. Affi Léontine est mariée à un certain Cocouvi et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés, et à leur charge. Affi Léontine s'est installée depuis dix ans dans une ville du Bénin, où elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Affi Léontine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour se prendre en charge et satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants, Affi Léontine a commencé depuis cinq ans la vente de jus de bissap de façon ambulante. Affi Léontine achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité, Affi Léontine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: This group comprises four people who all live in the same area. In order to raise the level of their businesses and to meet the demands of their clientele, this group joined ALIDÉ, with the goal of obtaining a loan. The group leader, Affi Léontine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 34 years old. She is married to a man named Cocouvi and has three children, all of whom attend school and are in the couple's care. Affi Léontine has lived in a city in Benin for ten years with her husband and children. The couple take care of the various household expenses together. Affi Léontine did not attend school. To provide for herself and satisfy her children's needs, she begin a business nine years ago selling hibiscus juice door-to-door. She gets her products at a market in Benin. With the goal of raising the level of her business, Affi Léontine is seeking a loan with ALIDÉ.

loans.use: To buy hibiscus leaves, sugar, and packets.

loans.name: Elise's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est formé de trois  personnes qui résident toutes dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Elise, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Elise est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un certain Désiré. Elise n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Elise est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Dans le but de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants, Elise mène comme activité depuis quinze ans environs, la vente de nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce, etc.) dans un marché du Bénin. Elise achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Elise désire obtenir un crédit avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en: This group comprises three people who all live in the same area. The group leader is named Elise and has her hand raised in the photo. This is the first time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ with the goal of raising the level of their businesses. Elise is 42 years old and married to a man named Désiré. She did not attend school. Elise has two children, both of whom attend school and are in the couple's care. The couple live together with their children and take care of the various household expenses together. With the goal of providing for herself and ensuring her children's education, Elise has run a business for about fifteen years, selling food (maize paste with sauce, etc.) at a market in Benin. She gets her products in Benin. With the goal of increasing her stock of products and better responding to her customers' demands, Elise would like to obtain a loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: To buy maize, vegetable oil, and condiments

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 58 years old and married with 13 children, four of whom are in school. Beatriz works very hard to provide for them.

Beatriz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, coffee, chips, bread, eggs, etc.

Beatriz has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Beatriz would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, coffee, chips, bread, eggs, etc

loans.name: Philbert

texts.en:
Philbert is 31 years old. He is the father of four children, all of whom go to school.

For the past three years, he has been selling sodas, maize flour and bananas to earn a living.

With the requested loan proceeds, he would like to buy more bananas and maize flour for re-sale purposes. With the profits he expects to generate from the business as a result of the loan, he would like to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional bananas and maize flour for re-sale

loans.name: Alpha Stars Group

texts.en:
Eunipha is a married woman and a mother of two children. She is the chairperson of this group, which is seeking its third loan.

To earn a living, she buys potatoes from Nyanga and re-sells them in Mutare at the market for a profit. At times she also buys and sells clothing to earn additional income. Depending on demand, she sometimes goes to South Africa to sell her goods. Her business challenges include poor quality potatoes, which often result in losses.

She is seeking a loan to buy more potatoes for re-sale purposes.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional potaotes for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: finance his higher education at ESTPO (public works school).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plantains for her business.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 20 years old and is a single man who lives in Hodeidah, Yemen.

He has been operating a grocery store for more than one year where he sells basic products. He started his business with capital from his family. He is a very hardworking and kind person. He is happy about attracting new clients but on the other hand, the financial challenge of meeting customers' demands is hindering his business progress and growth. He said he needs to fill his store with more food products to serve his customers.

So he applied for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy more grocery products to sell.  In the future, he would like to expand his business so that he can increase his profit and get married.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура доброжелательная и активная женщина, она замужем и имеет детей. Живёт Манзура в сельском посёлке. Уже с юных лет она изучала рукоделие. И на сегодня она является настоящей  мастерицей  по рукоделию. Она занимается вышивкой национальной одежды. За свою деятельность она успела изучать все тонкости своего дела и воспитать ряд учеников. Манзура с самого начала своей деятельности привыкла выполнять заказ на высшем уровне. Супруг ее занимается строительством. Супруги живут счастливо и стараются воспитывать своих детей хорошими людьми. Старший сын учится в медицинском коллеже. Манзура и её муж от своей работы получают хороший доход, но его хватает только на пропитание. А сейчас Манзура хочет женить своего старшего сына, и занимается подготовкой свадебного приданного для молодожён. Ей необходимо закупить много дорогих вещей. Но у них имеется недостаточная сумма денег для этого. Поэтому Манзура обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку приданного для своего сына. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Manzura is a friendly and active woman who is married and has children.  She lives in a village and from an early age, she has been involved in handicrafts.  Today she is a true master at work, making embroidered national costumes.  Her efforts have led her to learn all the intricacies of her work and to teach a number of apprentices.  From the moment she started her work, Manzura has made a habit of fulfilling orders to a very high quality.

Manzura's husband is a builder.  Their married life is happy and they are trying to raise their children to be good people.  Her eldest son is in medical school.  Manzura and her husband earn a decent living from their work, but it is only enough for their food.  Now their eldest son wants to get married and they are preparing a dowry for the couple.  Manzura needs to buy many expensive items, but they don't have enough money for everything.  This is why she has turned to Arvand - she wants to receive a loan to provide for her son's dowry.  She thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy a wedding dowry

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria se dedica a la costura de prendas de vestir (chamarras y sacos), principalmente de tela y fibra.
Ella vive en casa propia, ubicada en El Alto en la zona Villa Ingenio. 
El sueño de Victoria es tener en un mediano plazo equipos y máquinas diseñadas para desarrollar altas velocidades y al mismo tiempo, obtener máxima eficiencia en los diferentes procesos de producción, lo que redunda en mayores volúmenes de fabricación, reducción en costos y mejora de la calidad de los productos. El crédito lo necesita ahora para la compra de una máquina industrial de coser. Asi, podrá brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes y mejorar la calidad de vida a su familia.

Es la primeraa vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Victoria works as a seamstress sewing clothing (jackets and bags) primarily made of fabric and thread. She lives in her own home located in El Alto in the Villa Ingenio zone. Victoria's dream is to have a small place with equipment and machines designed to sew at high speeds and, at the same time, to obtain maximum efficiency in the different production processes that would result in larger volumes of products, reduced costs and higher quality products. She currently needs this loan to purchase an industrial sewing machine. This way she will be able to provide better service to her clients and a better quality of life for her family. This is the first time that she is seeking a loan through IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine that will bring increased efficiency to her business as a seamstress and jacket and bag designer for both sexes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair, hair relaxer, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, flour and sugar to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more meat, peppers, onions, etc for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more salt, pepper, onions, flour, oil, maggi cubes, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coal for her business.

loans.name: Jarlin

texts.es: Don Jarlin es originario de la ciudad de Boaco, casado y padre de un hijo. De 33 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la administración de un molino y venta de leña. Inicio su negocio con capital propio el cual le ayudo a comprar un pequeño molino con el cual comenzó a trabajar y poco a poco fue creciendo hasta el día de hoy. Su meta próxima es mejorar su situación económica y sacar adelante a su familia. Solicita el crédito para comprar un motor eléctrico, discos para su molino y darle mantenimiento a su molino actual. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para ampliar su negocio y brindarles una mejor atención a sus clientes. Su plan futuro es establecer su negocio en el mercado popular de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Don Jarlin is from the city of Boaco. He is 33 years old, and he is married with one child. 

He is a businessman, running a mill and selling firewood.  He started his business with his own capital, which helped him to purchase a small mill.  He began working with it, and his business has been gradually growing to this day.  

His next goal is to improve his economic situation and keep his family going.  He is seeking a loan in order to purchase an electric motor and discs for his mill, and to perform maintenance on it.  He believes that the loan will be of great help in expanding his business and providing better service to his customers.  

His plan for the future is to establish his business in the city's popular market.

loans.use: to purchase an electric motor and discs for his mill, and to perform maintenance on it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more caustic and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more nails, door locks, copy books, reading books, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil, pepper, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more varieties of rice, soft drinks and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shoes, jeans and clothing material to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of cassava, yam, chicken cartons, meat and fish, and palm fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of hair extension products, hair relaxers and body lotion and pomade.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sandals and introduce the sale of children's sandals, rubber bowls and cups to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional cartons of frozen fish, meat, chicken, and smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Aurora Pastora

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Quiroga.
En este lugar vive la señora Aurora, tiene 48 años está casada y de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos, pero uno de ellos falleció  hace algunos años,  tres de ellos son mayores de edad, el menor tiene 14 años y estudia en colegio y es el que aun vive en su casa ya que los otros ya son independientes. Su  esposo es comerciante.
Doña Aurora junto a su esposo se dedican a diversas actividades con la finalidad que en su hogar no falte nada, mientras ella se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos él se dedica a la agricultura y a la compra y venta de frutas. El  recorre los campos recogiendo los productos de la zona, compra naranjas, mandarinas, limón, sandias, melón, etc. Y las lleva a entregar a Portoviejo, aunque también una vez por semana envían estos productos a la ciudad de Quito ya que allá los venden a mejor precio, mientras el realiza esta actividad ella se dedica a la cría de sus animalitos los mismos que entrega a comerciantes cuando están para la venta, es así como ellos luchan incansablemente día a día para salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas así como también alimento para los pollos y los chanchos. Lleva más de 9 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda. Sus sueños son tener un camión para que su marido lleve sus productos.
texts.en:
In the parish of Quiroga within the city of Calceta, there is a town where the people spend most of their time farming, raising animals, and selling their products. The Communal Bank "Quiroga" meets here every 15 days.

It is also in this place where Sra. Aurora lives. She is 48 years old, married, and has five children but one of them has been deceased for a few years. Three of her children are adults and her youngest one is 14 years old, is in school, and lives at home. The other children are already independent. Her husband is a merchant.

Doña Aurora and her husband engage in different business activities so that they can provide everything they need for their household. While she spends time raising chickens and pigs, her husband is busy farming and buying and selling fruit. He travels to farms in order to buy local products such as oranges, tangerines, lemons, watermelons, melons, and other fruit. Her husband delivers the fruit to Portoviejo, but he also ships these products once a week to the city of Quito where he is able to sell them at a better price. In the meantime, Aurora raises her animals and delivers them to the merchants when they are ready to be sold. Both of them work tirelessly day after day so that they can get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy fruits and also feed for her chickens and pigs. Aurora has been with her Communal Bank for more than nine years and enjoys the assistance she has received. Her dreams include having a truck so that her husband can deliver his products.

loans.use: to buy fruits for her husband's business and also animal feed for her chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Garnik

texts.en:
Garnik is a married man with two daughters and a son. He lives in Kapan city, which is in the Syunik region of Armenia. Garnik has a vocational education, and for several years worked as a locksmith.

Since 2005, he has operated his own business. First, he worked out of a rented space, where he installed a portable booth to sell fruits and vegetables. Up until 2011 he worked in that booth, but thanks to his hard work and efforts, he managed to save money and to build a small shop, where he currently operates his business. Garnik managed to buy a truck, on which he transports fruits and vegetables, and which has also greatly reduced his expanses. He sells great a variety of fruits and vegetables, such as: apples, mandarins, oranges, grapes, kiwis, potatoes, onions, garlic, beetroot, and cabbage.

Garnik says that, in order to generate good income, he always chooses fresh, pure and not very expensive produce for his stall. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,100,000 AMD in order to buy a large batch of fruits and vegetables for re-sale purpose.

loans.use: to purchase a large batch of fruits and vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different colors of sewing thread, zippers, linen and pins.

loans.name: Célestine's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe constitué de trois personnes dont la représentante (dont la main est levée sur la photo) se nomme  Célestine. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier. Ce groupe sollicite un premier crédit en vue de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d'augmenter leur chiffre d'affaire. Âgée de 30 ans, Célestine est mariée à un certain Karim et est mère de deux enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins du ménage. Pour y arriver, Célestine vend depuis cinq ans, des liqueurs, de l'akassa (aliment local à base d'amidon de maïs) et des poissons à son domicile. Célestine s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Célestine sollicite un financement auprès de ALIDé, afin d'agrandir son activité et d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu.
texts.en: This group comprises three people, and its leader (whose hand is raised in the photo) is named Célestine. The group members live in the same area. This group is seeking its first loan with the goal of raising the level of their businesses and increasing their sales. Célestine is 30 years old, married to a man named Karim, and has two children. Both the children are in school and live together with their parents. The couple take care of the household needs together. In order to achieve this, Célestine has sold liquor, akassa (a local food made of corn starch), and fish at her home for the past five years. Célestine gets her supplies in an area of Benin. She is seeking a loan with ALIDÉ in order to expand her business and increase her sales and income.

loans.use: To buy and sell liquor.

loans.name: Sélimath's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Sélimath est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Sélimath est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un certain Idriss. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé, et à sa charge. Sélimath vit avec son enfant. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Sélimath mène comme activité, la vente de bouillie de maïs et aussi des divers (bombons, etc.) de façon ambulante. Sélimath s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Sélimath désire obtenir un crédit avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en: This group comprises three people who live in the same area. The group leader is named Sélimath and has her hand raised in the photo. This is the first time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ with the goal of raising the level of their businesses. Sélimath is 30 years old and married to a man named Idriss. The couple have one child who attends school and is in their care. Sélimath lives with her child. To meet the various household expenses, Sélimath runs a business selling maize "bouillie" (a type of porridge) and also various items (sweets, etc.) door-to-door. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of increasing her stock of products and better responding to her customers' demands, Sélimath would like to obtain a loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: To buy maize, sugar, and sweets.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is single and owns a hardware store. He has been dealing house construction materials for the past two years.

He has requested a loan to buy more iron sheets and cement for re-sale purposes. He would like to save any of the profits he generates from the business as a result of the loan. He was very happy after he successfully repaid his previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase additional construction materials (e.g., iron sheets and cement) for re-sale.

loans.name: Dorcas Group

texts.en:
Josephine is the chairperson of the Dorcas Group. Josephine is a married woman with three children, two of whom go to school.

To earn a living, she works as a cross-border trader, who travels back and forth between Botswana and South Africa to buy and sell electrical goods. She has been operating this business for more than three years. She operates a shop in Mutare, and the other group members are in the same business.

She is requesting this loan to buy more electrical goods, such as radios, television sets, speakers, and DVDs for re-sale purposes.

loans.use: to purchase additional electrical goods (e.g., radios, televisions, speakers, and DVDs) for re-sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, oil, onion, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more beer, stout, and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, cartons of cigarettes, drinks, and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil, pepper, Vita, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Se Bo Gnan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SE BO GNAN est composé de trois personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adèle est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Adèle est âgée de 33 ans. Adèle est mariée à un certain Antoine et a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Adèle et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Adèle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin de se prendre en charge et d'améliorer son niveau de vie, Adèle exerce depuis dix ans environs, comme activité la vente de chaussures, de sacs et des bijoux par le système de distribution. Adèle achète ses produits au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Adèle sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SE BO GNAN, un deuxième crédit.
texts.en: The "Se Bo Gnan" group comprises three people who all live in the same area. This is the second time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ with the goal of raising the level of their businesses. The group leader is named Adèle and has her hand raised in the photo. Adèle is 33 years old. She is married to a man named Antoine and has two children, both in school. Adèle and her husband take care of the various household expenses together. Adèle lives together with her husband and children. In order to take care of herself and improve her living conditions, Adèle has run a business selling shoes, bags, and jewelry through the distribution system for about ten years. She buys her products in Togo. With the goal of satisfying her clientele and increasing her income, she is seeking a second loan together with the other members of the Se Bo Gnan group.

loans.use: To buy shoes and bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase smoked fish, fresh eggs, canned tomatoes and various foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of cooking pots, frying pans, sauce pans, and laundry baskets

loans.name: Martine's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Martine. Les membres du groupe se connaissent compte tenu du fait qu’ils habitent le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Âgée de 33 ans, Martine est une veuve et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Martine vit avec ses enfants et assure leurs différents besoins grâce au revenu de son activité. Martine n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Martine mène comme activité, la vente de charbon de bois à son domicile. Martine s'approvisionne auprès des grossistes. Martine a déjà sept ans d’expérience dans l’exercice de cette activité. Ce prêt permettra certainement à Martine et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité par l’augmentation du stock de leurs produits et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: This group comprises three people and its leader (whose hand is raised in the photo) is named Martine. The group members know each other from living in the same area. With the goal of increasing their working capital, this group is seeking a loan with ALIDÉ for the second time. Martine is 33 years old and a widowed mother of three children, all in school. She lives with her children and provides for their various needs thanks to the income from her business. Martine never attended school. To provide for herself, Martine runs a business selling charcoal at her home. She gets her supplies from wholesalers. She already has seven years of experience running this business. This loan will certainly allow Martine and her group to raise the level of their businesses by expanding their stock of products and increasing their clientele and income.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of bananas, plantains and yams

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa works hard to support her family. Elsa is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her tailoring business. Elsa has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is 59 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. Nilda has been in this business for 8 years.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Amada works hard to support her family. She has a wholesale soft drinks business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens.  Amada is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks of soft drinks to sell for her wholesale soft drinks business.

Amada has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Erlida

texts.en: Erlida is 58 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them. Erlida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, chips, eggs, bread, etc. She has been in this business for 19 years. Erlida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, chips, eggs, bread, etc.

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en: Virgenia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Virgenia requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soap, shampoo, milk, soft drinks, canned goods, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 8 years now. In the future, Virgenia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soap, shampoo, milk, soft drinks, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie works hard to support her family. Virgie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap and shampoo. Virgie has been in this business for 6 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig raising business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Concepcion has been in this business for many years. Concepcion earns more income from cattle breeding. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now has requested a new loan to further build her business.

Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a banana business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell.

Crispina has been in this business for 10 years. Crispina earns more income from a general store that she operates.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Crispina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Leila works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.  Leila is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients to produce food for her food vending business.

Leila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for food production.

loans.name: Vahagn

texts.en:
Vahagn is a 41-year-old father of six children (four daughters and two sons). His oldest daughter is a student, while his other children are nearly school-age.

He has a vocational education and a specialty in mechanics, but he then developed skills as a tailor. For five years he worked as a shoemaker, but in recent years he became engaged in farming and agriculture activities.

On his farm he has four cows, four bulls, four calves, and 21 piglets; he also has a tractor and a combine of his own. He sells his farm outputs and receives good profits from his sales. This year he managed to gather a lot of hay for his cattle, which ought to be more than enough for the winter months.

Vahagn is asking for a loan in the amount of 700,000 AMD in order to buy two more cows and to increase both his farm cattle and his family income.

loans.use: to expand his farming operations by purchasing two additional cows

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana es una señora de 30 años, es madre soltera y vive en Sololá. Ella tiene dos hijos un varón de 10 años y una nena de 8 años, ellos están estudiando. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas preparadas, que son colocadas en bandejas y de esta forma sale a ofrecer en las oficinas, tiendas, juzgados etc. Ella empezó este pequeño negocio por la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos a raíz de la separación con su pareja. 
Ella lucha por el bienestar de sus hijos y de esta manera salir adelante también como mujer. Ella solicita un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para capital de trabajo y así ampliar su negocio de frutas, mejorando su ingreso y el servicio a sus clientes. Su sueño es construir una casa propia para ella y sus hijos ya que por el momento están alquilando la casa donde viven.
texts.en:
Ana is a 30-year-old woman, single mother, and lives in Sololá. She has two children: a 10-year-old boy and an 8-year-old girl. They both are in school. She makes a living selling fruit, which she places on trays, allowing her to sell the fruit in offices, shops, and courthouses. She started this small business due to the need to support her children since separating with her partner.

She works hard for the well-being of her children, as well as to get ahead as a woman. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 quetzals for working capital. This will allow her to grow her fruit business, thus increasing her income and improving customer service. Her dream is to build a house for her and her children, since at the moment, they are renting the house where they live.

loans.use: to expand her fruit business.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмире 36 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Гулмиры -среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулмира занимается полеводством, а точнее выращиванием овощей, стартовав 16 лет назад, с 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулмиры, на сегодняшний день у нее имеется: 0,24 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает ранние огурцы, репчатый лук и помидоры для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Полеводством занимается практически одна, так как супруг -частный строитель, подрабатывает на стройках в сезонное время, а внесезонное время помогает Гулмире на поле. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку семян огурцов, помидоров, а также удобрений и ядохимикатов. Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить улучшение финансового состояния семьи, что способствует улучшению жилищных условий. В будущем Гульмира с супругом намерены построить теплицу во дворе дома.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 36 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising two children.  She has a secondary education and is involved in agriculture, an activity which constitutes her family's main source of income.  She essentially grows vegetables, which she started doing 16 years ago with an initial capital of 5,000 som.  Thanks to Gulmira's hard work, her farm now consists of 0.24 hectares of land and she cultivates early cucumbers, onions and potatoes on a yearly basis, for the family's consumption as well as for resale.

Gulmira takes care of her farm practically by herself.  Her husband is a private builder who works on construction sites during the building season and helps his wife with the farm-work during the off-season.  Gulmira makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan to buy cucumber and tomato seeds, as well as fertilizers and pesticides.  With the earnings from her loan Gulmira plans to improve her family's financial situation and, ultimately, their living conditions.  In the future, she and her husband would like to build a greenhouse on their property.

loans.use: to buy cucumber and tomato seeds, as well as fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: Зафар 28-летний фермер. Он живет с женой, двумя детьми и родителями в районе Шахритус. У него высшее образование. Он бухгалтер и работает по своей профессии. Одновременно Зафар в течение 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Он имеет орошаемый участок земли, на котором выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Зафар занимается земледелием всей семьей. В данный момент он просит кредит, чтобы купить качественные семена картофеля и минеральные удобрения. Данный кредит поможет ему провести посевные работы и к весне получить хороший урожай. Зафар надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Zafar is a 28-year-old farmer who lives with his wife, his two children and his parents in the Shahrituz district of Tajikistan.  He has a higher education and works as an accountant.  For the past ten years, he has also been involved in agriculture.  He owns an irrigated plot of land on which he grows crops.  The whole family helps him with the business.  He is taking a loan to buy high quality potato seeds as well as mineral fertilizers.  With this loan, he will be able to start sowing his land, and in the spring, get a good harvest.  Zafar is awaiting your support.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata tiene 53 años de edad y tiene tres hijos, ella se dedica a la atención de su tienda de abarrotes donde expende sus productos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros cosas más, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería  panetones, chocolates y otras cosas más. 

Honorata está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Honorata is 53 years old and has three children. She manages a grocery store where she offers products such as rice, sugar, noodles, and other items. Honorata is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy merchandise such as panettones, chocolates, and other products.

She is pleased with the loan that has been granted and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy panettones, chocolates, and other products.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Kuña Guapa está formado por 25 integrantes, quienes están en el ciclo número 10  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se pusieron como objetivo poder ayudarse las unas a las otras, y por medio de ese trabajo también poder ayudar a sus familias. También forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ramona, quien en la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza que hizo estaba en el nivel 1, es decir con ingresos bajos, pero está consciente que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Entre el trabajo que ella hace comenta que se dedica a hacer muchas cosas, como ser la venta de productos de limpieza, venta de comidas  y compra venta de cualquier producto de mercería.
La Sra. Solicita este crédito para la compra de productos de mercería, como ser prendas, calzados, etc., que le permitirá seguir creciendo y mejorando cada día en su negocio, a la vez que crecer como microemprendedora.
texts.en:
This group is called Kuña Guapa and is made up of 25 members in their 10th cycle in the committee for women program, where they all work to help one another and their families.  The also form part of the elimination of poverty program in order to improve their life conditions.

Ramona is one of the members who’s survey results showed her to be at level 1, that is to say of low income, but she knows that she is bettering her poverty situation through her work and continued application of the behaviors of a successful woman.  She says that she does many things such as selling cleaning products, food, and buying and selling general merchandise. 

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as clothing, shoes, etc. that will allow her to continue growing and improving her business every day and grow as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
