El grupo Santa Catalina se formó en Ciudad del Este, donde estas mujeres forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, el cual les permitirá poder conocer la situación de cada una, y conforme a eso poder seguir creciendo y mejorando su calidad de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra.  Juliana, quien en su encuesta de eliminación mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, y que debe seguir esforzándose por crecer y mejorar.  Ella a través de la venta de golosinas y empanadas en una cantina de la una escuela está tratando y luchando por mejorar sus ingresos y sus condiciones de vida. Es una persona que se destaca por el gran entusiasmo que tiene, ya que quiere seguir creciendo como persona y profesional.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de golosinas varias, como así también de insumos para sus empanadas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The Santa Catalina group is made up of these women who form part of the elimination of poverty program, which allows them to know one another’s situations and in this way continue growing and improving their qualities of life.

Juliana is one of the members in the program and showed a level one poverty level that is of very low income and she knows that she must continue to grow and improve herself.  Through her sale of snacks and empanadas at a school canteen, she is working to improve her income and quality of life.  She is a person characterized by her great enthusiasm and who wants to continue growing as a person and as a professional.

She is asking for this loan to buy snacks and empanada making ingredients.  In this way she can continue making sales.

loans.use: to buy snacks and ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Eleonor works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish and raising pigs. Eleonor is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, canned goods and eggs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Eleonor has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, canned goods and eggs

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Helen works hard to support her family.

To earn a living, she operates a general store business in the Philippines. She earns additional income by raising pigs.

Helen is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more items to sell, such as noodles, coffee, milk, and chips for her general store business. She proudly states that she successfully repaid her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Helen has been sustaining her business activities through ten previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory (e.g., noodles, coffee, milk, and chips) for re-sale

loans.name: Josita

texts.en:
Josita works hard to support her family. Josita is married and raises pigs in the Philippines to earn a living.

Josita is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Josita has been in this business for 10 years. She explains that she successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Josita would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to further expand her business by purchasing additional feed and vitamins for her pig-raising business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lucy works hard to support her family.

To earn a living, she buys and sells fish in the Philippines. She earns additional income from food vending.

Lucy is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her business. She explains that she successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Lucy has been sustaining her business activities through 11 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to further expand her business by purchasing additional fish for re-sale

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. Merly has been in this business for 24 years. She earns additional income by providing motorcycle transportation services.

She is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items such as sugar, soap, shampoo, and canned goods for her general store business. She explains that she successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Merly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to further expand her business by purchasing additional items (e.g., sugar, soap, shampoo, and canned goods) for re-sale

loans.name: Leah Ann

texts.en:
Leah Ann is 19 years old and has two children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Leah Ann requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Leah Ann has been pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 38 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like biscuits, sugar, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Marivic has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and buying and selling rice. Marivic aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like biscuits, sugar, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She has a business, selling ready-to-wear clothing, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years.

Mary Jane requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock to sell, like t-shirts, shorts, and pants.

She is a widow and has children. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like t-shirts, shorts, and pants.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 55 years old and married. She has three children. Mercy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business, selling nipa roofing in the Philippines. She has been running the nipa roofing business for 33 years, and she earns additional income from a general store.

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock (nipa) to sell.

Mercy has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year, and she earns additional income by selling rice, at retail.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF. She will use it to purchase additional stock to sell at her general store, like soy sauce, biscuits, juice, canned goods, milk, and sugar.

Merlie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like soy sauce, biscuits, and juice

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 59 years old and married with nine children.

Nena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like shampoo, soap, sugar, etc. to resell. Nena has borrowed and paid back 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 38 years and also earns an income from direct selling Avon products.

Nena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like shampoo, soap, sugar, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Elnura

texts.ru: Эльнуре 32 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Эльнуры - средне-специальное образование, домохозяйка занимается воспитанием детей и домашним хозяйством. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Эльнура занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. На сегодняшний день у Эльнуры имеется: 1,14 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает клевер, фасоль и кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жаркынай обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку семян фасоли, а также селитру и удобрения. Доходы от кредита Эльнура планирует вложить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Elnura is 32 years old and married. She and her husband are raising three children. She has a specialized secondary education and is now a homemaker, raising her children and taking care of the house.  She is also involved in agriculture and animal husbandry, an activity which constitutes her family's main source of income.  She started in this field 12 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS).  She now owns 1.14 hectare of land on which she grows clover, beans and maize annually for the family's consumption as well as for resale.

Elnura makes a monthly income of 16,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan to buy bean seeds as well as fertilizers and ammonium nitrate. She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds, fertilizers and ammonium nitrate.

loans.name: Yeth

texts.en: Yeth is 51 years old. She is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish and vegetables for more than five years, earning approximately 5 USD per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who makes an income of 4 USD daily. One of her children is employed in a casino and earns about 5 USD each day. Due to lack of funding, Yeth is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds for cultivation. In the future, she would like to run an additional business of breeding poultry and help her youngest child earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Antonio es de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa, donde todas las integrantes forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, como un medio de poder ir mejorando y creciendo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Julia, quien es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedor, ella es ama de casa y está trabajando también en la producción y venta de Productos de Limpieza se debe primeramente que ella siempre está muy atenta en las capacitaciones y tiene todo el entusiasmo de crecer.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus productos de limpieza, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called "San Antonio" is from the city of Villa Elisa. All of the members are part of the poverty elimination program and have taken the poverty elimination survey. This will enable them to improve and grow.

One of the members is Sra. Julia, who is a hardworking and enterprising person. She is a housewife, but she also works by making and selling cleaning products. Most of all, Julia has always been very attentive during the training sessions and is enthusiastic about growing.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy supplies that will allow her to continue making cleaning products. This will help to solidify her business plan, which will result in an improvement in her earnings.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making cleaning products.

loans.name: Sourouchi Toto's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe constitué de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Sourouchi Toto. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Sourouchi Toto est âgée de 25 ans et est mariée à un certain Donatien. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sourouchi Toto vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Sourouchi Toto a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Sourouchi Toto vend des beignets de haricot et de l'igname frit dans sa région depuis près de dix ans. Sourouchi Toto s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Ce prêt permettra certainement à  Sourouchi Toto et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
This is a group made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood and whose leader (the one who is raising her hand in the photo) is named Sourouchi Toto. With the goal of increasing their working capital, this group is seeking a loan from ALIDé for the first time.

Sourouchi Toto is 25 years old and is married to a man named Donatien. The couple has five children, all of whom attend school and are in their care. Sourouchi Toto lives with her children and her husband and, with her husband, sees to the household expenses. Sourouchi Toto stopped attending school in elementary school. In order to meet her needs and those of her family, Sourouchi Toto has been selling bean fritters and fried yam in her area for nearly 10 years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin.

This loan will without doubt allow Sourouchi Toto and her group to increase their business and their income, and to expand their customer base.

loans.use: To purchase yams, vegetable oil, and charcoal.

loans.name: Rosaline's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe constitué de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Rosaline. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Rosaline est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain Maxime. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Rosaline n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Rosaline vend des liqueurs et du charbon de bois. Rosaline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Rosaline sollicite un premier prêt ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
This is a group made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood and of which the leader (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is named Rosaline. With the goal of increasing their working capital, this group is seeking a loan from ALIDé for the first time.

Rosaline is 35 years old and is married to a man named Maxime. The couple has five children, some of whom attend school and all of whom are in their care. Rosaline did not attend school. In order to meet her needs and those of her family, Rosaline sells liqueurs and charcoal. Rosaline gets her supplies in a market in Benin. To be more competitive in the marketplace, Rosaline is seeking a first loan with the other members of her group. This loan will allow them to increase their business and their income, and to expand their customer base.

loans.use: To purchase liqueurs and charcoal.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 38 years old and married with five children.

Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sugar, soy sauce, spices, milk, etc.

Fe has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from selling fruit. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now request a new loan to further build her business. Fe aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sugar, soy sauce, spices, milk, etc

loans.name: Mitchelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mitchelle works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells fish in the Philippines to earn a living. She earns additional income from a general store.

Mitchelle is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her business. She explains that she successfully paid back her two previous loans and is now requesting the additional loan to build her business. Mitchelle has been sustaining her business activities through 16 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to further expand her business by purchasing additional boxes of fish for re-sale

loans.name: Rapuncel

texts.en:
Rapuncel is 26 years old and married with two children who are in school. Rapuncel works very hard to provide for them.

Rapuncel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like soap, chips, bread, eggs, canned goods, etc. Rapuncel has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Rapuncel would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like soap, chips, bread, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: As a married parent of nine children, Rebecca works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Rebecca is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business. Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Jose Rudys

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar plywood, pegamento e insumos para la tienda, con lo que fortalecerá el negocio y equipara la carpintería, con lo que seguirá teniendo clientes más satisfechos.
Con la inversión anterior logro variar más los productos que ofrece en su tienda, aumento sus ventas, mejoro su economía con la que ha podido cancelar sus cuotas y cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en: Jose is asking for a new loan to buy plywood, glue, and supplies for the store.  He will use this to strengthen his business and to equip his carpentry shop thereby continuing to satisfy his customers. With the previous investment, he was able to offer a wider variety of products in his store, increase sales, and improve his financial situation. He has been able to make his loan payments and cover his household expenses.

loans.use: to buy plywood, glue, and supplies for the store.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years.

Mira requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional ingredients for her dishes, like spices, fish and vegetables.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her dishes, like spices, fish and vegetables.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 61 years old and married. She has two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Monina has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF. She will use this amount to purchase additional ingredients for her dishes, like flour, sugar, and milk.

In the future, Monina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her dishes, like flour, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Nueva Florecita Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank group, “Nueva Florecita” meaning “New Little Flower,” is located in rural Chichicastenango, Guatemala. It is composed of thirteen motivated women who formed the group five years ago. As the ladies have excellent credit history, they are comfortable and excited to apply for a new loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. They will use their loans investing in their businesses, which mostly involve textile production.

Maria is the 23-year-old Secretary of the Trust Bank. Her fellow Trust Bank members chose her to occupy this position as she has had six years of education and has good Spanish reading and writing skills. Maria is the youngest member of the Trust Bank! She is a weaver and has requested a new loan which she will use to purchase various types of thread to produce more textiles. She will also use a small portion of the loan for her husband’s business. He sells cellphone accessories and parts. The couple works very hard each day so that they can meet the basic needs of their family including providing nutritious foods and education.

Maria, along with the other ladies in the Trust Bank, really appreciated the opportunities realized during their first loan cycle, and they are quite excited about this second loan cycle. Besides receiving and making payments on their loans, the women participate in monthly trainings on various topics like effective business administration, health and nutrition, and self-esteem. This month’s topic involves budgeting administration.

The ladies of the Trust Bank are so thankful to Kiva investors throughout the world who are helping them move ahead in their lives. They look forward to a brighter future as empowered women, creating better lives for themselves, their families, and their community of Chichicastenango.

loans.use: to purchase various types of thread to produce more textiles.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 32 years old, happily married and a resident of Oroquieta City, Philippines. She earns a living through her cellphone store repair and accessory stall. She has been in this kind of business for five years.

She has been a member of PMPC for two years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy additional stocks of phone paraphernalia.

Lorna deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To buy cellphone parts, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 52 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with 6 children.

Josephine sells assorted products to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month she earns 1500 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 12000 PHP to restock store with basic commodities.

Josephine has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Josephine hope to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Gulsaana

texts.ru: Гульсаане 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Гульсааны - высшее образование, окончила педагогический институт, после окончания института вышла замуж за Рахмадилде. Супруг занимается частным строительством. А Гульсаана в данное время работает в местной школе преподавателем. Три дочери замужем, сын женат, проживает с родителями, младшая дочь-студентка. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Гульсаана занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульсааны, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 2 бычка, 20 овец. Также Гульсаана со своей семьей обрабатывает 1,50 ГА поливной земли, где ежегодно сажает фасоль, картофель и получают хороший урожай. По хозяйству помогают все члены семьи, проживающие совместно. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, от сезонных заработок супруга, от собственной зарплаты. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульсаана обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гульсаана планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Gulsaana is 55, married and has five children. Gulsaana has a college education and married Rakhmadild after she graduated from the Pedagogical Institute. Her spouse is an independent construction worker and she teaches at the local school. Three of her daughters and her son are married and live at home, and her youngest daughter is a student. In order to earn additional income for her family, Gulsaana raises livestock and plants crops. She started 19 years ago with a purchase of cattle for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Gulsaana now has two dairy cows, two horses, two young bulls, 20 sheep, and 1.5 hectares of irrigated land where she plants beans and potatoes and gets a good harvest. She earns 13,000 som (KGS) per month from milk sales and her husband's seasonal income. With the goal of expanding her farm, Gulsaana asked the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy a horse to increase her livestock numbers. She plans to use the profits to purchase additional domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy a horse

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn  is 31 years old, married with children, and a resident of Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She earns a living through having her sari-sari (variety) store business where she generates her income to answer her family's needs.

She has been a member of PMPC for two years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of Php 6,000 to buy stocks of supplies for her business.

Rosalyn deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy stocks for her sari-sari store business

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is married. Rufina is 58 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Rufina grows and sells pigs to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy piglets and feed for the pigs.

Rufina has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Rufina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed for the pigs

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Ercelisa

texts.en:
Ercelisa is married. She is 38 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Ercelisa operates her sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of small business. She has requested a loan for 6,000 PHP to buy more grocery items to display and sell in her store like shampoo, toothpaste, rice, corn, soap and other items.

Ercelisa has been a member of PMPC since June 2013. In the future, Ercelisa hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: buy more groceries items to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta  joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2012 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. This loan is intended to purchase stocks for her home product business. Violeta dreams of nothing more than aving a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks for her home products sales business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more salt, rice, oil, pepper, vita, onions, and peanuts for her food business.

loans.name: Armida

texts.es:
Armida de 61 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato y vive sola. Trabaja la tierra o paga para que siembren yuca, es una persona que la mayor parte de su vida vivió en Estado Unidos.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar los materiales para construir una letrina y un baño.

Su deseo es arreglar bien su casa, para que sus hijos que viven en Estado Unidos puedan venir y vivir cómodamente, en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Armida is 61 years old. She studied through high school and lives alone. She works the land or pays someone to plant yucca. She has lived most of her life in the United States.

The loan she is applying for is to buy the materials to construct a latrine and a bathroom. His desire is to fix her own house so that her children living in the United States can come and live comfortably in their own home.

loans.use: to buy the materials to construct a latrine and a bathroom.

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en:
Sochea is 36 years old. He is married and resides with four children, in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has been working in construction for more than four years, earning approximately $6 per day. His wife is a garment worker, who makes an income of $5 daily.

To improve his family’s finances, Sochea is requesting a loan of $600, with which he will purchase rice to resell. By doing so, he would earn additional income to support the family. In the future, he would like to expand his business and send his children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TERESA DE JESUS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                          

La socia es la Sra. Josefa ella es casada, tiene 50 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende ropa para damas, caballeros, otros, a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar casacas para su negocio.

Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de libros, venta de ropa, productos de belleza y trabajadores del sector estatal y privado.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Teresa de Jesús Communal Bank, located in the Cusco district in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member, Josefa, is 50 years old and married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling clothing.  She has worked for some time in this business, which is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  Josefa sells women's and men's clothing to her customers who order them.  She wants to be able to keep on working so she can continue helping her family.

Josefa's requesting the loan to buy coats for her business.

The members in the attached photos asked permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work.  The other members make their livings selling books, selling clothing, selling beauty products, and working for the public sector or the private sector.

Josefa's grateful to those who are part of her dream through this means and she promises to make her payments within the established deadline.

loans.use: to buy coats

loans.name: Anihouvi 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ANIHOUVI 2 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Akouavi Diane Régina est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Akouavi Diane Régina est âgée de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Akouavi Diane Régina ne vit plus avec son mari. Akouavi Diane Régina a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Akouavi Diane Régina vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs divers besoins. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins, Akouavi Diane Régina mène comme activité depuis quinze ans, la vente de vernis à ongle de façon ambulante. Akouavi Diane Régina est une coiffeuse, qui fait aussi des pédicures, manucures. Akouavi Diane Régina s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Akouavi Diane Régina sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ANIHOUVI 2, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Anihouvi 2 Group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the first time that this group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé in order to increase their business. The group's leader, named Akouavi Diane Régina, is the one who has her hand raised in the photo.

Akouavi Diane Régina is 33 years old and lives in Benin. She no longer lives with her husband. She has three children, all of them in school and under her care. Akouavi Diane Régina lives alone with her children and she alone sees to their various needs. In order to meet her needs, she has been running a business selling nail polish door-to-door for 15 years. Akouavi Diane Régina is a hairdresser and also gives pedicures and manicures. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin.

With the hope of satisfying her customers and increasing her revenue, Akouavi Diane Régina, along with the other members of Anihouvi 2 Group, is seeking a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: To purchase nail polish.

loans.name: Breezy

texts.en:
This is Breezy. She previously obtained a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase more grocery items, toiletries and beverages, needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

Now, she would like to apply for another loan, this time in the amount of 20,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products, to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Breezy hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of having her own family. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of their lives and business endeavors. There, she can draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet every week. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
This is Marcelina, 57, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Loreto, a company driver, and they have children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They both work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Marcelina is an egg retailer. What she basically does is buy eggs from wholesalers, and then sell them with a little profit. Customers are attracted to buy, due to the low selling price she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales, every day.

Marcelina is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock of eggs. She expects a boost in her business income, as she expands her business.

Marcelina dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to have a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more eggs, which are needed for her business

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 55 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Visitacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc. Visitacion has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Visitacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Delwende Ismael

texts.fr:
Mr DELWENDE ISMAEL est un étudiant en classe de Master II à l’ESTPO. Il est célibataire sans enfant.
Il est à l’ESTPO depuis 2009.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures à l’ESTPO.
Il ambitionne exercer comme cadre supérieur dans les organisations internationales et créer une société qui va intervenir dans tous les domaines  d’activités et si possible créer une société qui va sérieusement aider les personnes démunies.
texts.en:
Mr. Delwende Ismael is a Master II [second year master's] student at ESTPO [l'Ecole supérieure des travaux publics de Ouagadougou]. He is single and has no children. He has been studying at ESTPO since 2009.

Mr. Delwende Ismael wants to fund his graduate studies at ESTPO. His ambition is to work as a senior executive in international organizations and to establish a company that will take part in all business sectors and, if possible, establish a company that will seriously help impoverished people.

loans.use: To pay for his graduate studies at ESTPO [a civil engineering university].

loans.name: Mahamadi

texts.fr:
Mr MAHAMADI est un étudiant en classe de Master II à l’ESTPO. Il est célibataire sans enfant.
Il est à l’ESTPO depuis 05ans.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures à l’ESTPO.
Il ambitionne ouvrir un cabinet d’étude.
texts.en:
Mr. Mahamadi is a Master II [second year master's] student at ESTPO [l'Ecole supérieur des travaux publics de Ouagadougou, a civil engineering/public works university in Ouagadougou]. He is single and has no children. He has been at ESTPO for five years.

Mr. Mahamadi wants to fund his graduate studies at ESTPO. His ambition is to open a consulting firm.

loans.use: To pay for his graduate studies at ESTPO [a civil engineering university].

loans.name: Remolino Group

texts.es:
José, tiene 39 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos, y vive con su esposa e hijos en una aldea del municipio de la Iguala, Lempira. toda su vida a trabajado en la agricultura cultivando maíz, frijoles y café, Producción que vende en el mercado local. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener en buen estado el cultivo, y actualmente solicita el quinto ciclo en forma grupal, en lo personal solicita 15,000 Lempiras para pago de mano de obra ya que viene el corte de café y necesita cortarlo rápido. Su plan es crecer como productor y poderles dar un buen estudio a sus hijos.
El grupo de llama Remolino, que esta integrado por 6 personas, quienes se dedican al cultivo de café y viven en la misma comunidad. El préstamo grupal es por 58,000 Lempiras y lo utilizaran para pagar mano de obra en el corte del café. en la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta don Bernardo, Servelio, Audelia, Bernardo, José y Willians.
texts.en:
José is 39 years old, married, and has three children. He lives with his wife and children in a neighborhood in the town of Iguala, Lempira.

José has worked all of his life in agriculture by cultivating corn, beans, and coffee. Whatever he produces is sold at the local market. He has requested several loans in order to keep his crops in good condition. José is currently submitting his request as part of his fifth group loan cycle. He is personally requesting 15,000 HNL in order to pay for labor. His coffee plants need to be pruned and this needs to be done very soon. His plan is to grow as a producer and to provide a good education for his children.

The group is called is called "Remolino" and consists of six people. They all grow coffee and live in the same community. The group loan is in the amount of 58,000 HNL and will be used to pay for labor (pruning coffee plants). In the photo, the members from left to right are Don Bernardo, Servelio, Audelia, Bernardo, José, and Willians.

loans.use: to pay laborers to prune the coffee plants.

loans.name: Cruzche Iii Group

texts.en:
The state or department of Quiche (pronounced “key-che) is located in the highlands of northwest Guatemala and is quite culturally diverse and interesting. Most of the populations of this rural area work in agriculture as well as textile and handicraft production. One of the communities located in Quiche is “Cruzche” meaning “tree cross”. 

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Cruzche III” was formed in 2012 and consists of thirteen hard-working and determined women. The ladies are applying for a new loan with Friendship Bridge in order to sustain and grow their businesses. They are very motivated to succeed and look forward to their monthly meetings where they also receive trainings on subjects like effective business practices, indebtedness, women’s health, children’s nutrition and self-esteem. Almost all of them have had very little or no formal education.

Fermina is the 36-year-old Secretary of the Trust Bank. She is married and has five children. As three of the children are still dependent on Fermina and her husband, the couple makes many sacrifices so that they can meet the basic needs of the children. They realize that education is a vital key to their successful futures and so the couple works hard. Fermina fabricates palm mats and delivers 50 each week to the local market. She is requesting a new loan with Friendship Bridge which she will use to invest in additional palm material for the mats as well as other materials. Fermina wants to take advantage of this time of the year to buy quantities of raw materials because this is the most economical time to make purchases as costs are down.

Each of the ladies in the Trust Bank is most grateful to Kiva investors and Friendship Bridge for this vital support which is really a lifeline for them. With these loans, the women can maintain or grow their businesses. With the monthly trainings, they can arm themselves with new knowledge to live their lives. The combination of loans and education is a winning one for the ladies of the Cruzche Trust Bank. They are able to step more confidently and empowered into a brighter future and create a better life for themselves, their families and their community.

loans.use: to buy palm material to make mats, as well as other materials.

loans.name: I Ketut

texts.en:
I Ketut made an early loan payment. The due date should have been next month. But, I Ketut sold a large amount of cacao to a big buyer and he earned a profit. He's very happy for that. To enlarge his business, I Ketut is applying for another loan from MUK. With the same loan size of 7,000,000 IDR, I Ketut will buy more cacao and a sow. He has a new plan to raise pigs at home and become a piglets seller.

By pursuing  this business, I Ketut is hoping to get satisfactory results so he can meet the needs of the family. He will save all the profit to support his business.

loans.use: to buy more cacao and a sow.

loans.name: Sumber Mulia Group

texts.en:
Ketut wants to increase her business by raising local pigs for pigroll. She needs a new loan to purchase three local pigs and renovate the cage. The pigs for pigroll are usually kept for only two or three months and then sold. Her husband supports her business by helping her to feed the pigs and clean the barn. Ketut saves her profit because she has a dream of renovating her kitchen.
 
Ketut and the other member of Sumber Mulia Group hope their businesses grow and support their family's income to fullfill the daily needs, school fees and savings.

loans.use: to purchase three local pigs and renovate the cage

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is from Mobod, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She is 25 years old and is married with kids.

Annabelle applied for her membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Annabelle is asking for financial assistance of Php 5,000 to buy additional stocks for her egg retail business. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy trays of eggs to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is married with two children. Marissa is 40 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Marissa grows and sells pigs to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy an additional piglet and feed for the pigs.

Marissa has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Marissa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy one piglet and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 51 years old and lives in San Jose, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with 6 children.

Melissa sells variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month she earns PHP 1400 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 13000 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Melissa has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Melissa hope to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 44 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with 7 children.

Rosalinda is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan to buy a sack of feed for her pigs.

Rosalinda has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to pay her children's school fees and supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to buy a sack of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie is 64 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with 5 children.

Nellie sells variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 40 years. Each month she earns PHP 2000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 14900 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Nellie has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future Nellie hope to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 60 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is single with no children.

Cristina sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month she earns 3000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14900 PHP to restock her store with basic commodities.

Cristina has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future Cristina hope to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Regina dreams of buying a new house and lot, and she hopes that her business will continue to flourish. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Guirellito

texts.en:
Guirellito is married, 46 years old and lives in Carangan, Ozamiz City. He owns a "sari-sari" store and has a computer shop business. He has had these businesses for two years. Each month, he earns PHP 10,000 doing these types of work. Recently, he has requested a loan for PHP 50,000 to restock his store with basic commodities and to buy a computer printer.

Guirellito has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Guirellito hopes to improve his living conditions and to make his businesses become successful someday.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities and to buy a computer printer

location.town: Ozamis-P2 Carangan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, necesita invertir en su negocio de venta de ropa por lo que está solicitando nuevamente más capital para comprar variedad de ropa para caballeros, damas y niños, lo que le ayudara a continuar satisfaciendo a sus clientes y mejorar su economía.
El préstamo anterior le dio oportunidad de surtir el inventario de ropa con la cual ha tenido mejores ventas, más clientes nuevos, mejores ingresos y ha cancelado puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
José needs to invest in his clothing sales business.  He is requesting a new loan because he needs more capital for purchasing a variety of men's, women's and children's clothing.  It will help him to continue satisfying his costumers and improve his finances. 
The previous loan gave José the opportunity to stock up his clothing inventory.  Since then, he has had better sales and more new customers.  He also punctually re-paid the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more vita, rice, pepper, oil, soap, and onions for her food business.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch is 54 years old. She is married and resides with six children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband help her run the business. All of her children are employed. They make an income of $28 daily. To improve her family’s finances, Touch is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase cattle to breed and resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she will earn more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed and resell when they gain weight

loans.name: Phala

texts.en: Phala is 27 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working as a sales clerk for more than three years, earning approximately $8 per day. Phala asks for a loan of $500 to purchase a plot of land next to her house. This purchase will help her expand her house’s yard and provide better space for her living. In the future, she would like to ask for another loan from KREDIT to build a guest house to rent.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land next to her house

loans.name: Sarith

texts.en: Sarith is 36 years old. He is married and resides with five children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a chef for more than five years, earning approximately $10 per day. His wife runs a food store. She makes an income of $5 daily. Due to lack of funds, Sarith is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase construction materials to fix his wife’s store. In addition, a part of this money will be used to buy a motorbike for family use. This money will help him decorate the store and provide a better environment for customers. In the future, he would like to run an additional business and send his children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix his wife's store

loans.name: Phanny

texts.en: Phanny is 28 years old. He is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has been working in construction for more than five years, earning approximately $6 per day. His wife is a rice farmer who makes an income of $1 daily. To improve his business, Phanny is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase construction tools to use in his business. This purchase will enable him to bid for bigger construction projects. In the future, he would like to take another loan from KREDIT to fix his house and send his children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools to use in his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and rebar to build a wall and a gutter

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVA VIDA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Norma ella es conviviente y tiene 36 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de golosinas, la socia vende chupetes, galletas, gaseosas y chocolates, ella tiene una carreta donde vende las golosinas, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 2 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chupetes,galletas,gaseosas y chocolates 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de zapatos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de golosinas.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Nueva Vida communal bank. This bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department. 

Norma, a 36 year old member, lives with her partner and has two children. She works in her business of selling candies, lollipops, cookies, sodas and chocolates. She has a cart where she sells the sweets from place to place from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. Norma already has two years with this business and it is treating her very well. Her dream is to run a grocery store. She is requesting the loan to buy lollipops, cookies, candies and chocolates.

The other members sell clothes, shoes, sweets and run a grocery store. 

Norma is grateful to those who form part of this dream by providing this loan and she pledges to make her payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: buy lollipops, cookies, soda and chocolates.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 59 years old and married with six children.

Zenaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of nipa to resell. Zenaida has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell nipa roofing business for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Zenaida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of nipa to resell.

loans.name: Edis

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Grupo De Crédito Quiroga.
En este lugar vive la señora Edis, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos  aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Edis es una gran ama de casa y buena esposa que realiza los créditos para ayudarle a su esposo en el negocio, el se dedica a la compra y venta de gallinas y otras aves de corral, el sale a los campos a comprar estos animalitos y luego viaja al centro de la ciudad o a otras ciudades a venderlos  con lo cual se gana lo necesario para el sustento diario, ella por su parte también se dedica a la cría de gallinas y chanchos con lo cual contribuye para solventar los gastos que genera el hogar.
Este crédito es para comprar gallinas, pavos, pollos pequeños para la cría y alimentos para los mismos. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos salen adelante. Sus sueños son tener una gran granja mas grande.
texts.en:
In the parish of Quiroga within the city of Calceta, there is a town where the people spend most of their time farming, raising animals, and selling their products. The Communal Bank "Quiroga" meets here every 15 days.

It is also in this place where Sra. Edis lives. She is 54 years old, married, and has six grown children, two of whom still live with her. Her husband is a merchant.

Doña Edis is an excellent homemaker and a good wife. She has utilized the loans to help with her husband's business. He buys and sells chickens and other types of poultry. Her husband travels to farms in order to buy these animals and then delivers them to the central part of the city and to other towns to sell. Whatever he earns is used to provide for their daily needs. Edis also spends time raising chickens and pigs in order to contribute toward the household expenses.

This loan will be used to buy hens, turkeys, and chicks to raise, as well as feed for these birds. Edis is a founding member of her Communal Bank and enjoys the fact that the loans have allowed her to get ahead. Her dreams include having a larger farm.

loans.use: to buy hens, turkeys, chicks, and poultry feed.

loans.name: Elsea

texts.en:
Elsea is 62 years old and married with two children.

Elsea works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to resell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc. Elsea has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Elsea aspires to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to resell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Maria Agripina

texts.es:
María, opta por otro préstamo para fortalecer el negocio de manera rápida, comprara ropa, zapatos y otros accesorios, con lo que poco a poco va ampliando su negocio y mantiene a sus clientes muy satisfechos.
Con el préstamo anterior pudo variar el tipo de ropa y medicina natural que ofrecía en su negocio, sus ventas mejoraron, atrajo a nuevos clientes y obtuvo mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
María is getting another loan to strengthen her business quickly.  She's going to buy clothing, shoes, and other accessories to keep on expanding her business little by little and to keep her customers satisfied.

With the previous loan María was able to vary the clothing and natural medicine she sold in her business.  Her sales improved, she attracted new customers, and she earned more income.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and other accessories

loans.name: Sandra Emelina

texts.es:
Sandra de 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, es ama de casa pero, por las tardes ayuda a su madre con la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal, vive con sus dos hijas y con una sobrina que cuida, porque los padres se fueron a Estados Unidos.

Desde hace 5 años, Sandra trabaja con su madre, aprendió muy bien el oficio y su madre le ha dado permiso de que ponga su propia venta al castado de la de ella.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar frutas de temporada, verduras y otras cosas más para iniciar su propio puesto de venta, que sabrá manejar gracias a lo que aprendió con su madre.

En un futuro quiere tener un puesto fijo y  convertir su negocio en una pequeña agencia donde se vendan productos básicos
texts.en:
Sandra, 37, is married and has two children.  She's a homemaker but in the afternoon she helps her mother sell fruits and vegetables in the city market.  She lives with her two daughters and a niece, whom she takes care of because her parents went to the United States.

Sandra has worked with her mother for five years.  She learned the job very well and her mother has given her permission to set up her own store next to hers.

She'll use the loan to buy seasonal fruit, vegetables, and other things to start her own sales stall, which she'll be able to run thanks to what she learned from her mother.

In the future Sandra wants to have a regular job and turn her business into a small branch where she sells basic products.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Las Productoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS PRODUCTORAS” iniciará el trigésimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho   integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Olga es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesanía, tejido de mantas, tienda de carnicería, ropa de bebe, atención de cabinas telefónicas, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Olga es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió después de haber asistido a una capacitación donde aprendió el manejo de este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz y fideo por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “LAS PRODUCTORAS” (The Producers) will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. The group consists of 8 members and is led by a Board of Directors where Olga is the Treasurer. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as handicraft, woven blankets, butcher shop, baby clothing, telephone booths, and a neighbourhood store. 

The loan they are taking out now will benefit small microenterprises where Olga is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago after receiving an invitation from a member who visited her at her house. She currently has a business selling food. She gained knowledge about this business after assisting in a training where she learned how to manage this business.  
    
The loan she is now receiving will be used to increase capital, purchasing rice and noodles wholesale, which will be purchased from the markets in the Department of La Paz. She will later make it and sell it. 

Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family as she is single and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she enjoys the loans, the health and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase rice and noodles wholesale.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 34 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married with 2 children.

Elsie operates her own sari-sari store (general store) to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month she earns 10000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 11000 PHP for additional capital.

Elsie has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future Elsie hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to display in her store such as coffee, shampoo, soap, and other basic needs items.

loans.name: Silvana

texts.en:
Silvana is 46 years old, married, and a resident of Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She earns a living through her buy-and-sell business. 

She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of Php 14,900  to purchase raw ingredients for her homemade products business.

Silvana deeply wishes to maintain a membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her home-made products business.

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Nhorn

texts.en:
Nhorn is 45 years old. She is widowed and resides with her son in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a house worker for more than a year, earning approximately $3 per day. Her son sells souvenirs. He makes an income of $7 each day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Nhorn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce their transportation expenses. 

In the future she would like to purchase a store for her son to sell souvenirs at the tourism site and build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Ari Yesenia

texts.es:
Ari  Yesenia de 33 años de edad, madre soltera con tres hijos menores de edad, bajo su responsabilidad. Es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser emprendedora, trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal. El negocio lo inicio por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos en su hogar por la falta de empleos fijos. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar, por falta de recursos económicos. En la actualidad lucha para brindarles  a sus hijos un futuro mejor.
Gracias a  su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica el servicio de fritanga en sus casas de habitación. Una fritanga es una pequeña venta de comida típica casera como gallo pinto, tacos, maduros, carne asada, pollo asados, tajadas, enchiladas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de materia prima para elaborar la comida o fritanga, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ari Yesenia is 33 years old and the single mother of three minor children under her care.  She is from Leon, located in the western part of the country.  She is known for being enterprising, hardworking, and with a desire for personal success.  She started her business out of a need to have a source of income and a lack of steady work.  Unfortunately she was not able to attend school due to a lack of financial resources.  Now she strives to provide a better future for her children. 

Thanks to her efforts, hard work, and desire to get ahead, she has a “fritanga” in her home.  A “fritanga” is a small restaurant where she sells typical home cooked food such as red chicken, tacos, “maduros,” grilled meats and chicken, tajadas, and enchiladas.  She works 12 hours a day selling her products. The goal for this loan is to stock her business by buying ingredients to make her food, or fritanga, so she can have a greater income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is thankful for the previous financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more stocks of mineral water needed in her business. Her loan also helped in the education of her children while her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. Aside from her mineral water business, she also owns a jeepney for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. She will also use the loan in buying more gallons of mineral water. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain their daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosita hopes to have additional jeepney and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a daily basis. A fellowship group gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Martir

texts.es:
Mártir, se ha decidido por otro crédito pues reconoce que su buena administración le ayuda a incrementar sus ingresos y fortalecer su negocio, en esta ocasión lo utilizara para invertirlo en la compra de concentrados para ganado, con lo que tendrá el alimento suficiente para la época de verano y cuando ya esté en condiciones de venderlo tener mejores ganancias.
Con el crédito anterior fortaleció el negocio mejorando su economía con la que ha cancelado sus deudas y mejorado el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Mártir, has decided to take another loan as he realizes good management helps him increase his income and strengthen his business. At this time he will use the loan to invest in the purchase of feed for his cattle, thus he will have enough food for the summer and when he is able to sell them, he’ll have better profits. 

With the previous loan he strengthened the business improving his finances by paying off his debts and improving his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase feed.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco, pertenece a una familia integrada por su esposa y un hijo, junto a su esposa se encarga de generar los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus gastos familiares, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, es un oficio que aprendió de su padre, para tener ingresos extras también aprendió el oficio de albañilería.
Con el préstamo invertirá en el pago de mano de obra para la recolección de la cosecha, con esto podrá cumplir en menor tiempo los pedidos de sus clientes también sus ganancias serán mejores, con las cuales continuara cumpliendo con los diferentes compromisos económicos que tiene.
Sueña con tener un área más grande de cultivo para aumentar sus ganancias y ofrecer a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco has a wife and son. He and his wife are responsible for generating the necessary income to cover household expenses. He grows staple crops. It’s a trade he learned from his father to earn extra income. He also learned masonry.

With the loan, he will invest in paying labourers to harvest. He will be able to fulfil his clients’ requests in less time and his earning will be higher, with which he will continue to meet his various financial commitments.

He dreams of having a bigger area to cultivate to increase his profits and provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay labourers to harvest.

loans.name: Cesar Alejandro

texts.es:
Cesar de 40 años de edad, es una persona acompañada convive con su esposa y sus hijas, estudio hasta noveno grado. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa e hijos(que van a la escuela) que le apoyan en la actividades comerciales y en el ordeño de los animales que poseen (vacas) 

Cesar junto a su esposa se dedican a vender productos de primera necesidad, en su vivienda oficio que aprendió de su madre;  durante la mañana mientras su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde él cuida las vacas que poseen.


El  préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar tres vacas que necesita para incrementar la producción de leche que ocupa para la elaboración de queso, crema que ofrece en su tienda. Él  planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de productos de primera necesidad,  la venta de lácteos y del préstamo para la compra de las vacas; podrá comprar un terreno para pastar sus animales ya que actualmente alquila.
texts.en:
Cesar is 40 years old, married, and lives with his wife and daughters.  He studied to ninth grade.  Every morning he rises at 5:00 am, along with his wife and children (who attend school), and who help him with his business activities and with milking the cows they have.

Cesar and his wife sell personal products from their home, which they learned from his mother.  In the mornings, while his wife works in the home, and in the evenings he cares for the cows.

He will use the money from this loan to buy three cows he needs to start milk production, that he uses to make cheese and cream that he sells in his store.  He plans to buy personal products, and with the income from their sale, from the sale of milk, and the loan, he will buy cows.  He will also be able to buy land on which to pasture the animals.  He currently rents.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Gonzalo De Jesús

texts.es:
Gonzalo es un hombre humilde, buen trabajador y querido por sus familiares y amigos, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, por quienes ha luchado incansablemente para sacarlos adelante.
Tiene 57 años de edad y, cuenta con una experiencia de aproximadamente 30 años dedicándose a guarnecer calzado, actividad que aprendió por medio de la observación; tiene un pequeño taller ubicado en su vivienda y cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado que contrata por días; de esta manera genera los ingresos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su familia y solventar los gastos básicos del hogar.
Su propósito es fortalecer y acreditar bien su negocio para así tener la posibilidad de generar oportunidades de empleo, tratando de aportar un granito de arena para disminuir el desempleo en la ciudad, por ello se motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor (pegante, tintes, hilos, entre otros), de esta forma disminuirá los costos de su trabajo y podrá obtener un nivel más alto de rentabilidad.
Todo esto le permitirá a Gonzalo seguir avanzando para tener la capacidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida y el bienestar de su núcleo familiar, además desea dejar un buen legado a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is a humble man and a good worker, loved by his friends and relatives.  He lives with his wife and two children for whom he works tirelessly to get ahead.

He is 57 years old and has been a cobbler for approximately 30 years.  He learned this by watching others and he has a small workshop in his home where he has one employee during the day.  This is how he generates enough income to support his family and pay the basic household expenses.  His purpose is to strengthen and accredit his business so that he has the possibility of generating employment opportunities, trying to lay a grain of sand to help with the unemployment situation in the city, so he is asking for a loan to buy supplies in quantity (glue, tints, thread, and other things).  In this way he can reduce the costs of his work and increase his profits.

All this will allow Gonzalo to continue moving forward to have the capacity to improve his living conditions and the wellbeing of his immediate family.  He also wants to leave a good legacy for his children.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: María Ximena

texts.es:
María es una joven emprendedora de 20 años de edad, con ganas de salir adelante y convertirse en una microempresaria exitosa.
A sus 20 años de edad, trabaja como emplead en una empresa de fabricación y venta de colchones, con lo que ha obtenido nuevos conocimientos y experiencia laboral; sin embargo ella desea incursionar en su propio negocio en el campo de la belleza y aplicar los conocimientos obtenidos en un curso de capacitación en belleza que realizó, inicialmente desea prestar sus servicios a domicilio, por ello se motiva para solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará herramientas de trabajo e insumos (secador, plancha para el cabello, tinturas, tratamientos capilares, esmaltes para uñas, entre otros), esto le permitirá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo que por el momento realizará durante los fines de semana, mientras estabiliza su economía y logra independizarse completamente.
María se proyecta hacia un futuro cercano siendo toda una estilista profesional, teniendo su propia sala de belleza en la que pueda consentir a sus clientes y generando oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
