Maria is a young 20 year old entrepreneur with a desire to get ahead and become a successful small businesswoman.  

At age 20 she works as an employee for a mattress factory and sales outlet, where she learned new skills and got work experience.  However she wants to start her own business in the beauty arena and expand her knowledge from the beauty training course she completed.  Initially she wants to provide in home services and is asking for a loan to buy work tools and supplies (a dryer, curling iron, tints, hair treatment, nail polish, and other things).  This will allow her to begin her plans on the weekends, while she sets herself up financially and breaks away on her own.

Maria, thinking about the future, will set herself up professionally and have her own beauty salon where she can gain her own customers and create employment opportunities.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom is 34 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who makes an income of $2 daily. Due to lack of funds, Mom is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase bricks and cement to build a room and bathroom at the ground floor of her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to purchase farmland for rice cultivation and send her children to a good school. In addition, she wants to build fence around her house.

loans.use: to purchase bricks and cement to build a room and bathroom at the ground floor of her house

loans.name: Warna Sari Group

texts.en:
The plans that were already drawn up at the beginning of the loan went smoothly. Sales of pork can be rotated within the group so that it is mutually beneficial. All members of the group got satisfactory results and they can meet the daily needs of their families and also set aside some for saving.

To further improve its business, the Warna Sari group went for a new loan. This loan was used to purchase local pigs for pork rolls. Pigs for pork rolls are sold every two months. Luh, besides maintaining sows, also used the loan to buy local pigs. Luh and all members of the Warna Sari group hope with this new plan they will be able to increase the income and welfare of their families.

loans.use: to buy local pigs

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more merchandise for her direct selling business which has been running for sixteen years now. Her income from the business is assisting with everyday household expenditures.

She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise to increase her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Iluminada hopes that her business will last longer and dreams to have their own house. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business. This is also where she can draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 21 years old, single and supports one member of his family. He runs a retail shop in Chemundu trading centre in Nandi County. He has been in this business for the last three years. He gets an average monthly income of KES 20,000.

He plans to use the amount borrowed of KES 45,000 to purchase maize flour, sugar, rice and cooking fat for resale. He will use the profits from the retail shop business to sustain himself and his dependents.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, sugar, rice and cooking fat for resale.

loans.name: Sarai Del Transito

texts.es:
Saraí, necesita materia prima para elaborar los panes, comprara pan, pollo, aceite, aderezos, embutidos y bebidas, de esta manera tendrá un negocio fortalecido.
Con la inversión anterior pudo tener lo necesario para trabajar por un tiempo, logro aumentar su clientela, sus ventas aumentaron y su economía mejor un poco.
texts.en:
Saraí needs ingredients to make sandwiches.  She'll buy bread, chicken, oil, seasoning, cold cuts, and beverages so she can strengthen her business.

With the previous loan she was able to have what she needed to work for a period of time, she managed to increase her clientele and her sales, and her finances improved a little bit.

loans.use: to buy bread, chicken, oil, seasoning, cold cuts, and beverages

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Estelita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing. Estelita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items to resell like canned goods, milk, coffee, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc. for her general store business.

Estelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to resell like canned goods, milk, coffee, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. Beatriz has been in business for 12 years. Beatriz earns more income from pig fattening. Beatriz has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jozfain

texts.en: Jozfain is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She admitted this fact: that if her husband worked alone for their family, then he would not be able to meet the household expenses and the educational needs of their children. This is the reason she started tailoring at home – to support her family. She has been running a tailoring business for five years to help support her family. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.With Christmas upcoming, she has a heavy burden of work. To cope with the demand she has need of reels, thread, packs of buttons, laces, zippers, etc. Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase these items. In this way, she will be able to stitch up more dresses. Jozfain hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business. Jozfain is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy reels, thread, packs of buttons, laces, zippers etc. for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en: Hameeda is a hard-working 35-year-old housewife. She is the mother of five children. Her husband owns a vegetable shop which is the only source of income for their family. He purchases a variety of fresh and seasonal vegetables from the field and sells them in the main market. Now that he has rented a shop for selling his vegetables, he needs to purchase vegetables for his shop. Hameeda requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase vegetables. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to increase his net income. She will save the profits for the future needs or medical expenses of her children. Hameeda prays for the success of her husband’s business. She is feeling relaxed and happy after receiving this loan.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is a 43-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and seven children in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. She has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods for his general store like sugar, rice, and biscuits to satisfy his clients more professionally, as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

Rasheeda and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to buy inventory for the general store.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 28 years old, a hard-working and independent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and a son, who is in the third grade. Her husband is a barber and his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. For three years, Asia has been running a beauty salon, and she wants to purchase some more cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon. 

For that reason, Asia has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. When she makes a profit, first of all she will repay the loan amount to Kiva and then she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is much too congested. She hopes that her business grows more and she is very much thankful to both BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 43 years old, married and blessed with five children, all of whom he provides for. He runs a small scale horticulture business as well as a retail shop business in Kiptildil village in Nandi County. His wife supports him in running the business and producing additional income.

He has been doing the two businesses for the last eight years. From these businesses he gets a monthly income of KES 30,000. He has borrowed a loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to start a new green tea leaves hawking business as well buy stock for his retail shop.

He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business as well as diversify his businesses to increase his income. His hope is to improve his living standards and be financially stable. He also hopes to save money to enable him to pay school fees for his children as well as expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more tea leaves and to add more retail items for sale.

loans.name: Elcin

texts.en:
Elcin is 36 years old, an internationally displaced person (IDP), who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two children. He is a very well known barber and established his business in 2009, and through practice, he mastered his field. Elcin is his family’s sole breadwinner. He is a farmer too and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables in his own land. 

Elcin is responsible for the living expenses of three members of his family. For this reason, he works hard and puts substantial effort into continuing to improve his business. In April 2012, he opened his current shop and is working hard to develop it. Because his income is low compared to his high expenses, Elcin is unable to save enough cash to improve and develop his business. His monthly profit from this business is 70 AZN. For this reason, he is acquiring a loan of 2,000 AZN from Kiva partner Aqroinvest to increase his business capital with special gels, beauty supplies and necessary tools for developing his business. This is going to be his 5th loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to increase his business capital with special gels, beauty supplies and necessary tools for developing his business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 53 years old and is from Nakuru. She is married and has five children aged 22, 19, 14, 5 and 4 years old.

She owns rental houses, a business she has been running for the last ten years. To enable her to complete some unfinished rental houses, she has applied for her second loan of KES 50,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES 50,000 and she hopes to use the profits anticipated from her expanded business to educate her children and to pay back her loan.

She hopes for a prosperous future.

loans.use: to complete some rental houses.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Soeun is 55 years old. She is married and resides with six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating vegetables and fattening up animal for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is involved in rice cultivation and fishing. He makes an income of $5 each day. Four of her children are employed in garment factories. They earn about $20 per day. Soeun asks for a loan of $700 to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds for her husband to use for farming. This money will help him obtain enough ability to grow rice. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds for her husband to use for farming

loans.name: Milagros Del Rosario

texts.es:
Milagros del Rosario tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobo, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta carnes de cerdos, desde hace más de 10 años, por lo que cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos y pavos para abastecer su negocio por temporada navideña y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Milagros del Rosario, 35, lives with her children in the district of Buenos Aires, two hours from the city of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.  The community is known for its carob forests, and the residents work in farming, commerce, and ranching.

Milagros del Rosario has made a living selling pork for more than 10 years, so she has a lot of customers.  She has requested a loan for 4,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy pigs and turkeys to stock her business for the Christmas season.  This way she'll generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and turkeys

loans.name: Sebastiana Ymelda

texts.es:
Sebastiana Ymelda tiene 66 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad ubicada cerca al valle del río Jequetepeque, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a una hora con veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes arroz, azúcar, aceite entre otros en una bodeguita ubicada en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería panetones, chocolate de taza entre otros, para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Sebastiana Ymelda, 66, lives with her husband in the district of Zaña, a farming, commerce, and ranching community located near the Jequetepeque River Valley an hour and twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.  

She makes a living selling rice, sugar, oil, and other groceries in a small store located in her home.

Sebastiana Ymelda has requested a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy panettone, chocolate, and other merchandise to stock her business and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store which has been running for ten years now. Her loan also helped in the education of her children. Her income from her business, on the other hand, is assisting her family's everyday expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Adelaida dreams that her business will last longer and hopes that her family will not be in poverty. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Deus

texts.en: Deus is a 37-year-old married man with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He runs a beer and soda depot and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children and also has started construction of his commercial houses. The seasonal nature of the business affects him since sales increase during festive seasons and decline in other months. Good father that he is, he desires to educate his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification and to open an outlet in a nearby trading center. Deus intends to use the loan to buy beer and soda to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: Leonard is 38 years old and has five children. He is a resident of Kagadi, Uganda. He runs a produce business, which he has been doing for seven years. He started as a builder, then switched to carpentry where he got capital and engaged in the produce business. From this business, Leonard has acquired the capital to start a school. He would like to educate his five children and build a permanent house despite inadequate capital that affects the growth of his businesses.  Leonard is requesting a loan to buy salt, sugar, soap and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, soap and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 62 years old and widowed with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elsie has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 9,500 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like coconut, rice and sugar for her food vending business.

Elsie has been in this business for 23 years. Elsie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like coconut, rice and sugar for her food vending business.

loans.name: Elizardo

texts.en: Elizardo provides for the family needs with his income that he derives from farming. He has been growing and harvesting corn for many years, earning well, and he has successfully repaid his previous loans from GDMPC. Currently, he borrowed a new loan to buy organic fertilizer in order to boost the farm. He hopes to see his children become successful in the near future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Rahiema

texts.en:
Rahiema previously accessed a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rahiema dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to be a successful businesswoman. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ailleen

texts.en: Ailleen is married with three children. She helps her husband earn a living by operating a general store in her village. She has been selling assorted groceries for more than five years, and she earns well from this. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to expand her business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Asif

texts.en: Asif is 37 years old, married and has three kids. He is an IDP person (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzulu refugee. He is a very successful entrepreneur who sells chickens and ducks, which brings him a stable income. Asif is a very hardworking man. For the past three years, he has been raising chickens and ducks and is very active in poultry. He usually buys small ducks, raises and fattens them for five to six months, and then sells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His father also helps him in this business because it is the only income for their family. From this business Asif 's monthly income is 120 AZN. He has applied for his first loan of 2000 AZN. With this money, he wants to invest in the business and buy more small chickens in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more small chickens in order to generate more revenue.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
This is Jinky, 27, resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Mario, a welder and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jinky operates the buying and selling business of her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell it with a little profit. Her products are women’s clothes, handkerchiefs, kids’ shoes, towels and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buying from her due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items like women’s clothes, handkerchiefs, kids’ shoes, towels and other products to expand her product inventory.

Jinky dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for RTW products and merchandise items like women’s clothes, handkerchiefs, kids’ shoes, towels and other products to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Zebuniso

texts.ru: Зебунисо 37 лет. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Зебунисо живет одна. Она имеет две высшее образование. Первое образование у нее педагогическое, а второе экономическое. Зебунисо раньше работала в государственной организации в социальном отделе. Ей очень нравилась ее работа, но у нее была маленькая зарплата. Поэтому она решила организовать свой бизнес и увеличить доход. Она планирует открыть своё ателье по пошиву женской одежды, и сдать в аренду портнихам каждую швейную машинку. Зебунисо запрашивает займ на сумму 900 долларов США для покупки швейных машинок. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Она очень добрая и честная женщина.
texts.en: Zebuniso is 37, divorced, and childless.  She is a kind and honest woman who lives by herself, and has 2 university degrees.  Her first degree was in education, and her second was in economics.  She previously held a government job in social services; one which she liked a great deal, but which didn't pay very well.  She decided that she'd like to move on to a higher-paying job, and has plans to set up her own business making women's clothing and renting out sewing machines to people who make such clothing.  She is requesting a loan of $900 (USD) to buy sewing machines, and is counting on your kindness amd charity to get the money she needs to start up her business.

loans.use: buy sewing machines to help start up a new business

loans.name: Dubán De Jesús

texts.es:
Dubán, a sus 63 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como reciclador y es propietario de una chatarrería ubicada en un local arrendado donde almacena los artículos que recicla para luego venderlos; lleva 6 años desempeñándose en esta labor y adicionalmente genera un empleo directo; trabaja de lunes a sábado y así se ha ganado la vida y ha logrado generar ingresos para llevar el sustento a su familia.
Actualmente solicita el préstamo para comprar chatarra al por mayor (cobre, hierro, cartón, entre otros) para luego venderlo y así generar un mejor nivel de utilidades.
Dubán, con empuje y dedicación ha sacado adelante su negocio, pero sueña poder adquirir un local propio para tener una mayor rentabilidad y poder continuar velando por el bienestar de su familia y ofrecerles mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Dubán, 63, works as a recycler and is an owner of a scrapyard located on leased property where he stores recycled items that are to be sold later. He has been working this job for 6 years and also generates direct employment. He works Monday to Saturday and through his work he makes enough to support himself and his family.

Presently, he is requesting this loan to buy scrap such as copper, iron and cardboard at wholesale to later resell them and generate a higher level of profits.

Dubán, with drive and dedication, has managed to get ahead in his business but he dreams of being able to acquire his own place to have higher profitability and continue to ensure the welfare of his family and offer them better living conditions.

loans.use: buy scrap such as copper, iron and cardboard at wholesale.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her house. She has four years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market since he has maintained many contacts over the years. Parveen is a mother of six children and she is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan to buy packs of salts, grains, and beverages to meet the increasing demand in her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 46-year-old lady whose devotions are all for her husband, who is earning a very low income. He provides sheltering services for people whose houses are under construction.  He works on a contractual basis and most of the time he is unable to get any contracts for sheltering services. Recently he has gotten a huge contract but he does not have enough sheltering material to provide proper services. Abida has requested a loan so her husband will be able to buy more sheltering material to provide his best services. With the profits she will arrange the marriage ceremony of their elder son. Abida is very thankful to the Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that Kiva lenders will take pity on her and support her in the form of raising funds.

loans.use: To buy sheltering materials for her husband's business.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 50-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and a son in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Since 2010, her husband has had a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family’s needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. His wife Nusrat has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan. With the money her husband can buy a variety of goods for his general store, which will satisfy his clients more professionally as well as help him to increase his savings so he can provide a better future for his son. Nusrat and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family. She is thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Batsaikhan, 48 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2011, and before this, he had worked as serviceman. Currently, his wife is unemployed and stays at home. Their elder son graduated last summer and was recruited into a financial institution as an accountant. His younger son goes to high school. 

Recently, he has decided to run an automobile spare parts sales business. For this cause, he is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy automobile spare parts such as brakes, air ducts, coil wire and tires. According to his calculation, this business will greatly increase his family's living standards.

loans.use: to sell spare parts to local people

loans.name: Darma Sedana Group

texts.en:
After six months of raising pigs, Ni Ketut sold three of her fattened pigs and made a profit of IDR 300,000 per month. These results have been deducted from her loans. Together with her husband, who is a farmer, Ni Ketut was able to develop pig raising efforts so as to help the family income.

These results are certainly very useful for families and can help with their daily needs. Although the price of piglets as well as pig feed are currently expensive, Ni Ketut retains a passion for development of the pig business within the group she leads.

After making repayment, one of the members decided to resign from the group because she earns enough profit to have adequate capital and run the business by herself.

After successfully repaying the previous loan, the Darma Sedana Group decided to continue the loan process and are each getting 1.5 million IDR. Ni Ketut is still trusted as the head of the group. With full support from her husband because this is considered beneficial to the family economy, she is optimistic the business will run smoothly. The group of 12 members is taking a new loan of 18 million IDR.

Ni Ketut receives 1.5 million IDR of the loan, and she will use this loan to buy three piglets for fattening. Ni Ketut is hoping to gain more profit than she did as a result of the previous loan, which only produced a profit of IDR 300,000 per month.

loans.use: to buy three piglets for fattening

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora previously accessed a 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase additional stock of merchandise like men's and women's ready-to-wear items. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stock of merchandise like men's and women's ready-to-wear items. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nora hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that her family will have their own house and lot. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of merchandise like men's and women's ready-to-wear items.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en: To make a living, Arnel grows rice in his own farm, and he earns well for the family. He has been doing this for eight years. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to buy fertilizer and pay for weeding maintenance costs. He is determined to improve the farm to provide a better living for his family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for weeding maintenance costs

loans.name: Rodena

texts.en: Rodena is selling grocery goods in her retail store while helping her husband in operating a motor transportation business. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to repair the existing vehicle. She also uses the vehicle in carrying her purchased goods from the market. In the future, she wants to own a four-wheeled vehicle to be used for the business.

loans.use: to repair the existing vehicle

loans.name: Brefna Cristina

texts.es: Brefna es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, casada y madre de tres hijos. Tiene 26 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida. Inicio su negocio cuando tenía 15 años vendiendo arroz de leche y con las ganancias obtenidas comenzó a vender enchilada, tacos entre otros, hoy en día cuenta con un negocio prospero. Su meta próxima es establecer un restaurante donde pueda ofrecer comida a la carta. Solicita el crédito para la compra de Arroz, Leña, Plátanos, Verduras entre otros para la elaboración de la comida que ofrece. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para ofrecer una amplia variedad de comidas a sus clientes. Su plan futuro es que su negocio crezca y logre ofrecer frescos y gaseosas.
texts.en: Brefna is from Granada.  She is 26 years old, married and has three children.  She is a merchant who sells food and started doing this when she was 15 years old and sold rice pudding.  She used her earnings to start selling enchiladas, tacos, and other things.  Now she has a successful business.  Her goal is to set up a restaurant where she can sell food from a menu.  She is asking for this loan to buy rice, firewood, plantains, vegetables, and other things to make the food she sells.  She estimates that this loan will be of great help to offer an great variety of food to her customers.  Her plan for the future is to grow her business and also sell soft drinks and beverages.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 48 years old and is from Nakuru. She is married and is blessed with one child aged 22 years old.

She is a farmer who practices mixed farming, a business she has been running for the last ten years. She has applied for her second loan of KES 40,000 from VisionFund Kenya to enable her buy a heifer.

Her monthly income right now is KES 20,000 and her intention is to use the profits to provide the basic needs for her farming activities. She hopes to be a successful dairy farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy a heifer

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en: Noreen, a 32 year old woman, is living with her spouse and three children in the remote place of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. It’s really difficult for her husband to run his family with his little income; as a result she wants to change her life through hard work in her embroidery business. For that she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from KIVA Partner BRAC Pakistan to buy cloth, thread, and other materials for her business. She has almost 5 years experience in stitching and embroidery. She is very much hopeful that this finance will help her to lead a happy life.

loans.use: To puchase embroidery equipment.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 38-year-old lady who is passing her life with her seven children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is taking a loan for her husband, who owns a small embroidery firm on partnership. He has been running this business for many years; but a few days ago one of his partners withdrew his invested amount. To compensate for the withdrawn amount each partner is contributing according to his financial position. Her husband does not have enough money for the investment in the embroidery business. Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can make the investment like the other partners. Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's embroidery business.

loans.name: Saba

texts.en: Saba is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has run a beauty parlor for many years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Due to her great service, she has become very well-known on her street. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a larger variety of cosmetic products for the parlor. Because she has a low amount of cash, she contacted BRAC Pakistan and applied for her second loan. She wants to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. Saba is hopeful that she can cater to more customers in time. She expects a boost in her earnings due to her loan, and she plans to spend a part of her profits on her family.

loans.use: To buy products for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Kaneez Fatima Group

texts.en:
Kaneez , a hard-working  51-year-old woman, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, 2 sons, and 2 daughters. One son and both daughters are studying, and her husband is an auto mechanic. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Kaneez is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profits in the future. 

As a part of 4-person lending group, Kaneez has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and to be able to save for her family’s future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Epifania requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of ready-to-wear to sell. She has been in this business for 2 years now. Epifania would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Putri Mandiri Group

texts.en:
MUK had given a loan for the seventh time to the Putri Mandiri group, and this repayment was fully paid on time. Ni Ketut maintained four fattened pigs, and when they sold, she earned a satisfactory profit. At the beginning, she bought piglets for 1 million IDR (Indonesian rupiah) and she spent on feed for six months 4.8 million IDR. Her sales were 10 million IDR because the price for 1 kilogram of pork is 230,000 IDR. After deducting all the costs and her repayment, her net profit is 4.2 million IDR. She’s very happy that all her hard work paid off.

The Putri Mandiri group is receiving their new loan. After being evaluated by the field officer, they are receiving the same loan size. During the disbursement, one member couldn't attend because she had a religious ceremony in her temple.

Ni Ketut, as the head, personally feels the benefits from the pig breeder program. With the eight loans, the profit helped her income to fullfill her daily needs and also some savings. Although she still needs the loan, she and the members of Putri Mandiri group keep their spirit to maintain the business. In this loan, she will use it to purchase five superior piglets and feed. She will also use her own money because the price for piglets is quite expensive now. 

The Putri Mandiri group hopes the cooperation between MUK, Kiva, lenders and the group runs smoothly and still can support them until they can have enough savings to use as capital to run the businesses by themselves.

loans.use: To buy five superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Chori

texts.ru: 44 летний Чори из села района Шахритус хочет начать свой бизнес по купле откорму и продаже скотов. Он сам не может начать бизнес потому, что его финансовое положение не позволяет ему осуществить задуманный план, но если он начнет деятельность животноводства, то жизненные условия, в том числе финансовое положения семьи изменится в лучшую сторону. По этой причине он просит Вас помочь купить маленьких скотов, которые станут основоположниками в новом бизнесе. Чори планирует купить скотов на рынке "Искра" района Шахритус. Чори надеется, что он получить помощь. Помогите ему.
texts.en: 44-year-old Chori is from a village in the Shahrituz region of Tajikistan, and would like to start his own livestock-farming business, buying young animals and fattening them for resale.  He lacks the money to go forward with his plans at present, but would be able to improve both his living conditions and financial situation if he had the capital to get his business up and running.  It's for this reason that he's seeking your help; he is requesting a loan to buy some young livestock to start his business with.  He plays on buying livestock from a market called "Iskra" ("Spark"), and is counting on your help.

loans.use: buy some young livestock to set up a livestock-farming business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more farm inputs and fertilizer needed in her business. Aside from her business that was helped from her loan, her children also benefited with the assistance to their education. Her income from the business is helping with their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband, who is a carpenter, are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

She would like to apply for a new 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and the education of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rosalinda hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams to help those who are in need. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel previously accessed a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of the tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and pay for more maintenance for the tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maricel dreams that she will have additional units of tricycles and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of the tricycle.

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en: Mr. Myagmarsuren lives with his family in Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Since coming here from the countryside, he has been making and selling Mongolian gers to local people. He is requesting a loan of 7000000 MNT to buy hardwood floors, low pressure heaters, fiberglass, and foam for ger renovation. Installing hardwood floor and low pressure heaters is crucial to keeping the heat of a ger. Also, the family will burn less coal for ger-heating, thus releasing less pollutants into air. The borrower is one of our organization's reliable clients and has paid his every installment on schedule after taking his first loan.

loans.use: to buy a low pressure heater, hardwood floor and fiberglass

loans.name: Abravi

texts.fr: Âgée de 38ans, Abravi mariée et maman d'01 enfant de 13ans revend des friperies, bazins et bijoux de façon ambulante. Elle a démarré en 2000 et s'approvisionne chez les grossistes au Grand marché de Lomé. A l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année, elle souhaite élargir sa clientèle c'est pour cela elle sollicite un second prêt pour acheter plus de marchandises. Elle espère créer une boutique et assurer l'éducation de son enfant.
texts.en: At 38 years old, Abravi is a married mother of a 13-year-old and sells used clothing, damask, and jewelry as a street vendor. She started doing this in 2000 and stocks up at wholesalers at the grand market in Lome. With the year-end holidays approaching, she hopes to increase her clientele, which is why she is seeking a second loan to buy more merchandise. She hopes to have a boutique and ensure her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy used clothing, damask, and jewelry

loans.name: Tsedensodnom

texts.en: Mrs. Tsedensodnom lives with her husband and youngest daughter in Dundgovi, in the southern province of Mongolia. She and her husband have been raising livestock for 36 years and are considered to be the best herdsmen in whole Mongolia. Their other three daughters all live and work in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She is requesting a loan of 3000000 MNT to buy a truck for transporting diary products to local markets. The truck will greatly help her business by saving time and increasing the amount of products to sell and currently she uses oxcart for transportation. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to buy a truck for transporting dairy products to local markets

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita previously accessed a 35,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy farming materials and other supplies needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a variety store for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing this loan to buy farming materials and other supplies needed for her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Julita dreams that all her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better living. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farming materials and other supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Zulhumor

texts.ru: Зулхумор родилась в 1966 году. Она вдова и имеет 3 детей. Зулхумор занимается купле продажей детских игрушек на местном рынке. Зулхумор имеет свою точку продажи. Она этим бизнесом занимается уже более 7 лет. Она имеет хорошую репутацию среди местных бизнесменов. Ее сын учится в университете. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына, но не имеет денег. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zulhumor was born in 1966.  She is a widow and has 3 children.  Zulhumor is involved in reselling children's toys at a local market.  Zulhumor has her own retail outlet.  She has been involved in this business for over 7 years.  She has a good reputation among local businessmen.  Her son attends a university.  She has to pay for her son's tuition, but does not have money.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition

loans.name: Isidora

texts.en:
This is Isidora, 47, a resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Isayas, a driver and a father to their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Isidora oversees and owns operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle unit that can carry up to four passengers to their destinations within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business, the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of the tricycle.

Isidora hopes to buy another tricycle unit and dreams that her family will be prosperous. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of the tricycle unit.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
This is Anabel, 51, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Alberto, her business partner and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anabel operates a market stall. She sells fruits and vegetable products in the community market. She buys a quantity of fruits and vegetables and sells it per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 5,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruits to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Anabel hopes that her business will grow even more and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fruits to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гульнаре 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Гульнары - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гульнара занимается животноводством и полеводством, параллельно реализует молоко. По хозяйству помогает супруг, он также дополнительно работает в строительной бригаде, занимается внутренней и внешней обделкой домов. Гульнара по характеру спокойная, трудолюбивая и доброжелательная. Животноводством и полеводством начала заниматься 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульнары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 нетель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульнара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гульнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Gulnara is 46 years old, married and raising 5 children together with her husband. Gulnara has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and farming and selling milk parallel to this.  Her husband helps her with the business and also works at a construction brigade, where he involved in interior and exterior home remodeling.  Gulnara is calm, hardworking and kind.  She became involved in animal husbandry and farming 20 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulnara's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow and 1 heifer.  The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Gulnara requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to increase livestock headcount. Gulnara plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money for her children's continued education.

loans.use: to buy cows and increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
This is Magdalena, a 54-year-old resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Noli and a mother to their children. She, together with husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Magdalena operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from those round palm sized ones to the much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. She also makes underwear. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business.

Magdalena hopes to expand her business and have more customers and dreams to have a better living standard.
She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week. Her she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
This is Rita, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is a widow and she has children who are all working. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rita operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers dresses and gowns. She also makes curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other items for the home. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms occur all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business.

Rita dreams that her business will continue and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Sambi Ternak Group

texts.en:
The Sambi Ternak Group is located in the north part of Bali near Pumeteran beach. The husbands of the members of the group work as farmers or fishermen and as Balinese women, the members also support their husbands' income by raising pigs at home.

After several loan periods have passed, it can be observed that the Sambi Ternak Group has managed to boost incomes for their families. This can be seen from the level of sales and livestock populations they have maintained.

Ketut has even been able to increase the population of her pigs. Ketut is very grateful for all that she has from her business and her family. She said she is very happy about her situation now, but she still needs a new loan to further improve business again.

After successfully paying off the last loans, they proceed to the next period with the purpose to improve their businesses. Ketut, head of the group, is coordinating members in the purchase of piglets so that all members get good piglets. With the loan, she will buy super quality feed for her sows and piglets to make sure they grow healthily. 

In this period, besides increasing the loan size, there’s a change in the Sambi Ternak membership. One member resigned because she had an accident and broke her arm. For now, she can’t work and only depends on her husband. She said she will join the group again after she heals from the broken arm. She was replaced by new member.

loans.use: to buy super quality feed for her sows and piglets.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia helps her husband by working in their own farm to make a living. She has been doing this for eleven years and she earns well from it. She also has successfully repaid her previous loan that she used for farm inputs. Currently, she takes a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer for the next crop. She wants to expand her farming business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for the next crop.

loans.name: Felimon

texts.en:
Felimon previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more ingredients for his fish balls and other dainties and sweet meats that he sells. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan that he will use to pay for more ingredients for his fish balls and other dainties and sweet meats that he sells. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Felimon hopes that his business will flourish even more and dreams to have other sources of income. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more ingredients for his fish balls and other dainties and sweet meats that he sells.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy the gardening materials needed for her business. Her business has existed for ten years now and she also has a direct selling business for additional income. She is already a widow and she works hard to provide for everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials such as wire and basket, and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marcelina hopes to be more successful in business and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her fellowship co-members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials such as wire and basket, and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Floribelia

texts.es:
Floribelia, solicita un crédito nuevo para comprar telas, broches, zippers, botones, hilos, vitaminas y alimento para ganado, esto le ayudara a tener los materiales necesarios para continuar trabajando en la sastrería así como también mejorara las condiciones del ganado que posee.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a mejorar su economía, tiene mayor demanda de su servicio, con sus nuevos ingresos ha mejorado las condiciones familiares y ha comprado ganado.
texts.en: Floribelia requests a new loan to buy to buy fabrics, clasps, zippers, buttons and threads, and vitamins and food for livestock. This will help her have all the necessary materials to continue working as a seamstress, as well as to improve the conditions of the cattle which she owns. The previous loan helped her to improve her financial situation. She has more demand for her services, and with her new income she has improved her family's conditions and purchased cattle.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, clasps, zippers, buttons and threads, and vitamins and food for livestock

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es una persona de 47 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos: cuatro  hombres y una mujer, el y su familia viven en el Cantón Xajaxac, Sololá
El es agricultor, dedicado al cultivo de  papa, zanahoria y repollo; su cultivo lo comercializa en el mercado de su comunidad y a  través de  esta actividad obtiene ingresos aceptables que le ayudan al sostenimiento de su familia. Lleva más de 25 años realizando esta labor junto a sus dos hijos menores quienes lo apoyan en todo el trabajo que requieren este cultivo.
El está  solicitando un préstamo de Q 2,500.00 para compra de semilla y fertilizante orgánico para la siembra y el mantenimiento de papa.
El sueño más importante de Jorge es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y asi brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 47 years old and has 5 children: 4 boys and 1 girl. He and his family live in Xajaxac canton, Solola. He is a farmer who cultivates potatoes, carrots and cabbage. He sells his produce in the community market and through this activity he earns sufficient income to support his family. He has spent over 25 years performing this job together with his two youngest sons, who help him with all of the work required for cultivation. 

He is requesting a loan of Q 2,500 to buy seeds and organic fertilizer for the sowing and maintenance of potatoes. Jorge's most significant dream is to improve the conditions of his home in order to provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy seeds and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en: Mr. Batbayar is 35 years old and lives with his son in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His main income comes for his taxi service. In order to increase his income, he decided to work together with his old friend, a former second hand car dealer, to import and sell automobiles. Actually he won't do anything except contribute to the startup capital. He will receive a share each month proportional to the sales. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT. Also in the future, he wants to run tire repair shop. The borrower is a caring father to his son.

loans.use: to contribute to startup capital.

loans.name: Mafinga Group

texts.en:
Grace, who is in her late 30's, is married with one son who goes to school. She has been running a supermarket for four years. She works from 8:30am to 10:00pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be Grace's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy fast-moving items so that she can meet her customers' demands. She paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, cover household expenses, and start building her house.   She shared her view that the company should reduce interest and consider giving good clients a chance for an individual loan. She will use this loan to buy supermarket items to meet her customers' demands. She dreams of owning a wholesale shop. 

Grace will share this loan with her loan group, Mafinga, which has seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy supermarket items to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Meet Alice, a farmer living in the highlands of Kericho, which is a rich tea growing area, with her husband and 4 children. Her husband has been farming for 8 years and she produces and sells milk, and eggs. She loves dairy farming the most as more milk is produced and she is able to earn more from it. The challenge she faces with dairy farming is lack of consistency in the dairy industry.
Alice chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of their easy loan repayment terms and their loans have a low interest rate. This loan will help her construct a dairy unit for her dairy cows which will give her cows the right environment for more milk production. This will bring in more income and allow her to educate her children well. It will also improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Farhat Gul

texts.en: Farhat Gul is a 52-year-old hard working housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, 3 daughters and 2 sons. Her husband is a carpenter by profession but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore for the past 4 years, in addition to carpentry he also drives taxi at night. Currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. Farhat Gul has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan for the amount of repairing the engine in her husband's taxi. With the profits her husband wants to open a new carpentry shop in the future. Farhat Gul desires to provide a quality education to her children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: to pay for repairing the taxi engine in her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as oils, condiments, yucca, beverages, among others

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.en:
Ni Luh sold her three piglets and earnt a net profit of 1,500,000 IDR after deducting the cost of feed and making her payment. She’s really happy for that and has decided to continue her loan to increase the population of her pigs. All the profit will be used for her family's daily needs and school fees.

To improve the quality of livestock, the Sari Mertha Group continue its lending. This loan will be used to buy super quality piglets for fattening. Selling prices for super quality pork remain high and these are easier to sell.

Ni Luh will use the loan to buy four super quality piglets for fattening. The pigs will be maintained for six months. She hopes the pigs' growth will be healthy and the ideal weight will be achieved. Ni Luh is planning to save all the profits that will be used for working capital.      

As per the agreement, the Sari Mertha make their payment on 17 January 2014. With 10 members, they can make the payment together of 14,500,000 IDR. During the loan period, they can manage the pigs well. With the instructions of their Vet, the group keep the pigs by give them nutritious feed and vitamins.

loans.use: to buy four super quality piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie and her husband earn well from their banana farm. They have been growing and harvesting bananas for more than two years to make a living. To finance farm maintenance and fertilization costs, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit. She is hopeful to gain more return from the farm and wants to improve for a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to finance farm maintenance and fertilization costs.

loans.name: Melva Imelda

texts.es:
Melva tiene 34 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con el esposo y con suS hijos de 13,15,9 y 10 años, Vive en el  Cantón Mocache provincia de los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama Juntos Triunfaremos se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jhon F Kennedy 2, perteneciente al cantón Mocache cerca de Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Melva se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace tres años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y en Mocache, los vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para la siembra de maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para mejorar la situación económica. Su sueño es  darles una buena educación y alimentación a sus hijos.
Le gusta trabajar y dedicarse a la familia.
texts.en:
Melva, 34, lives with her partner and four children, aged 15, 13, 10 and 9.  She lives in the Mocache Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank is called ‘Juntos Triunfaremos’ and is located at number 2 in the John F Kennedy precinct in the Mocache Canton area near Ventanas.  Melva works in agriculture and livestock.

She has worked in agriculture for three years, sowing corn and then selling her products in Ventanas and Mocache in the local markets.

She is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies to sow corn and rice.  The last loan helped her to improve her financial situation.  She dreams of providing her children with a good education and to be able to provide for them.  She likes her work and looking after the family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, fertilizers and urea.

loans.name: Zoila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Zoila, opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, aderezos, gas propano entre otros ingredientes necesarios para elaboración y venta de pupusas, pues reconoce los buenos beneficios que obtiene de los créditos.
Zoila invirtió el préstamo anterior en su negocio y ayudo a dar un mejor servicio, aumentar su clientela, tener mejores ventas y aumentar sus ganancias, con las cuales ha cancelado sus deudas y mejoro el local del negocio.
texts.en:
Zoila is asking for a new loan to buy cheese, pork rinds, oil, dressings and propane gas among other ingredients which she needs to make and sell her tortillas.  She recognizes the benefits that these loans give her.

She invested the previous loan in her business and it helped her to offer a better service, get more customers, improve her sales and generate more profits.  She has therefore been able to pay off her debts and improve her establishment.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, pork rinds, cheese, cooking oil, and corn.

loans.name: 04-15-02-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hạnh operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase meat to make processed food to resell. 

Hạnh is 41 years old and is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in the Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of the 04-15-02-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which has 3 members. 

This is Hạnh's first loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hạnh faces in her business is a lack of capital. With her business profit, Hạnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase meat to make processed food to resell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Anita is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her achieve her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rebeca Luzmila

texts.es:
Rebeca tiene 26 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con su esposo e hija, en el Cantón Mocache provincia de los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama Juntos Triunfaremos se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jhon F Kennedy 2, perteneciente al cantón Mocache cerca de Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Rebeca se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en Agroquímica Karlita y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para mejorar la actividad agrícola y mejorar la economía familiar. Su sueño es comprar más terrenos para construir una casa.
Le gusta trabajar y viajar.
texts.en:
Rebeca, 26, lives with her husband and their daughter in the Mocache Canton area of Los Ríos.  

The communal bank is called ‘Juntos Triunfaremos’ and is located at number 2, John F Kennedy precinct in the Mocache area, which is close to Ventanas.  This group is dedicated to agriculture and livestock.

Rebeca has been sowing corn and rice for several years.  She buys her products in Ventanas in ‘Agroquimica Karlita’ and sells them in the local market.
She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and urea for sowing corn and rice.  

She hopes the loan will help her to increase her production and improve her family’s financial situation.  She dreams of buying more land on which she can build a house.  She enjoys working and traveling.

loans.use: to sow corn and rice.

loans.name: Flor De Papa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE PAPA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de camas de bebe, salón de belleza, macramé de mantas, encuadernación, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sonia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su promotora que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de encuadernación; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió mediante su pareja, con el cual inicio este negocio, con el pasar del tiempo se independizo y en la actualidad tiene su propio espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cartón) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo distribuirá en las entidades solicitantes. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella  vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros, el crédito y el área de salud que le ofrecen en la institución.

En la imagen falta una compañera del grupo pues se encontraba en consulta médica.
texts.en:
The communal association "FLOR DE PAPA" will begin its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Focal de Panamericana Center. It is comprised of eight members and is directed by a leadership committee led by Sonia, the President. The members' businesses are diverse and include: sale of baby beds, a beauty salon, macrame of blankets, bookbinding and cosmetics sales. The loan they take will benefit small women microentrepreneurs, of which Sonia is one.
