Sonia indicates that she has been with Pro Mujer for three cycles, joining through the invitation of her sales promoter who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a bookbinding business. She learned this business through her partner, with whom she started the business. As time went by she became independent and currently she has her own work space.

The loan which she is taking now is for an increase in capital (the purchase of cardboard) which she will acquire from markets in the city of El Alto and after elaboration she will distribute it to soliciting entities. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home, since she lives in a common law marriage and has four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings, loan and health services offered by the institution.

The photo is missing one group member because she had a medical appointment at the time the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy cardboard

loans.name: Elsy Estela

texts.es:
Elsy, invertirá en surtir el inventario de su tienda, por lo que solicita nuevamente un crédito con el que comprara granos básicos, bebidas, golosinas, jabón, detergentes, etc., todo lo necesario con lo que satisfacera las necesidades de sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer su negocio con mercadería que demandaban sus clientes y ha tenido como resultado mejores ventas, un negocio más grande, sus ingresos han aumentado y tiene más clientes nuevos. Su estilo de vida familiar es mucho mejor.
texts.en: Elsy will invest in assorting the inventory of her shop. For this purpose she requests a new loan with which she will buy basic grains, drinks, sweets, soap, detergents, etc., everything necessary to satisfy the needs of her customers. The previous loan helped her strengthen her business with the merchandise demanded by her customers and as a result she has had better sales, a bigger business, higher income and more new clients. Her family's lifestyle is much better.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, drinks, sweets, soap, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
José, es padre de cuatro hijos con edades de 18, 15, 13 y 11 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, hace 20 años se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y al cultivo de granos básicos, es un oficio que aprendió de su padre, hoy en día lo ejerce con el apoyo de su familia.
Invertirá el capital en el pago de mano de obra para recolectar la cosecha de una manzana de maíz, lo que le ayudar a obtener sus ganancias en un plazo corto y de esa manera iniciar con anticipación los preparativos para la próxima siembra.
Sueña con aumentar sus cultivos, mejorar su economía para cancelar sus deudas y dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de superarse académicamente.
texts.en:
José is the father of four children aged 18, 15, 13 and 11.  He lives with his wife and children.  He has been raising pigs and growing basic grains for 20 years.  He learned the trade from his father and today he carries it on with the help of his family.

He will invest the loan in paying people to help him collect the corn harvest, which will help him generate some income in the short term and also prepare for the next sowing season.  

He hopes to grow more and improve his financial situation to be able to pay off his debts and to allow his children to get a better education than he did.

loans.use: to pay people to help him collect the harvest.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, vive junto a tres de sus hijos de 15, 7 y 6 años de edad, ella es el pilar principal de su familia, se dedica a la venta de antojitos, uno de sus hijos la apoya en el negocio, ella ofrece a sus clientes papas fritas, tostadas, yuca frita, entre otros, por el momento es una actividad que puede realizar sin ningún problema ya que no representa riesgos.
Con el capital comprara aceite, yuca, aderezos, leña, gas propano y dará mantenimiento al coche de venta, espera mejorar su producción, seguir dando productos de calidad a sus clientes, mejorar sus ventas y tener ingresos más altos, para cancelar el crédito puntualmente.
Sueña con dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudio superior para que tengan más oportunidades de superación.
texts.en:
María lives with her children, ages 15, 7 and 6.  She is the main support of the family and sells appetizers.  One of her children helps with the business.  She sells french fries, toasted tortilla, fried yucca, etc.  For now she is able to carry out this activity without any type of problem or risks.

The loan will be used to buy oil, yucca plant, seasonings, firewood, propane gas and to pay for vehicle maintenance.  She hopes to increase production and continue offering her customers top quality.  By increasing sales and earning more income she will be able to pay back the loan on time.

Her dream is to give her children the opportunity to get a higher education so they will have more opportunities improvement.

loans.use: To buy oil, yucca plant, seasonings, firewood, propane gas and to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es:
Nelson Enrique tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Morropon su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus clientes a las zonas aledañas a su distrito, también se dedica a la venta de combustible, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de piezas para su mototaxi y arreglos de su vivienda y así tener un lugar agradable donde residir.
texts.en:
Nelson Enrique, 35, lives with his wife and children in the district of Morropon.  The local people are involved in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  It is two hours from the city of Piura along the northern coast of Peru.

He provides a public transportation service with his auto-rickshaw, driving customers from neighboring villages to his district.  He also sells fuel.  The loan he is requesting in the amount of 1,500 PEN is to buy spare parts for his vehicle and to fix up his house to make it more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to perform maintenance on his lorry and to buy scrap metal.

loans.name: Reina Guadalupe

texts.es:
Reina de 48 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 2 hijos 17 y 23 años de edad, su esposo es docente director en una escuela y ella es docente de otra escuela, ambos son profesionales de la educación.

Tiene 12 años trabajando como docente, es muy bien recomendada y se identifica por hacer bien su trabajo.

El préstamo será utilizado para saldar una deuda pendiente ya que solicito dos tarjetas de crédito para solventar unos gastos.

Como toda madre lo que espera en un futuro es que con su trabajo y el de su esposo puedan dar a sus hijos una carrera universitaria y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en: Reina is 48, lives with her spouse, and has two children, aged 17 and 23 respectively. Her husband is a schoolteacher, as is she, but they work in different schools. She has been a teacher for 12 years, and everyone is satisfied with her work. She prides herself on doing a good job. She will use the loan to pay back two credit card loans that she needed to face some expenses. As a mother, she hopes, together with her husband, to be able to support her children through university and to see them become good people.

loans.use: to pay back a credit card loan.

loans.name: Zonia Magdalena

texts.es:
Zonia, se decidió por otro crédito para invertir en la compra de aceite, maíz, harina, hojas de huerta, pollo, chicharrón, etc., pues son los ingredientes necesarios para elaborar las pupusas y tamales que ofrece a sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior compro la materia prima necesaria para su negocio, con lo que aumento su clientela, mejoro su producto, sus ganancias son mejores lo que le permite cumplir con sus compromisos económicos y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Zonia has decided to request another loan to buy oil, corn, flour, cabbage, chicken, pork cracklings, etc. which are the necessary ingredients to make pupusas (stuffed tortillas) and tamales to offer her customers.

The previous loan was used to buy raw materials for her business and she was able to increase her clientele, improve production and earn more profit.  This allows her to fulfill her economic commitments and continue supporting her children in their education.

loans.use: to buy oil, corn, flour, cabbage, chicken, pork cracklings, etc.

loans.name: Juana Lidia

texts.es:
Doña Juana es una señora de 51 años que curso hasta el quinto grado de primaria, es casada y de su matrimonio procreo 5 hijos de los cuales solo los tres últimos dependen de ella. La primera llego hasta sexto grado y le ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar, el tercer llego hasta ciclo común y les apoya en el trabajo de campo y la última tiene 16 años y no le gusto el estudio llegando hasta quinto grado, con ella vive una nieta que es hija de su hija mayor a quien está educando desde muy pequeña. El negocio es el cultivo de café, ella sabe realizar todas las actividades relacionadas sin embargo apoya a su esposo hasta la corta y traslado del mismo ya que se tiene que encargar de los quehaceres del hogar. Aprendió esta actividad desde niña con sus padres y luego continúo con el esposo, decidiendo dedicarse a esta actividad ya que viene de raíces y es el único ingreso que han tenido por generaciones. Doña Juana tiene la facilidad que las tierras productoras están ubicadas cerca de su casa de habitación, llegada la hora de corta o recolección del grano se involucran todos los miembros de su familia desde el más grande hasta el más pequeño ya que así se evitan el costo de contratar más personal. Los clientes que ella tiene son bodegas que exclusivamente se dedican a la compra-venta de café en otra localidad.
Su sueño es comprar tres manzanas de tierra para cultivarlas y así poder obtener más ingresos para su hogar, esto lo lograra con el apoyo del financiamiento que hoy solicita y el buen manejo de sus ganancias.
El financiamiento solicitado le permitirá adquirir suministros agrícolas, como abono y fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café siendo esta la primera vez que trabajara con préstamo y es debido a que tienen una manzana que jamás la han sembrado por falta del capital y esta es la oportunidad que han esperado para cumplir parte de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Juana, 51, has fifth grade education.  She is married and has five children, three of whom are still in her care.  The eldest finished sixth grade and now helps with housework.  The third child finished elementary and helps work with farming.  The youngest is 16 and studied to fifth grade, but didn't like school.  A granddaughter, the daughter of her eldest daughter, is the one she has been raising since she was a little girl.  

Juana grows coffee and knows all about its related activities, but she only helps her husband in the cutting and transport because she has to take care of the housework.   She learned the trade from her parents when she was a little girl and then continued alongside her husband.  She decided on this activity because it is in her roots and has been the only source of income for generations.

She is lucky to have her cropland near her home; and at harvest time all the members of the family are involved, from the eldest to the youngest, in order to avoid the cost of hiring more workers.  Her customers are stores in other locations who specialize in buying and selling coffee.  Her dream is to buy three more acres of land for crop growing to earn more income for the household.  She should be able to do this with the help of the loan she is requesting today and by managing her earnings well.

The loan will allow her to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers for coffee crop maintenance.  This is her first loan and it will be used as capital to plant another patch of land they had never used before for lack of funds.  This is the opportunity she had been waiting for to realize her dreams.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for a new coffee crop.

loans.name: La Corona Group

texts.es: Silvia es una de los socios que forman el grupo ella tiene la edad de 39 años, acompañada, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, se dedica a la venta de recarga en su casa desde hace 4 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 2 años tiempo en el cual ha demostrado ser un grupo muy responsables en sus pagos. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de recargas electrónicas. Aracely mujer de 36 años su negocio es el destace de cerdo en pie, Chester hombre de 40 años su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the group. She is 39 years old. She is in a relationship and has two children that she takes care of. She has worked selling cellphone topup minutes from her home for the last 4 years. 

The group has been a member of the institution for 2 years, during which it has proven to be a very responsible group that makes its payments. 

Silvia is requesting the loan to buy cellphone topup minutes. Aracely is a 36 year old woman who has a business slaughtering pigs. Chester is a 40 year old man who has a business selling new clothes.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of cellphone topup minutes.

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es: Don José es originario de la ciudad de Granada. Es de oficio comerciante se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Se siente agradecido con Kiva y MiCredito ya que pudo invertir en los productos que más demanda sus clientes, y logro obtener mejore ganancias con las ventas. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar granos básicos como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite entre otros, con el fin de cumplir con las necesidades de su clientela. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que crecerá un poco más su inventario y su negocio.
texts.en:
José is from the city of Granada.  He is a merchant and runs a grocery store.  He is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito for being able to buy products requested by his customers and earn more profits from sales.

He is requesting a new loan to buy staple goods such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, etc. in order to respond to customer needs.  He believes the loan will be of great help because his inventory and business will grow a little more.

loans.use: To buy staple goods such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, etc.

loans.name: Hernán Darío

texts.es:
Hernán es un hombre carismático y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo y dedicación. Su experiencia laboral de 34 años, fue adquirida trabajando como empleado en diferentes ópticas de la ciudad pero, desde hace 13 años decidió independizarse y aprovechar la oportunidad de generar mejores ingresos para su familia, pues ya poseía la experiencia y el conocimiento suficiente en el manejo de este tipo de negocios. Su óptica presta los servicios de lunes a sábado de 8:00 am a 7:00 pm, allí ofrece todo tipo de lentes y monturas bajo fórmula; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos de su familia.
Con el ánimo de mejorar su portafolio, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (lentes y monturas), así estará en la capacidad de satisfacer la demanda con productos innovadores y de diversos diseños que satisfagan los gustos de su clientela; dando como resultado un incremento en los ingresos por ventas.
Su mayor anhelo es fortalecer su negocio para que en un futuro cercano le permita tener una estabilidad económica favorable para poder disfrutar con su familia un mejor bienestar, calidad de vida, y una vejez tranquila.
texts.en: Hernán is a charismatic and hard-working man. He lives with his spouse and his two sons, whom he supports with great effort and dedication. He has 34 years' worth of experience as an optician, thanks to his work as an employee for different opticians in the city. 13 years ago, he decided to set up his own business in order to improve his income for the sake of his family. He saw it as a good opportunity since he had already accumulated the necessary knowledge and experience. His shop opens Monday to Saturday, from 8 am to 7 pm, and sells all types of prescription spectacles. From it, Hernán derives the income he needs to support his family. With a view to improving the range of goods on offer, he asks for a loan in order to buy lenses and frames wholesale. Thus, he will be able to meet customer demand for innovative products and more choice in designs. He expects to increase his sales in this way. His greatest wish is to strengthen his business in order to have more financial stability in the future, so as to enjoy a better life with his family, as well as peace in his old age.

loans.use: to buy lenses and frames wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Monico

texts.es:
José, solicita capital para comprar variedad de mariscos, para que su negocio sigua surtido y le permita seguir creciendo económicamente, para cubrir sus gastos familiares.
Con el préstamo anterior logro fortalecer más el negocio, tiene más clientes, sus ventas son mayores, y sus ganancias son mejores. Su familia se encuentra muy bien.
texts.en: José asks for a loan in order to buy different sorts of fish and shrimp to sell. He wants to have more stock and a greater variety of products so as to keep growing and support his family. With the previous loan, he managed to strengthen his business: he now has more clients, sells more, and earns more. His family is in very good health.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Sembrando Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEMBRANDO ESPERANZA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Filomena es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de refrescos, venta de venestas, venta de comida, venta de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Filomena es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; cuenta que este negocio lo implementaron por iniciativa propia al observar a uno de sus familiares en la elaboración de este producto y como ella ya conocía la técnica de tejido decide emprender su propio negocio
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "SEMBRANDO ESPERANZA" will begin its first Pro Mujer loan cycle through the Collpani Social Center.  The group is comprised of eight members and it is led by a management board whose secretary is Filomena.  The members of the group are involved in different business activities, such as sales of soft drinks, wood stools, food, or groceries.

The loan will benefit small business owners, one of whom is Filomena.  She says it her first experience through Pro Mujer and she joined by invitation from a representative of the institution who visited her at home.  Her business is selling blankets and she says she started it through her own initiative upon observing one of her relatives making one so she learned the knitting technique and started her own business.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her work capital to buy yarn from the wholesale dealers in the city of La Paz.  After making the blankets she will sell them at her stall.  Her work allows her to generate an income to support her household, since she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds saying she likes the institution's training program.

loans.use: To buy yarn.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Doña Luz tiene 51 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Viuda y madre de cuatro hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Negocio que inicio con la ayuda de su esposo cuando aún vivía, el cual le dio un poco de dinero para que instalara su propio negocio y poder sobrevivir; poco a poco iba invirtiendo hasta que actualmente cuenta con su negocio próspero y rentable. Su meta próxima es ampliar su negocio y mantenerlo surtido. Solicita el crédito para comprar; golosinas, gaseosa, pan, arroz, azúcar, detergentes, entre otros con el fin de ofertar la variedad de producto demandado por sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a obtener ganancias y crecer su pulpería. Su plan futuro es mejorar la estructura de su casa y su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz, 51, is from the city of Granada and is a widow and mother of four independent children.  She is a merchant and runs a grocery store that she started with the help of her husband when he was still alive.  He gave her a little money to start her own business to survive and little by little she invested more and made it a prosperous, profitable business.

Her goal is to expand her business and keep it well stocked.  She is requesting a loan to buy sweets, sodas, bread, rice, sugar, detergents, etc. in order to offer a variety of products to her customers.  She believes the loan will help her to earn more profits and grow her store.

Her plans for the future are to improve both her home and business.

loans.use: To buy sweets, sodas, bread, rice, sugar, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José de 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos, de 2 años de edad, 5 años de edad, 12 años de edad y 17 años de edad, tres de ellos estudian. Con él conviven 5 personas.

José es empleado, trabaja en una gasolinera, ya tiene varios años de ser empleado y es bien recomendado por gente de la zona que lo conoce. Además es agricultor, oficio que aprendió de su padre desde pequeño.

El préstamo será utilizado para compra artículos mobiliarios para su casa, así en un futuro mejorar la vivienda y darle mejor comodidad y calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José, 41, is married and has four children, ages 2, 5, 12 and 17.  Three of them are in school so five people live at home.

José works at a gas station where he has been employed for several years and he is well known in the area.  He is also a farmer and learned the trade from his father when he was little.

The loan will be used to buy appliances for his home to make it more comfortable for his family so they can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy appliances for his home.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Amelia dreams that her business will last longer and hopes to always have good health. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 31 years old and a cafeteria owner in Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of five whose spouse gives additional support and has been in this business for the last four years doing well. 

This marks her fourth borrowing from Vision fund to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase bales of wheat and maize flour, boxes of milk for her hotel, a sack of potatoes and cooking fat. 

She will use the anticipated profit to service her loan and educate her children. She hopes to have a successful life in future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of wheat, maize, and flour, boxes of milk for her hotel, a sack of potatoes and cooking fat.

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vilma, opta por otro crédito debido a que se le presenta la necesidad de invertir en el inventario de su tienda comprara aceite, pan, golosinas, bebidas, etc., le ayudara a continuar satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior ofreció una mayor variedad de productos en la tienda con lo que obtuvo mejores ganancias, mayores ventas, mejoro la atención a sus clientes, ha cancelado el crédito y las condiciones familiares son mejores.
texts.en: Vilma asks for a loan in order to replenish her stock. She wants to keep meeting customer demand, which is why she needs to buy items such as cooking oil, bread, sweets, drinks. Her previous loan enabled her to offer a wider variety of products, owing to which she sold more, earned more, and provided a better service. She repaid said loan and her family's situation has seen some improvement.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio es originario de la ciudad de Granada. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa y alquiler de sillas, el cual le logro tener un negocio demandado. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCredito ya que pudo suplir con la demanda de sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias. Solicita un nuevo crédito para  comprar: calcetines, camisas para hombres y de mujeres, pantalones para ambos sexos entre otros, con el fin de diversificar su mercadería. Estima que el crédito le ayudara extender su negocio y obtener mejores ingresos en su familia.
texts.en: Julio comes from the town of Granada. He sells clothes and rents chairs, which keeps him in business. He is grateful to Kiva and field partner MiCredito for the previous loan, which enabled him to meet customer demand and to increase his profits. He asks for a new loan to buy socks, shirts, and trousers, both for men and women, among other items, with a view to offering a wider range of products. He is confident this loan will help him expand his business and increase his income for the sake of his family.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Estephanie Jane

texts.en: Estephanie Jane has been doing business through charcoal making for many years and she earns well from this. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also has a banana farm where she earns more income for her needs. She took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to pay for the labor cost of replanting bananas. She has a desire to improve the business and have a better future.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost of replanting bananas.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia has helped her husband working in their own farm to make a living for five years by growing and selling bananas. She earns so well from this that she has supported her children's education. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy organic fertilizer and pay for weeding costs. She wants to improve the farm to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pay for weeding costs.

loans.name: Luisito

texts.en:
This is Luisito, 36, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Lucy, a housekeeper and mother to his child. By the grace of God, Luisito has managed to support his child's schooling. At this time, he is working hard to continually send his child to school to finish his/her degree.

Luisito oversees operations of their Jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have a Jeepney that has a capacity of 18 persons, which pays a boundary (daily quota) each day. 

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy new tires for the Jeepney, and renew his registration. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Luisito hopes to acquire another Jeepney and dreams that his family will always be in good health. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.

- Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater Jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the Jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their Jeepney unit.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Pascual tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el caserío La Unión, una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la destilación y comercio de aguardiente, actividad que consiste en procesar de manera artesanal el jugo de la caña para convertirlo en una bebida conocida como el llonque que se utiliza con fines festivos, curativos y antisépticos, Pascual ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materia prima plantas de caña y de esta manera aumentar la producción de su producto para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Pascual is 38 and lives with his spouse and his son in the village of La Unión, located in a rural area of Callayuc district. Green forests abound and people are mostly farmers and traders. The area is two hours from the town of Cutervo, in the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. Pascual sells the sugar cane brandy he makes. He uses traditional methods to distill the juice of the sugar cane in order to make a drink known as 'llonque', used for festive, medical, and antiseptic purposes. He asks for a loan of 2,000 new soles in oder to buy his raw material, namely sugar cane. His aim is to produce more alcohol, earn more customers, and improve his earnings for the sake of his family.

loans.use: to buy sugar cane plants to make brandy.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 34 años de edad, está acompañada, tiene cuatro hijos, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y Frijol); lo aprendió de sus padres trabaja de lunas a sábado, de 6:00 a.m. hasta 12:00 p.m., es apoyada por su compañero de vida. De esta manera ella genera ingresos para los gastos de su hogar.
Con la inversión pagara mano de obra y una maquina desgranadora, lo que le facilitara la recolección de la cosecha, espera tener su producción en menos tiempo, aumentar sus ingresos y cancelar muy puntual sus cuotas.
Aspira a aumentar el área de cultivo, mejorar su economía y dar a su familia mejor alimentación, vestuario, salud y educación de calidad.
texts.en: Ana is 34 and has a husband and four sons. She grows sweetcorn and broad beans, a trade she learned from her parents. She works Monday to Saturday from 6 am to noon. Her partner helps her. Her farm generates income to pay for household expenses. She asks for a loan in order to hire farm hands and to buy a shelling machine, which will make it easier to harvest her crops. She hopes to finish earlier in order to sell her products as soon as possible and increase her earnings. She promises to be punctual in her repayments. Her goals for the future are to farm more land, to improve her financial situation and to provide her family with better food and better clothes, to keep everyone in good health, and to give her children the best possible education.

loans.use: to hire farm hands and to buy a shelling machine.

loans.name: Umoja Ni Nguvu Ii Group

texts.fr: La cliente Muleherwa est une brave commerçante et membre du groupe  d’affaires « Umoja ni nguvu II », senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 61 ans et mère de 9 enfants  dont 8 sont mariés et 1 qui continue à étudier. La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe sa marchandise à son domicile devant son enclos, où, elle a su gagner sa clientèle. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. So conjoint est un fonctionnaire dans une compagnie aérienne de la place. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 30 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 sacs de braises, 20 litres d’huile de palme, ½ panier de tomates et les épices. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir son enfant. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant, ce moment critique post conflit à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Muleherwa, age 61, is a brave merchant and a member of Umoja Ni Nguvu II Group. She's an energetic senior entrepreneur and the mother of nine children. Eight are married, and one is still studying.

She sells food products. She sets up her products at her home, in front of her fence, where she managed to earn a clientele.

She started her business with a first capital that she received from her husband, an agent for a local airline. Later on, she obtained a loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Hekima.

She's been running this business for thirty years. This new loan will be used to buy two sacks of charcoal, 20 liters of palm oil, half a basket of tomatoes, and spices. She wishes to build a home, feed her child, and ensure he can go to school.

In the end, she strongly thanks Hekima for its contribution to making women entrepreneurs who are excluded from traditional banks self-supporting, especially at this critical post-war time in the East of the country.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of charcoal, 20 liters of palm oil, half a basket of tomatoes, and spices

loans.name: 04-06-08-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en: Mrs Hoa operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan of 27,000,000 VND to purchase vegetables to resell. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Hoa is 40 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the 04-06-08-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependent children. In 2012, Hoa joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. Hoa has successfully repaid two loans from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. The main hardship that Hoa faces in her business is a lack of capital. With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: 04-06-06-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en: Mrs Việt has a service business repairing agricultural machines. She is requesting a loan of 24,000,000 VND to purchase equipment to repair the agricultural machines. Việt is 62 years old and is married with three children. She is the group leader of the 04-06-06-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents (her children are grown up). In 2012, Việt joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. Việt has successfully repaid two loans from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Việt has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is a lack of capital. With her business profit, Việt hopes to build a new house for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to repair agricultural machines.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Doña Norma es una señora de 37 años de edad que curso hasta el sexto grado ya que decidió dedicarse a la agricultura desde muy temprana edad. Ella es casada quien vive en E.U.A. con el fin de darle un mejor futuro a sus 4 hijos el mayor tiene 20 años y se graduó de la secundaria, la segunda tiene 16 años y está finalizando el ciclo común básico y los últimos dos son guatos con edades de 12 años y están en primaria. Ella se dedica al cultivo de café esto desde hace muchos años por lo que sabe realizar todo lo relacionado a ello mantenimiento, recolecta del grano, aplicación de abono, fertilizantes entre otros. El terreno que ella tiene una pequeña parte fue herencia de sus padres y el otro fruto de su esfuerzo. El producto lo vende a intermediarios que llegan a la localidad y sus cultivos están ubicados aproximadamente a 30 minutos de camino y 10 en carro. Llegada la recolección del grano se involucran todos los miembros de la familia esto con el fin de disminuir los gastos y aumentar las ganancias.
Su mayor meta es duplicar el volumen de sus cultivos para así tener una mayor estabilidad económica apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y demás necesidades para que su esposo regrese del extranjero y lograr que su familia vuelva a estar unida.
El financiamiento que hoy solicita será invertido en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café permitiendo la compra de abono, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra, para ayudar a mejorar sus producciones y así sus ingresos que le permitirán realizar sus sueños y metas personales.
texts.en: Norma is 37 years old, completed primary school, and decided to become a farmer early in life. Her husband works in the United States in order to give a better future to their four children. The eldest is 20 and finished high school, the daughter is sixteen and finishing high school, and the youngest two are twins who go to primary school. Norma grows coffee and has been doing so for many years, which means she knows everything about caring for the plants, harvesting the crops, using manure and fertilisers, etc. She owns a plot of land, a small part of which she inherited from her parents, the rest of which she acquired thanks to her own labour. She sells her coffee to middlemen who come to her village to buy it. Her land is 30 minutes away from her house on foot, 10 minutes by car. When the time for harvesting comes, her whole family helps, in order to reduce costs and increase profits. Norma's main goal is to double her production in order to be more stable financially, so as to support her children during their studies and pay for household expenses, which would mean her husband would not need to work abroad any more. Her greatest wish is to see her family living under the same roof again. She asks for a loan in order to care for her crops: she needs to buy fertiliser and manure, and wants to hire farm hands in order to increase her production and, thus, her income, so as to reach her goals and fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to hire farm hands to help her harvest her coffee crops.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is married to a farmer who owns a banana farm in their village. She has helped him work the farm for more than five years and she earns good money from this. She has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, which she used to buy farm inputs. Since she has added more plots of bananas, she needs to purchase organic fertilizers. So she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies wholesale.

loans.name: Kigera Group

texts.fr:
Rameck  fait partie du groupe  Kigera  et  habite à Rumonge. Il  a 50 ans et est marié à Pamphia. Une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 10 enfants, âgé des 1 à 1 0 ans dont 8 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de bière de la bière de farine, d’huile de palme depuis 15 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de caisse de bière Primus, d'Amstel, et de  limonade   à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  ouvrir un magasin de matériaux de construction et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Rameck is a member of the Kigera group and lives in Rumonge. He is 50 years old and married to Pamphia, a farmer. Together they have 10 children, ages 1 to 10, 8 of whom attend school. 

Rameck has been selling beer, wheat beer, and palm oil for 15 years. He is on his second loan with Turame.

With the Kiva loan that he obtains, Rameck will increase his capital and purchase many cases of Primus and Amstel beer and lemonade to resell and increase his profits. In the coming years, he would like to open a construction materials store and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase many cases of Primus and Amstel beer and lemonade to resell and increase his profits

loans.name: Sari Maju Group

texts.en:
The Sari Maju group from West Bali would like to thank lenders for their support.  Ni Komang, the group head, purchased three piglets with her loans for fattening and she was able to sell them.  At the end of the loan period, Ni Komang sold her pigs, yielding a respectable profit.  With her profits, and with the help of a new loan from MUK, she plans to purchase additional pigs.  With the overall increase in household income, she has supported the daily needs of her family, saving and renovating her kitchen.

Ni Komang with the Sari Maju group decided to continue borrowing from MUK since it is especially helpful in developing pig businesses. This loan will be used to buy four local piglets and pig feed. Local piglets are sold for pigroll and Ni Komang hopes this business will go well. She still has a dream to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy four local piglets

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Meet Ilham. Ilham lives in Cibubur, a suburban area located about 30 minutes from Jakarta, the capital city. He is married to a kindergarten teacher. From their marriage, they have a child who's still a toddler. 

Ilham owns a small stall that sells mobile phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Ilham joined Ruma because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. He also thinks that Ruma's business is innovative so he wants to gain more knowledge from it. As his business continues, he needs a working capital loan from Kiva to process more transactions especially on weekends when more people tend to come to his stall. For the last three months, he has had around $170 - $180 sales per day just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. He's glad that his business is being assisted and supported by Ruma agents. In the photo, Ilham is sitting in his stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits on weekends

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
BENKAN est un groupe de l’association SANOUYA de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe 5 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments et de la restauration à l’image de BINTOU qui est la première personne  assise de la gauche vers la droite gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
BINTOU, qui excelle dans les activités de restauration, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiments alimentaires, oignon, choux, viande et poisson.  Elle s’approvisionne sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 10.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Benkan is a subgroup of Sanouya of Ouelessebougou. It is made up of 5 women who came to know each other as relatives and neighbors. They are on average 40 years old, married, with an average of 5 children each.

Each of the women pursues her own small business. Bintou, pictured as the first person sitting on the left of the photo, purchases and resells spices and is in the restaurant business.

The women live in traditional extended familiesin Ouelessebougou in the Kati area (in the Koulikoro region of Mali.) The women have been in business for many years and are much sought after in their businesses. In order to better meet the needs of their growing customer base, the members of the group decided to partner with the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first group loan.

Bintou, who is successful in the restaurant business, plans to use her loan to purchase spices, onions, cabbage, meat, and fish. She stocks up in the area from wholesalers and sells her food in Ouelessebougou at retail for cash and credit to a customer base made up of both men and women. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA which will allow her to repay the loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Enkhchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Enkhchimeg, 33 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been growing vegetables and other crops since 2010 and have accumulated a vast amount of experience in this field. She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to buy truck spare parts and some agriculture spare parts. She is preparing for growing vegetables early this spring as soon as it gets warmer outside. Now the only family income source is their agricultural business, so she and her husband are investing all their effort in it. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who usually works at their farm site without any rest all day long.

loans.use: to prepare for growing vegetables

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RENACER” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Catalina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, tejido de mantas, venta de comida, venta de chompas, venta de chocolate, librería, tienda de fotocopiadoras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Olga es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de librería; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por recomendación de sus familiares que conocían a cerca del negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de material escolar) que adquirirá de las ferias del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener sus estudios, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Renacer" communal bank is beginning its tenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, through the Los Andes regional office. This communal bank is made up of eight members and is run by a board which has Catalina as its president. The members of the communal bank have different businesses, including selling cosmetics, knitting blankets, selling meals, selling jumpers, selling chocolate, a book shop and a shop selling photocopiers.

This loan will benefit the small-time businesswomen in Catalina's group. Catalina herself tells us that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, following an invitation from a friend who is also a member of the bank. Catalina has a bookshop. She says that she started this business following recommendations from relatives, who knew how to run such a business.

This loan will be used to increase working capital, by buying school materials from the regional fairs in La Paz. Catalina will then sell the items in her shop. This work allows Catalina to earn an income to pay for her studies. Catalina is single.

When asked what it is that she likes about Pro Mujer, Catalina tells us that she likes the loans, the health education and the training which is offered by the organisation.

loans.use: to buy school materials.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is married with three children. She is 62 years old and lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Alicia operates her sari-sari store to earn a living and had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP for additional capital to buy grocery items.

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Alicia hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: buy more grocery item to display and sell

loans.name: Rosetina

texts.en:
Rosetina is married with two children. Rosetina is 37 years old and lives in San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rosetina operates her sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 25,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 25,000 PHP for additional capital to buy more grocery items.

Rosetina has been a  member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Rosetina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell and to display in her store

location.town: Liloy-San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 41 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with two children.

Alma works in the fish industry and catches and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for nine years. She has requested a loan for additional capital to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. 
.
Alma has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Jose Ismael

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por otro crédito para pagar mano de obra para la recolección de la cosecha y también el transporte a su casa, lo que le acortara el tiempo para tener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos familiares y cancelar las cuotas de la deuda adquirida. 
Con el crédito anterior tuvo los recursos necesarios para aumentar su cosecha, tener granos libre de plagas, mejoro sus ingresos con los cuales a mejorado las condiciones familiares y cancelo responsablemente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
José has decided to take out another loan in order to pay for labourers to bring in the harvest and to transport it to his house. This will save José time and so he will earn money quicker. He can then pay household expenses and pay off his debt.

With his previous loan José has enough money to increase his harvest and to have disease-free crops. José increased his income, which he used to improve his family's living conditions and to pay off his debt.

loans.use: to pay for labourers to bring in the harvest.

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 23 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con su esposa y con sus hijos de 6 y 5 años. Vive en el Cantón Mocache provincia de los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama Juntos Triunfaremos se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jhon F Kennedy 2, perteneciente al cantón Mocache cerca de Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en el Comercial Montenegro y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar. 

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es prosperar en la agricultura y sacar adelante a su familia.
Le gusta trabajar con su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 23 years old and married. He lives with his wife and children, who are aged six and five years old each. Carlos lives in the Mocache province of the Los Ríos province.

This communal bank is called "Juntos Triunfaremos" and is from the Jhon F Kennedy 2 area of the Mocache cantaon, near Ventanas. The members of the communal bank work in agriculture and raising livestock.

Carlos works in farming - he has been growing corn and rice for some years. He buys his supplies in Ventanas, at the Montenegro market and also sells his owns products there.

Carlos has applied for this loan in order to buy manure and fertilisers for sowing rice and corn. This loan will help Carlos to increase his income for his family and to invest in his business. Carlos' dream is to prosper in agriculture and help his family to get ahead.

Carlos likes working with his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José es una persona de 30 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos: un  hombre y dos mujeres, el y su familia viven en el Cantón El Tablón, Sololá
El es agricultor y comerciante; dedicado al cultivo de  papa, zanahoria y repollo; su cultivo lo comercializa en el mercado de su comunidad y a  través de  esta actividad obtiene ingresos aceptables que le ayudan al sostenimiento de su familia. Tiene 12 años realizando esta labor  la cual la heredó de sus padres quienes se dedicaban a lo mismo.
El está  solicitando un préstamo de Q 7,000.00 para compra de semilla y fertilizante para la siembra y el mantenimiento de papa.
El sueño más importante de José es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y asi brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 30 years old and has three children - two girls and a boy. José and his family live in the El Tablón canton of Sololá.

José is a farmer and businessman. He grows potatoes, carrots and cabbage, and sells his products at the local market. With this work, José is able to earn enough money to support his family. He has been doing this work for twelve years, having inherited it from his parents who also worked in farming

José is applying for a loan of 7000 Qetzal in order to buy seeds and fertilisers for sowing and looking after his potatoes.

José's biggest dream is to improve his living conditions and, thus, provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser for sowing and looking after potato crops.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua con la venta de desayunos, refrescos, gelatinas y leche, ella vende sus ricos desayunos todos los días desde las 5:30am hasta aproximadamente hasta las 8:30 am. 

Julia  sigue participando en hace varios años en el banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllorrity de Pilcopata” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para insumos como por ejemplo leche, manzana, quinua, azúcar y otras cosas más. (La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Julia is grateful to the lenders for the loan and she is happy for the support. She continues selling breakfast, soft drinks, jellies and milk. She sells her delicious breakfast  every day from 5:30AM until approximately 8:30AM every day.

Julie has been a member of the communal bank Señor de Qoyllorrity de Pilcopata for some years and at this time she needs a loan for supplies such as milk, apples, quinua, sugar and more items. (The city of Pilcopata is the capital of the district of Kosñipata in the province of Paucartambo within the department of Cucso, Perú.)

loans.use: to buy supplies such as milk, apples, quinoa and sugar, amongst other things.

loans.name: Kamila

texts.en:
Kamila is a freshman in the Psychology program, and this is her story: 

My name is Kamila and I have a younger sister with Down syndrome. My mom is worried that my sister can’t be like other children. She needs special treatment and classes to help her get through the day. I want to help children born with different mental illnesses, and their parents, who need moral help and support.

Therefore I have chosen to study psychology at AUCA. I want to understand the human mind, which factors help to shape and define who we are, and what can be done to aid those who do not fit into society. Psychology is not the most prestigious occupation in Kyrgyzstan because there are many taboos about going to see a 'head doctor'. I want to be an outstanding psychologist to help people, and also to show them that there is nothing wrong with getting help for mental illness. 

AUCA is the best place for me to study psychology because it has the best professors in this subject, and professors who are not afraid to do progressive and interesting research. AUCA is the only place where I will be able to pursue my dream freely.

loans.use: to pay for higher education

loans.name: Laras

texts.en:
Laras is single and living with four persons in the family home in Cibubur, a suburban area located about 30 minutes from Jakarta. Laras runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks, groceries, mobile phone airtime credits, and services bill payments. She joined Ruma because she wanted to expand her business. She is glad that her business got assisted and supported by Ruma agents.

For the last three months, she has got around $77-$78 per day sales on average, just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. She hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends when more people tend to come to her stall. In the future, she is planning to seek more business opportunities. In the photo, Laras is standing in front of her small stall. Laras thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Marbelline Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña Marbelline es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, de 25 años de edad. Casada y madre de dos hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida y ropa. Inicio este negocio hace pocos años, aprovecho la oportunidad que su esposo le ofreció, instalara un negocio de comida, desde entonces, ella hacia enchiladas, refrescos etc. luego paso a paso iba comprando ropa con la ganancias obtenidas del otro negocio. Hoy en día cuenta con sus dos pequeños negocios. Su meta es ofrecer otros tipos de platillos a sus clientes. Solicita un crédito para comprar ropa nueva: pantalones, ropa para niños, camisas entre otros, con el fin de brindar una variedad de mercadería. Estima que el crédito le ayudara ya que incrementara la demanda de clientes y obtendrá buenas ganancias. Su plan futuro es ampliar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Marbelline is originally from the city of Granada. She is 25 years old, married and the mother of two children. She is a merchant and works selling food and clothing.

She began this business a few years ago taking advantage of the opportunity that her husband offered her of setting up a food business. Since then she has been offering enchiladas, soft drinks, etc. and later, step by step she started buying clothing with the earnings she obtained from the other business. Now today she has two small businesses. Her goal is to offer other types of dishes to her customers. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy new clothing such as pants, clothing for children, shirts, and other items, with the goal of offering a variety of merchandise. She thinks that that the loan will help as customer demand increases and she obtains better earnings. Her future plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new clothing such as pants, clothing for children, shirts, and other items

loans.name: Shokir

texts.ru: Шокир учитель и фермер, проживающий в районе Восеъ. Ему 46 лет. У него высшее педагогическое образование. Шокир в своем селе работает учителем более 15 лет. Он примерный отец и муж. У него двое сыновей в возрасте 20, 16 лет и дочь в возрасте 14 лет. Старший сын в настоящее время находится в России на заработках, остальные дети учатся в школе. Шокир одновременно занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры на широком участке земли. Земледельческой деятельность он уже занимается 10 лет. Сейчас Шокиру необходимо успеть закончить осенний посев. С этой целью он запрашивает кредит. Шокир собирается купить семена, минеральные удобрения и топливо для озимых полей. Ему очень нужен этот кредит.
texts.en:
Shokir is a teacher and farmer who lives near Vose. He is 46 years old. He has a degree in teaching. Shokir has worked as a teacher in his village for over 15 years. He is an exemplary father and husband. He has two sons age 16 and 20, as well as a daughter age 14 . The eldest son is currently working abroad in Russia, and the other kids are in school. 

Shokir also works in agriculture. He grows crops on a large plot of land. He has been working in agriculture for 10 years. Now, Shokir must finish his autumn sowing in time. To do so, he has applied for a loan. Shokir plans to buy seeds, fertilizer and fuel for the winter fields. He really needs this loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Revendeuse de sacs et chaussures depuis 2006 au marché, Adjo fait sa deuxième demande à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Elle espère réinvestir le gain dans l'activité et aider son enfant à s'épanouir. Mariée, elle a 01 enfant de 07ans en charge scolarisé.
texts.en:
Adjo has been a retailer of bags and shoes at the market since 2006. She is married and the mother of a seven-year-old child who attends school.

She is now making her second loan request from WAGES to purchase merchandise. Adjo hopes to reinvest her earnings into her business, and to help her child to flourish.

loans.use: to purchase bags and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Niso

texts.ru: Нисо 49 лет. Она умная женщина. Нисо вдова и имеет 3 детей. Ее дети совершеннолетние. Нисо более 35 лет занимается лечением больных лечебными травами. Она знахарь. Нисо имеет доброе сердце и всегда старается, помочь больным людям. Она этим зарабатывает на жизнь. Нисо должна проводить свадебное торжество своего сына, так как он хочет жениться, но она не имеет денег. Нисо запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Niso is 49 years old. She is a smart woman. Niso is a widow and has 3 children. Niso has more than 35 years of experience in treating patients with curative herbs. She is a witch-doctor. Niso has a good heart and is always trying to help people. This is how she earns a living. Niso has to plan a wedding celebration for her son. Her son wants to get married, but she has no money. Niso has requested a loan of 3000 Somons for her son's wedding. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To make wedding party of her son

loans.name: 6 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “6 DE AGOSTO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Celestina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso y tunta, compra y venta de ganado, venta de leche, venta de flores, venta de pescado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Celestina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de flores; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años, al observar que este producto se vendía con amplia solicitud en el mercado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de flores) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que se realizan en el grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank 6 De Agosto, part of the Copacabana regional office, will begin its third loan from Pro Mujer. This group is composed of 8 members and is led by a board of directors of which Celestina is president.  The members of this communal bank work in various businesses such as selling cheese and freeze-dried potatoes, buying and selling livestock, milk, flowers, and fish. 

This loan will benefit small businesowners such as Celestina. She points out that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer, having been invited by friend who is a member of this institution. Currently she sells flowers and she says that she started this business of her own accord when she saw that this product was highly demanded in the market. 

The loan Celestina is requesting is to buy more flowers from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and sell them from her stall. This kind of job allows her to obtain more income to support her family. She is married and has two kids. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says that she likes that the members of the group can save money.

loans.use: to buy flowers

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru: Шаходат молодая и еще незамужняя девушка в возрасте 20 лет. Она недавно начала свой швейный бизнес. Уже 6 месяцев как она берет заказы на шитье женских платьев. Шаходат живет с матерью и отцом в городе Конибодом. Одновременно она работает оператором в холдинговой компании. Шаходат энергичная и шустрая девушка. В будние дни она работает в компании, а в выходные занимается шитьем. Ее мама домохозяйка и помогает дочери с шитьем. Шаходат научилась профессии швеи именно у мамы. Ей нравится шить платья и видеть восторженные лица своих клиенток когда они примеряют сшитые ею платья. Шаходат, чтобы сделать свою работу качественнее и быстрее, просит кредит для покупки новой модернизированной вышивальной машинки.
texts.en:
Shahodat is young woman of the age of 20, who is still not married. Not long ago she started her own sewing business. She has taken orders for sewing women's dresses for six months already. Shahodat lives with her mother and father in the city of Konibodom. She also works as an operator at the holding company.

Shahodat is an energetic and nimble girl. During weekdays she works at the company, and in the weekend she works with sewing. Her mother is a housewife, and she helps her daughter with the sewing. Shahodat learnt the profession of sewing from her mother. She likes to sew dresses and keenly observes her customers when they are trying on her dresses. 

In order to do her work faster and with higher quality, Shahodat requests a loan to purchase a new, modern embroidery machine.

loans.use: to purchase a new embroidery machine to develop her sewing business

loans.name: Toshtemir

texts.ru: Тоштемир молодой житель района Джиликуль, активно занимающийся растениеводством. Ему 24 года. Она женат, имеет двух детей, которым по 3 и 1 год. Тоштемир занимается растениеводством с юного возраста и уже 10 лет как он в этой сфере. Он зарабатывает на жизнь честным трудом и ему нравится его работа.  Тоштемир просит кредит. Он уже собрал урожай хлопка и сейчас всецело поглощен посевом пшеницы. На сумму кредита Тоштемир хочет закупить минеральные удобрения для саженцев пшеницы. Весной, собрав и продав урожай, на полученную прибыль он планирует купить машину, которая ему очень нужна для перевозки.
texts.en:
Totshemir is a young resident of Jilikul and he is actively engaged in agriculture.  He is 24 years old and he is married with two children aged three and one.  Totshemir has been working in agriculture since a young age and he already has 10 years experience in this area.

He earns a living by honest work and he likes his job. Toshtemir asks for a loan. He has already collected the cotton crop and now fully absorbed sowing wheat. From the loan proceeds Toshtemir wants to buy fertilizers for wheat seedlings. When he harvests and sells his spring crop, he plans to buy a car, which he very much needs for for transportation.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth, who is 50 years old, is married and blessed with three children. She manages a livestock business, specifically she raises hogs. This business enables her to earn a net income of PHP 5,000 per hog. Due to insufficient funds in her business, she would like a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase hogs and hog feed for her livestock business. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase hogs and hog feed for her livestock business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 27-year-old lady from the Shienwe area of Kakamega, which is in the western part of Kenya. She supports three people in her family and is married to Mr. Hillary who is also a businessman. They have one child.

Gladys has a retail shop, a business she has been operating for the last two years. She earns a monthly income of KES 2,000. She is applying for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more stock of sugar, salt and other basic items for sale. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase more items for the shop.

Her dreams are to open a wholesale establishment and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, salt and other basic items for sale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca  es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora de 65 años  de edad, casada, con un hijo que depende de ella, su negocio es una pulpería y venta de nacatamales  desde hace 3 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 1/2 año. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, queso, pollo, carne de res, tang, sopa maggi, gaseosa, cosméticos, golosinas, marucha, jabón, para la elaboración de los nacatamales necesita compra de cerdo, maíz, papa, hoja, mecate, naranja agria, leña, chiltoma, cebolla, tomate, ajo, achote, molida, etc.
texts.en:
Francisca is a very hardworking and tenacious 65-year-old woman, married with one dependent daughter. She has had a business running a general store and selling Nicaraguan tamales for three years. She has been a client of the institution for a year and a half. 

She is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, cheese, chicken, beef, Tang (powdered drink), Maggi soup, soda pop, cosmetics, candy, rump steak, and soap. In order to make the Nicaraguan tamales she needs to purchase pork, corn, potatoes, leaf, twine, bitter orange, firewood, sweet pepper, onion, tomato, garlic, achiote paste, ground beef, etc.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her general store and ingredients to make Nicaraguan tamales.

loans.name: Sayda Carolina

texts.es: Sayda es una joven emprendedora y trabajadora, tiene la edad de 23 años, acompañada, su negocio es dedicarse a la venta de productos farmacéuticos desde hace año y medio. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de inventario de medicamentos como ambroxol, zepol, doloviltalgia, panadol, tabcin, sal andrews, dolofin, nausyl, aspirina, delor, losartan, diarrol, acetaminofén, espamofin, otros.
texts.en: Sayda is a hardworking and entrepreneurial young woman. She is 23 years old, has a partner, and has been selling pharmaceuticals for a year and a half. She has requested this loan to buy medicinal products such as abroxol, zepol, doloviltalgia, panadol, tabcin, Andrews salts, dolofin, nausyl, delor, losartan, diarrol, acetaminophen, espasmofin, and others.

loans.use: to buy medicinal products

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Mrs.Dolgorsuren is a bachelor degree student in a private university as a tutor of Mongolian and English language. Graduating her university successfully and working at the place where she was born is her dream. There are two more students in her family, thus, her family income is not enough to pay for all the tuition fees. She was happy to get this loan and pay for tuition fees and carry on studying.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru:
Мукаддас женщина, в возрасте 36 лет, живет в поселке Дж. Расуловского района. Она замужем, имеет двоих детей. Мукаддас занимается купля продажей парфюмерии на центральном рынке Дж. расуловского района. Имеет очень большой опыт в этой сфере деятельности так как, она занимается этим бизнесом с 2000 года. Мукаддас кредитуется в ООО МДО Арванд с 2004 года имеет хорошую кредитную историю.  Муж Мукаддас работает плотником а в свободное время помогает жене. Бизнес Мукаддас стабильный, но она хочет расширить свой бизнес так как дети подрастают и бытовые расходы увеличиваются. С этой целю Мукаддас решила в очередной раз подать заявку на кредит. 
На полученный кредит она планирует расширить ассортимент товара и купить парфюмерию.   Она очень благодарна Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Mukaddas is a 36 year old woman who lives in a village in the J. Rasulov region.  She is married and has two children.  Mukaddas is in business selling perfume at the J. Rasulov region's central market.  She has gained a great deal of experience in this field, having run her business since 2000.  Mukaddas has been a borrower from MDO Arvand since 2004 and has a good credit history.  Mukaddas' husband is a carpenter and he helps his wife in his spare time.  Her business is stable, but Mukaddas wants to expand it because her children are getting older and their everyday expenses are getting bigger.  

With the goal of expanding her business, Mukaddas has again applied for a loan.  She plans to use the loan to expand the assortment of perfumes she sells.  She is very grateful to MDO Arvand for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy perfumes to expand the assortment of perfumes she sells

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
This is Anita, 53, resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Bobby, an electrician, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Anita dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nursultan

texts.en:
Nursultan is a freshman in the International and Comparative Politics program; this is his story:

My dream is to be a politician. I am interested in law and policy in Kyrgyzstan and other countries. Kyrgyzstan is a small and slowly developing country. It has a population of more than five million, but over one million of them work outside of the country.

 I live in Osh, which is situated in the south part of Kyrgyzstan. In recent times, there have been conflicts on borders with neighboring countries, and as a result the majority of the well-educated youth are emigrating to developed countries. As a patriot of my country, I will not stand by and watch as the best people in the country leave. I want to do whatever I can to help bring jobs to Kyrgyzstan, and make it possible for my friends to return.

To do this I need to get the best education that I can, and AUCA is the best university in my country. It is the only university trying to meet worldwide standards for education, and providing students with the things they need to be successful in life.

loans.use: to pay for higher education

loans.name: Sultanbek

texts.en:
Sultanbek is a freshman in the International and Comparative Politics program; this is his story:

I would like to study International and Comparative Politics as I believe that the knowledge I gain here will help me to become a professional analyst in Central Asia. What I like most about ICP is that students don’t just study political science and history but also learn to think critically and find solutions to complicated political issues. I want to help Kyrgyzstan develop as it faces many big challenges in the future such as climate change and political influence from Russia and China.

One of the people who inspired me to study ICP is my uncle. After graduating this department at AUCA, he won a full scholarship to Georgetown University in Washington, D.C., specializing in Central Asian security studies. For him AUCA was the first step to success and I would like to follow his path.

I am communicative; I like to meet people from different countries and share Kyrgyz culture with them. AUCA provides opportunities to meet people from all over the world and to learn from them.

loans.use: to pay for my Bachelor's degree in ICP
